5HgPkb2QYUhxjiWpD9wu4A.text: We visited Leroy Fox this past Saturday night for the first time.  They don't accept reservations (except for big parties), so we took our chance, hoping that it wouldn't be too long of a wait.  Fortunately, despite the restaurant being packed, there was hardly a wait at all (only a couple of minutes), and there's a BIG waiting comfy area anyway.    Our first impression of the restaurant was the fantastic outdoor seating area.  It's all enclosed so you actually feel like you're not jutting out into the parking lot.  If it wasn't 50 degrees outside (the outdoor heaters still weren't doing the trick), we would have liked to have sat out there.  But then we would have had to contend with the smokers out there, too, and that would not have been fun.  Just passing through, we noticed the smoke tended to linger in that enclosed area.  Bummer.  Maybe summertime outdoor dining might not be an option either.  I really liked the interior of the restaurant, too.  It's casual, but very nice with the rustic wood.    Our second impression of the restaurant was the loudness of the place.  Wow.  We got used to it after awhile, but it definitely was crazy loud.  Sound really carries throughout the whole rectangular-shaped dining room.     Their drinks are very reasonably priced.  It's not often you see beer anymore at those prices without being "on special."  We opted for the fancy hard liquor drinks, though, which ran about $8-10 (also good).  I tried the Pamarita -- tequila, Pama, Cointreau, and sour mix.  They definitely do not skimp on the tequila!  You get your money's worth, and it tasted great, too.    For an app, we shared their "world famous" zucchini fries.  They were really big and tasty.  The fried coating on there tasted like KFC's fried chicken coating to me!  It was very peppery, just the way I like it.  I'm usually not a fan of fried chicken on the bone, but if it tastes like the coating on the zucchini fries, I might give it a try.  I saw lots of BIG plates of fried chicken go by our table.  Their portions will satisfy hungry appetites.  For my entree, I opted for the Honey Buffalo chicken sandwich.  It was sweet and spicy with blue cheese crumbles melted on top.  Very good, just like the zucchini fries.  To give my body a break from the fried app and entree, I picked a side salad as my sandwich's side.  It was only a $1 more.  They do have a wide variety of other sides, though, too, so you don't always have to have fries.    Would we go back?  Definitely.   The food was "foxing fantastic" (their phrase, not mine), the service was great, and everything was very reasonably priced.  The downsides are that it can be quite loud in the restaurant and if you want to sit outside in their awesome-looking patio, be prepared to inhale second-hand smoke.

uT8LJQvywfwNR-Np8jckTg.text: This place is incredibly loud and full of little kids.  If you aren't up for that, then don't go here.  The food is "good" not great.  I have children too, by the way and this was outta control both times I was there.

4oelIHEKurZzjCsdi-_F8Q.text: Going down fast. Hopefully the owners will rescue it soon. Abbie was our server and did a great job we always try to sit in her section. The problem is the quality of the food is declining.

OyG7kvqZQta9fAbDuCU5Ow.text: What does this fox say?  He says "There's better food than this in Charlotte".  The wife and I dropped by this much-hyped Sharon Amity eatery Sunday after church.  While Sunday after church is usually a suicide time slot, the wait was short and the staff very nice.    The dining room was packed and loud but not in an off-putting way.  The lady at the hostess stand, the waitress and even the busboy were all great, offering kind words and big smiles along with the fast service.  On an accessibility note, I will say that my wife is in a wheel chair and everything was very easy for her, no steps, a nice ramp outside and wide doorways.  The biggest turn off, aside from the food, is the limited parking situation.  We had to make a couple of laps before a spot opened up.  The food was not what we were hoping for.  Having read several glowing reviews in the local papers, we were looking forward to a good sit down restaurant that really knows how to make great fried chicken and wonderful home-style sides.  Looks like we'll have to keep looking.  We both had fried chicken, so I can't speak for any other entrees etc.  The chicken was just OK.  It was hot but a little greasy and way too dry.  I expect it was overcooked.  The highly touted brine and seasoning process didn't bring much to the party.  Could have used a little more salt and a little less cayenne pepper.  The corn muffing was OK, but not even warm enough to melt the room temperature honey butter.  The mashed potatoes were OK, the texture was a little loose and not a lot of flavor.  The mac and cheese was a huge disappointment, slightly warmer than room temperature and totally devoid of flavor.  They should have called it just Macaroni because for the life of me I couldn't find and cheese or any flavor.   Maybe the biggest disappointment in what was turning out to be a symphony of inefficacy was the so-called banana pudding.  I've seen it recommended by other reviewers and since, I am a fan of the dish, I gladly shelled out 6 bucks to give it a go.  A huge bowl of very thick flavorless pudding like glop filled the bottom of a large bowl.  there were 3 banana slices stuck into the gloppy mess and on top was a huge pile of flavorless whipped cream with exactly 3 hard vanilla wafers stuck into it.  a fourth vanilla wafer had been crumbled over the top of this disaster.  Absolutely no flavor of anything, much less banana.  Maybe the burgers and some of the other sides are better, but I won't be finding out.

bOtZ1cGVQyzus5xgXTn0dg.text: Love the atmosphere and decor of this restaurant. There is an amazing outdoor space here with 2 tv's. If you go here you must order any chicken dish. One of the best appetizers on the menu is the fried zucchini. The batter is seasoned similar to blooming onion at Outback. They also have amazing salads with options of both grilled and fried chicken.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried zucchini

lYbs9UfiLf-pvgok-fszmQ.text: This place is on-point if you are looking for good old fashioned southern cooking in a cool atmosphere.    The old Hotel Charlotte was nicely transformed into a trendy, sports bar/southern comfort type environment.  Well done.  Between the 4 of us we tried quite a few items on the menu.....We tried the fried zucchini sticks which came with a spicy dipping sauce and they were awesome.    We tried the mashed potatoes, cheesy grits, fried chicken, baked beans and chicken salad.  All were phenomenal.    I have to give a special shout out to the lovely waitress, Erica, that offered our table a free dessert.  It was a heath bar blondie....yes, you heard right.  It was smothered with whipped cream, drizzled in caramel and chocolate sauce and it was heated through.  It was divine.  Their whole dessert menu looked scrumptious so I'd go back just for that.  They sell T-shirts as well.  I'm not sure I get the point of that but some of them were pretty cute....especially the ones for females.  However, $24 or $25 for a t-shirt of a local restaurant hardly seems worth it.  Just my opinion.

frpzS9C7tEHTeyRJhDkehA.text: The food at this place is fantastic!! We got an order of the hot pretzels with queso, which was probably my favorite thing that I ate. I ordered chicken fried chicken with green bean casserole and macaroni and my husband got Nashville style chicken. Both of us loved what we ordered and ate every last bite. The cornbread was delicious too! I can't wait to go back and try something else! Highly recommend!

4JP922mIfyQlvWo4hq3j_A.text: Zucchini fries are a must try. Cool atmosphere and great beer and wine selection. Their patio is semi covered and pet friendly. I'm a regular here!

VTrSxxhvtWF4xNGTZhkw4w.text: A month or so ago, I was lucky enough to check out Leroy Fox during their soft opening. And while I've been meaning to head back much sooner, I finally got a chance to check it out again last night! Overall, I'm thinking that Leroy Fox is going to be a neighborhood staple in Cotswold!   Hubs and I rolled in on a Wednesday night, hankering for some fried chicken. What? Don't judge. It sounded delicious. The exterior of Leroy Fox features a really cool looking patio, surrounded by what looks to be a Lincoln Log/Jenga-esque wall. There are plenty of cutouts and openings to ensure plenty of air flow. When the weather turns lovely, this patio will be a hoppin'.  Speaking of hoppin', the restaurant was super busy for a Wednesday night. Considering the number of TV's and comfy booths, it's no surprise. The place itself is warm and modern, yet Southern. There are tons of local influences from Poppy's Bagel chips to the decor to the locally named items.   Because the place was perhaps abnormally busy on a Wednesday night, service was a bit harried overall. However, the food and beverage certainly made up it! Here's what I ordered...  Selwyn Avenue (cocktail): 5/5: Wow. They should just name this happy juice. It's an Arnold Palmer esque (1/2 tea, 1/2 lemonade) but with a twist of Dragonberry rum. And it's yum. I also love that it's served in a mason jar!   1/4 North Fried Chicken: 4.5/5: Super delicious, crispy fried chicken. This plate is served with a wing and a breast and both pieces were very flavorful and juicy. The breading on the bird is salted and peppered and perfect with hot sauce!   Mac 'n cheese: 4/5: This was one of my side items and I was scraping the bottom of the ramekin to get every last bite. It's creamy shells and it's delightful.   Green bean casserole: 3/5: The casserole was just fine, but nothing crazy or overly spectacular. If you love green bean casserole, you'll likely enjoy it.   Cornbread: 3/5: I fully appreciate that I received not one but two cornbread muffins with my meal. Score! This cornbread was solid, but dry. Hubs dunked his in gravy and ate it right up.   Gravy: 4/5: That being said, the gravy was tasty...and I'm not even a gravy lover!   I can absolutely envision myself coming back to Leroy Fox for another helping of that practically perfect fried chicken and Selwyn Avenue cocktail. At an affordable $17 for the two ($9 chicken and $8 cocktail), my belly was full and very happy.

HtfClBpuvlrJEURM26B-4Q.text: I made reservations for 6 via Open Table for a Saturday evening meal with friends plus their 2 year old.  The availability for online reservations is a major time saver.    Upon arrival we were seated right away; it was so nice that we didn't have to wait for them to set up the table.  Our server was fast and friendly, keeping our waters topped off and making sure we were good with drinks and food.  Of the various foods I tried during my visit, the mac and cheese was my absolute favorite.  It was creamy and delicious!  I was slightly disappointed in the size of the mac and cheese side - I was jealous of the child's portion!  The atmosphere is a good combination of sports bar and family friendly, which was convenient for our friends with kids.

7oZQmpX-LfK8aMzoM4vuKg.text: I would definitely recommend this place but if you are a foodie, you won't be "highly" impressed.  Don't fall for the "tour" as it only takes you around the restaurant. You have to be part of an official tour to see the escape routes that run under the restaurant.  The gift shop is phenomenal and you have to visit if you stop by. Overall, nice experience.

g-7AHSNa8wrOJSY8Zu6WfA.text: I really try to like Leroy Fox.  It's a neighborhood restaurant that I visit occasionally because it's so close.  The food is okay (typical bar fare) but the bartenders need some customer service work.  Their attitude is consistently lousy.  They hardly ever engage the bar patrons.  A smile and some light conversation up front in the order process would be nice.  Instead you get a drink slung at you.  ugh.......

-O4oggnnmWUFEfvJHaZQhg.text: Usually this place is outstanding but not sure if it were a blue moon tonight or what .The hostess seemed like she wasn't sure what was going on . I usually sit inside but tonight had a party of four,great weather why not sit outside. BIG BIG MISTAKE. The waitress was great her support staff was so bad even a four letter word doesn't describe it . The manager on duty would peek through the window and give a look of OMG.  There were 2 tables that had words and actually walked out . So after a hour and half we get food , guess what COLD,NASTY,POS.  I had ordered  the Brussel sprouts ad no kidding every one but 8-9 were nothing but leaves. The fries  were stone cold, Mac and cheese was Cold. How can you almost burn fried chicken ,when that is your main menu. We NEVER got a apology from mngr, poor waitress never maid eye contact and said the bill is covered. This place is usually great but when your kitchen/ manager staff screws the dog that bad . I think  my guests and I won't be coming back anytime soon. The real kicker is one of my group is working with the new Apartment communities about good places to eat in the area. I don't think you will be recommended any time soon.

4W7wEMShCgMK8Msfc0-Q2g.text: My days off are always screwy; I rarely have a chance to enjoy a Saturday lunch with friends. I'm always looking for a new spot to try, especially one that doesn't just cater to the Monday-Friday business lunch-goers. Leroy Fox is the perfect place for a mid-afternoon lunch and some signature cocktails. I'm listening to Candlebox and sipping on the Elderflower Spritzer, which is the perfect summer cool down. The Man and I shared the Zucchini Fries, which were perfectly seasoned with cayenne pepper, and generous enough for a whole meal. I ordered the BBQ Peach Salad and my date had the Grilled Chicken sandwich with a fried egg and pimento cheese. The best part of the meal was the sweet potato tots--coated with cinnamon sugar and served with a honey mustard dipping sauce to cut the sweetness, if so desired (I didn't desire).

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Zucchini Fries and the Strawberry Gin Fizz. A couple of winners.

2d_mg66ssXvEfqAo2UD-NQ.text: Great service. Believe his name was Brian. Thanks for being awesome! The winner chicken dinner lasted for our meals for 2 days. Super happy about not having to cook. :)

HbDWcpTLtFrbSIgu_UNGYg.text: This is a great little tucked away place for food.  Inside is trendy and hip and outdoor patio is awesome.  I went for a brunch on Sunday afternoon and it was a beautiful day, so the patio was the perfect option.  Our server was friendly and prompt and shared specials (including a bottomless mimosa for 12 bucks!)  I opted for the Sweet Caroline Dip sandwich.  It was delicious and not being a huge fan of sweet potato the tots were surprisingly delicious.  My friend had the black bean burger with veggies.  (Def the more healthy option.)  It was delicious and had quinoa in the patty!  Overall food is really good.  Service is good and personable.  The only part I didn't particularly enjoy was when I ordered my mimosa I was only intending to have one, but was charged for the bottomless.  But, if you are having more than two, this is the better option.  If you are in the area you should give this place a shot!

JzUyRESFtvFFOpBky4H30g.text: To start, solely for the great service, I LOVE the Leroy fox on South blvd but after two visits to this location, I feel I can leave this review. The food, for the cotswold area, is just nothing to write home about and a few dollars over priced on every menu item. 13-17 for a sandwich or burger....this is Charlotte and you can get a way better brunch or lunch for that price. The Friday/Saturday drink is $9 cocktails... wait, what!? Again, this is Charlotte and a HIGH end cocktail is typically $10. That's not a special I'm interested in. The customer service is half and half- some of the people here are clearly trying, but the younger staff members just don't get it. There was a young hostess today and acted super busy and rushed (during a no wait time) and did not even bother to say hello or kindly say she would be right with us while helping others. We were just standing at the empt hostess stand. To me, thats just a super simple customer service tactic. We shouldn't stand around for 5 minutes with no greeting while she is walking right past. I have rated every place in Charlotte I can find with great customer service an easy 5 stars. Busy or not, it's just not difficult to put on a smile and kind voice. She is very young so room for growth on that. Our waiter was a very very polite young man and was trying hard so that's where the three stars comes in. Between every table having 5+ babies and high seats at pretty much every table and no room between them and your own personal space, this restaurant location is just truly not my favorite.

xznkxq0XOorQzYREo5ln9g.text: We decided to skip Eddie's and try the competition.   Three on a Sunday afternoon.  We were seated quickly.  Service, not a strong suit.  It took a minute or two for our server to get around to us.  It wasn't crowded.  More at the bar.   Our group had the haddock sand, prohib burger and I got the chicken fried chicken. The sands came with fries or sweet potato tots. Fries are fries. The tots? Very good.  I enjoyed them more than my sister.  Sweet and salty.  More sweet but definitely worth a try.  They split sands and shared.  Haddock got rave reviews the burger not as much.  I has an entree that came with 2 sides.  They were out of my first choice potato cake so I went with mac and cheese and grits.  I'm no veg head and I swear cheese does make everything better but the selection could use some variety.  Mostly starchy choices, green beans and slaw. Anyway, I'm paranoid about ordering grits. I always suspect they were cooked early that morning and kept on life support all day. I went against instinct and won't do that again.  The mac was watery, lacked body or any distinctive cheesy flavor or appeal, noodles were well cooked but sauce disappointed.  The gravy on my chicken was bland and unimpressive.  I scraped it off to get to the highlight. The chicken was flat out good.  I did not share.  1) entree portion was very small 2) not getting much from the accompanying sides.  I did snag a few tots,that helped,  It was moist, tender and well seasoned.  I'm not big on the crunchy crispy outside trend. We didn't have a frydaddy growing up.  We did have cast iron.  Clearly chicken is well respected here and it shows.  I considered dessert, (light supper), but was disappointed at a short list that offered 2 puddings and more super sweet choices.     Service lacked.  The only person that seemed to have any kind of hustle was the young lady that brought out our food.  She also brought out most everyone else s. Servers seemed to clear tables and take orders. I hope they pool tips.   Will I return?  Probably not.  Can't see myself passing by Eddies where service is pretty tight and I feel like I get more bang for my buck and more and better choices. Will I think about that chicken again. Hell Yeah!  Best to them!

OAcs5L-YlGXVt8dAFs-TYg.text: I've now had several great dining experiences here. The only downside is that I've always had to wait 15-20 min to be seated.  Today I ordered the pimiento egg fried chicken sandwich, and it was incredible. So much flavor. My husband ordered his go-to dish of shrimp and grits, which he claims is the best he's had. The grits have a great consistency and lots of flavor, as well.   Great place for brunch, lunch, or dinner!

3VeEK2KN0lvB_GgOwVxRFg.text: Another place I have heard so much about, and it has taken me forever to check out. I made it to Leroy Fox finally! I liked the vibe immediately, Leroy Fox seems to standout among its peers on Sharon Amity. I wasn't expecting such a large space, but when you walk in, you realize, this is BIG. It has plenty of seating, bar space, and TVs. The bar has some great local beers and other fun selections.   The hosts and waiters were all very friendly and efficient.  I have not had a chance to dig too deeply into the menu. I've had a few bits of the chicken wrap, and it was so YUM! The chicken had so much flavor. I had the Grilled Buffalo Chicken Salad- again, lots of flavor and freshness.   I can't wait to go back and dive deeper into the menu!

kXaMw17PWd4E_kCH4NcYwA.text: We were hoping for much more than we received. We went with another couple for brunch. It was everyone's first time eating there. The decor is beautiful, until you realize there are tvs all around you. Rather than being a nice, quiet restaurant, it was more of a sports bar atmosphere. The tvs are a distraction and do not belong is a restaurant this nice.   The waitress came to take our order on a Sunday for brunch, wearing very short shorts. Now, it really seemed like a sports bar. We were expecting a much nicer atmosphere for some reason.   Shortly after we ordered, the waitress came back to tell us that they were out of breakfast casserole, which both my husband and I ordered. We then re-ordered the Which Came First?. Our food was delivered by some random person, who basically plopped it on the table without saying a word. It was very rude!  My friends ordered three entrees, one to share and their own. One of the entrees came out wrong. After telling the waitress that it was the wrong piece of chicken,  she argued telling us that a chicken drumstick was  chicken wing. What kind of waitress argues with the customers knowing it is their first time at the restaurant and secondly, it was a drumstick instead of a wing? Three of us had to say to her that it is not a wing so she would take it back and get a wing. So ridiculous!    It was NOT surprising when she argued, because she kept forgetting everything we asked for. I ordered lemon with my water, and then had to as two more times before getting it. I also ordered a mimosa, only $3, and I think she forgot that for a while too. We asked for sauce when we realized the food was dry, and had to ask at least one more time before getting it.  Oh, and the mimosa was mostly champagne, but that isn't really a compliant, just a comment.  Our experience was not good to say the least. The only good thing was that another waitress or manager, not sure because she never said, came to our table to fill the water glasses and asked how everything was. So, she got an ear full. She eventually came back and gave us our checks that were 50% off. Honestly, that is the only thing that was good about our experience. We appreciated her effort very much. All in all, I believe the waitress caused our entire meal to go downhill.  We will give it one more try for dinner, just because the chicken on the Which came first was actually good.

KJhTn3M53qFxGcxh2K3_fw.text: Y'all, I'm SO excited to go back here and secure my rating up to 5 stars. First of all, the outdoor appearance of this place is gorgeous (but frankly it SCREAMS infill, it's nothing like the rest of the shops in that strip mall. Thank goodness that it's located on the end and not in the middle). There's a ton of faded gray-ish wood surrounding an amazing patio with tons of tables and TVs to check out whatever game is on. The inside is nice and open, we were sat quickly. They have a pretty good beer list - The Lady and I both started with a beer. I had been craving wings for a while, so I ordered their wings (6 for $8) with honey buffalo sauce which was fantastic. Add a side of cajun fries, and you have a great meal right there. The Lady ordered the BBQ Chicken Chopped Peach salad and it was gone before I even had the chance to ask her how it was. So...I would say that she enjoyed it.  Put all this together in a family friendly atmosphere that's definitely wallet friendly as well, and you have a stellar weeknight dinner location! I will be back!

IVfmYl1dFoSjLHzKJIvQuQ.text: Today I had brunch. Their take on biscuits and gravy.  It was pretty good. Better than average but like the fried chicken here much better.  Great atmosphere.

ChVqVCX9r8P0dwTyygTbkA.text: Cool micro brewery/ restaurant. Food was tasty and they had lots of drink to choose from. The place was pretty loud but the food was good and priced right. I will return the next time I'm in Charlotte area.

a7fVu8mdwsbRFHn3_Yak4w.text: Everything about this place is decent but for me what really made this place special was the bartender Shanna.  Her approach to customer service is out of this world exceptional.  Wow.  Honestly,  it would be worth going here just for her service.  I feel like she should be running the place rather than bartending there but that's just me....

fd1CBmHlBxZGyaL5i4_xoQ.text: Great for groups!  My friends and I were all very pleased with the entire experience at Leroy Fox. The service was excellent and yummy food! I'll be back very soon!

_uw-M1gtdIypIoNS3RgVKA.text: I just stopped by for a drink and an appetizer. The bartender suggested a glass of wine and there pimento dip. The pimento dip was delicious but it came out cold. I assumed that pimento dip would be hot because I have had it hot every place that I went. That was completely my fault. I just asked the young lady to warm it up and she did promptly. It was awesome. It came with pita chips that were served warm...

ZUR7h5yvXJjgFrhfKIlAIg.text: I love the look of the place, I went in on a Saturday afternoon and was lucky enough to find it not at all packed. Usually I stay away from restaurants on weekends for that reason. We were seated immediately and given menus to look over.  I already knew I wanted to try their burger and my date was anxious to give the chicken a shot.  I ordered a Prohibited burger. I absolutely loved the bacon marmalade...a great way to enjoy the flavor of bacon without having to gnaw on too crispy or too big pieces of bacon that can plague other bacon cheeseburgers.  I wish there was more cheese on my burger, but I'm a cheesehead so perhaps I'm bias and someone else would not mind. Whenever I stop in again I'll ask for double the cheese!  My date (daughter) was a bit underwhelmed with her chicken, she found it a bit bland. She is young, so she doesn't have the most developed taste yet- I will say she absolutely loves meat, I've rarely ever heard her complain about fried chicken.  We both gobbled up the macaroni and cheese and would have rather gotten more of that than fries.  I will certainly return to Leroy Fox, most likely when it is warmer so I can sit in the patio area. More cheeseburgers and mac please!

U6uU4iETqKYWDnWhogQ-Aw.text: Leroy Fox is great at everything except for the one thing it's supposed to be known for. I've been several times and it has a great atmosphere, a fantastic bar and pretty good prices. The Cajun wings are awesome and perfectly seasoned. I want to like the fried chicken-- I really do but every time I go it's bland despite having a special blend of spices and over cooked. It seems like the recipe tries really hard to be authentic southern fried chicken but just misses the mark. For the atmosphere and because there are  some quality items on the menu I'd still give Leroy Fox a try.

k5M3YpRigHn3VqqnDpSbDA.text: My boyfriend and I randomly went here one night for desserts.We ordered a cheesecake and a blondie brownie.My boyfriend stated his cheesecake was good.I loved my blondie brownie with toffee chips and icecream.I will definitely be back to try an entree next time.  The setting is nice and spacious.There were several guests present for which seemed to be a double date,male friends catching up,and solo bar drinkers.Therefore,I would think this  restaurant could be visited for different occasions.  The only con is when I arrived there was no one at the front.Eventually someone came after three minutes and provided me with a menu upon request,but disappeared again.I had to pass the hostess booth to go find her to ask to be seated.

avDhW14H5NOR0KMvjvfXHQ.text: Nice little gem off of Sharon Amity.  The decor is nice and the waitstaff perky and attentive.  The chicken was really very yummy, as I ate every morsel.  For those who like green bean casserole theirs was very good, and this comes from someone who isn't really a fan. Zucchini fries were yum. The drinks good tasting..but weak so dont expect even a mini buzz.  My main disappointment was with the shimp and grits. The shrimp were just steamed and put on top of the grits and not really sauteed. Plain shrimp on top of the gravy was not that tasty.  I picked through and left most of the dish in the bowl. Otherwise great visit.

pqMRHgAFNZCqcVdPLtGigA.text: I was thrilled to walk in to meet my best friend for drinks, sadly the night took a ugly turn. The people of Charlotte have raves about the zucchini fries and that the amazing drinks by Kayla which was simply divine. We sat down in Holly's and the trainees section and was met with sub-par service we were waiting for over a hour for food. Meagan the GM came out to explain that they were busy tonight. My response in my head was yeah it's Friday if you weren't busy I probably would not be here. The problem wasn't only that the food was behind but we didn't feel wanted by all staff as the LGBTQ and Black communities. All money is green and spends the same as like it. Next time we hope to seat with Sarah she was the table across from us she was amazing!!!!!!

GyTa5dVzyD7JaEg2satIrg.text: The zucchini fries here are more like cayenne logs, so spicy they're inedible. It doesn't say spicy on the menu.  Mine weren't cooked all the way through - not even fork tender.  Needless to say, I'm a little picky...  Chicken wrap was very good!  Bacon was crispy and they had no problem leaving the cheese off for me.  French Fries were thin cut and cooked perfectly but a little heavily salted.    The white negroni has too much vermouth for me.  Sassy martini is a little bitter even with the pear.  Overall not bad and I look forward to coming back to try more on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken wrap - Yum!
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Zucchini fries - watch out, they&#39;re spicy!

QK5L7BUyA_H2TcD82t2_bA.text: I don't know why this place only has 3 1/2 stars.  The parking is terrible. That's my only negative. Service is great. The wait staff are quick, knowledgeable, and friendly.  The menu is big, but the food is familiar. Not until it is sitting in front of you will you see the they have somehow taken familiar food and turned it into new, exciting, and DELICIOUS!!  Sweet potatoe fries? Fried zucchini?! You really can't go wrong with anything you order here.  Prices are great too.

aSucDHIa5uqQQOogCVXokA.text: A sandwich containing fried chicken, egg, bacon, tomato and a rich original sauce slathered on it is a difficult item for me. Big, calorie-laden, and messy.   Yet I find myself ordering it, enjoying it, and still staying awake for the duration. And I keep ordering it.  Leroy Fox's green tomatoes - not the fried ones - are an item over which someone just admitted to fantasizing. Not me, though.  Sarah is a nice server. Brandon is a charismatic manager. Cailin is Top Eight, and they also have a private room called the Fox Den that can have up to 18 or 20 people, perhaps uncomfortably.  The Shrimp Cobb salad is notable and I recommend the recommended dressing on the side.   Their chicken sandwiches can be grilled or fried, and both methods are pleasing.

vCzEEVdkQKev5ufFTzz1sg.text: The food is good, the prices are reasonable for this part of town.  The place is incredibly noisy and you have to shout to be heard.  The service is friendly but often absent, water and ice tea runneth dry.  Servers kept trying to bring us the wrong food (other table's food).

V8D7jtS_ZYr_0uY-6t8IPw.text: Strikes two and three, sorry Leroy Fox, but you are out - forever.  The 3 steps to a successful business model that every business should follow if they want to slither down the spiraling drain of restaurant mediocrity like Leroy Fox:  1. Take group order (4:00pm). So far, so good, nothing too crazy yet.    2. Notify customer that their group order has been canceled (4:45pm) without justification other than "we are just too busy." But it's a Tuesday...and you were not too busy at 4pm to take my order, so what changed?  3. Loss of sales revenue $200-$250 from tonight's order, and into perpetuity.  Every night during quarter-end, our team (approximately 15 people) orders in dinner and we rotate the restaurant selection. Tonight's selection of Leroy Fox was from our newest team member (let's call him "Drew") and he was pumped about the selection since he is new to the Charlotte area and has never been. Not only will we never be ordering from Leroy Fox again as a team, ever, but this dinner decision made by the new guy "Drew" will be forever reflected poorly in his permanent performance record.  The question I ask myself after this is - I wonder if Leroy Fox management would agree with this decision to not compete the order?  What about strike one someone asked? Aren't there usually 3 strikes in baseball? See Evan T's Leroy Fox review from March 28, 2016. I guess he was wrong about only using Leroy Fox as a carry out restaurant.  All names, except Leroy Fox, have been changed to protect the innocent.

U39LD3W344d7cSnOQuleng.text: Leroy Fox is famous for Southern Fried Chicken so of course it was a dinner stop in Charlotte.   There are TVs on all the walls that give a sports bar vibe which I didn't mind since the SF vs KC World Series was on!   Unfortunately most of the deep fried appetizers tasted like typical sports bar food although the fried pretzels with 3 dippings were pretty good.   I wasn't sure how big the fried chicken pieces would be so i ordered a "Northern" which includes a leg, thigh and breast. What I got was a tiny wing and a small back. Hardly any meat. The chicken was ok but I was disappointed in the meal and the waitress said I must've got someone else's order. I guess I should've said something when I got the dish but couldn't tell if it was a back or breast until I started it. Plus another person in our party received the same non-Northern.  The crispiness of chicken was good but overall I wasn't impressed with the size of the pieces. Does that 2" wing qualify as a "piece"?  I liked the beer selection though as they had a few local brews and they had NoDa Jam Session pale ale which was yum!

yIlx2o0MZiRQsXes6ZYf3Q.text: I was craving fried chicken, but it's not something I normally eat so after living in Charlotte for three years I had no clue where to go. I've heard of Prices and South 21 from others, but neither are open on Sunday's so I turned to trusty Google and found 'The 15 Best Places for a Fried Chicken in Charlotte' on Foursquare. Leroy Fox was listed as number 4 and since it was closest to my location I decided to give them a try.   We called and ordered one winner winner chicken dinner with mac & cheese and sweet potato tots - and were asked if we wanted sweet or regular tea. The menu doesn't state this selection includes a gallon of tea so the was an awesome addition to our meal. Got it all home and five of us loaded up plates and stuffed our faces in silence. Needless to say, the chicken (and everything else) was fantastic!!! Sweet potatoes tots were served with awesome (would imagine made in-house) honey mustard that we pretty much dipped everything in and couldn't get enough of. Aside from the four cornbread muffins there was about 1.5 servings when we were done.   I look forward to going back and dinning in here. The atmosphere seemed great and I saw many amazing dishes on their menu I plan on trying.

TSy281Bn8X0qe9GsTLSfFQ.text: Paul"s Y Rating: 3.5 Stars Rounded up to 4  Came in because I had such a great time at a Yelp Elite Event earlier this year, and I was in the area, and said, WHY NOT?   I am glad I did. I have not tried their "world famous" fried chicken so this was on my agenda. (Side note: just what the F#%+@$&k does "world famous" really mean? Like they know about this place in Zimbabwe? Just ssyin.....Hummmmmm)  Sorry for my digression.....back to the review. Could have gone straight bare fried chicken boob plate.....BUT I asked my (really cute by the way) waitress Kayla about their fried chicken sandwiches and she said that HER preference was the Piemento and Egg fried chicken sandwich. So I said let's do it!   Uhhh, ahem, No, I didn't mean "do it" (with the really cute waitress)......Crap maybe I did in a Freudian way.....Uggggg. Bad impure thoughts. Bad Paul Bad Paul! Lol....  More digression....feelin frisky today.....Duh.......Back to the fricken chicken!  So this sandwich comes out with supposed "Cajun" Fries and looks and smells incredible! See my pic.  So......  The Good - The chicken! To me its better than Price's. Half the bacon was very crispy the other half probably lost that edge under the hot bun. It's ok. The egg! Excellent addition to this sandwich!  The Ok How I Wish It Was better - The bun, described as Brioche. Hum.....this was NOT a Brioche bun. Sorry. It didn't have that requisite butteriness that a True BRIOCHE bun has. IF this sandwich had the real Brioche bun this could be a Top 10 in Charlotte sandwich.   The Meh - The fries. Very AVERAGE! Guys at Leroy Fox you descibe them as CAJUN FRIES. There wasn't one molecule of any Cajun Seasoning on these relatively limp fries! Come on how hard is it to put a simple dusting of Zatarans or other CAJUN spice on the fries? And you need to CRISP THEM UP!  The Ambience was good, felt more like a Sports Bar than classic restaurant with all the TVs on the sport channels. And the aforementioned waitress.....ah to be about 25 years younger......  Overall I can see why the close-by locals really love this place. Sure I'll be back

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Piemento and Egg Fried Chicken Sandwich

qPrz8HuO44LAPSOhf90T5w.text: Had a take out a few times lately, and food was good, like that they put the chicken in a separate container from the salad.  The downside it the concept of take out doesn't seem to be friendly enough, you have to fight your way through the bar crowd to the back of the place and hope to get someone's attention to find your food.  Wish they could put it up front and let the hostess finish the transaction or something.

4_ThxoRdYIS8NFZwUcOGDg.text: The patio area was busy but inside was slow.  The atmosphere is dark and dreary, gloomy.... but the food was ok.  Many better places to eat in Charlotte that make you feel welcome, too.

AKhStckz7waoMWcuS_4hlQ.text: You have to get the fried pickles when you eat here.  The fired chicken is very good, the atmosphere overall is a little loud but it is a great restaurant to put in your rotation.

PkJwFlPXN_tMPsRbhANiAg.text: The zucchini fries were excellent which was good because Our entrees were served icy cold, they got my order wrong, and the risotto was crunchy.

ZUKn03b53ZzPomhL7W_sDw.text: I have been to Leroy Foxes a couple times as it is really close by. Each time I have had very good food. I would say the sides are probably my favorite. The Zucchini fries, Mac and cheese, vegetable medley, it is all very good. On one occasion I became fixated on the pretzel brownie, I had to try it. It was worth every bite! A fun place to go with friends for some True southern food and drinks!

fjxO0-qNvvplyUPqdoFehA.text: Dinner time hit, and due to us being out of towers, I headed to Yelp to find a place to grab a bite to eat.  We were not left wanting after an amazing dinner here.  Great cocktails, and amazing food left us more than satisfied.  I had the catfish and loved it!  The next time in town, you will see my smiling face right back in another booth here, and I expect my mason jar filled with a cocktail to be waiting.

JUbKDXfu9ZIsyQI71MWS1Q.text: I really like this place.  The food is nothing spectacular (a lot of southern fried food) but the atmosphere, drinks and service are all great. My most recent visit was last evening for a birthday party.  We had a private room and everything was perfect.  Service was spot on and the room was perfect.

-Ugxf-UTRBkhRRr1q_vy2A.text: It was really delicious. The sweet potato tater tots are out of this world. Great selection of yummy drinks too. Wonderful service. We will certainly be back.

8YDBR7Mn3CHt2_pkq5hoZQ.text: I love everything about Leroy Fox, including the fact that it's less than a mile from my house. It's a place that both my fiance and I can agree on. I like the crowd, the service is friendly, there are both healthy and not-so-healthy options, and it's a great place to bring out of town guests because it has a lot of Charlotte charm. It's a wonderful place for fried chicken, mac and cheese, or a yummy salad. Leroy Fox has my vote!

IjLaMDlKjH2ziKD5O_Nb_Q.text: Just a quick review which I'll redo once we get a chance to go back and actually eat there. We went in yesterday (Sunday) around 1:30 and it was SO LOUD that we sat for a minute and then had to leave. The courtyard out front looked great and the noise level was perfect, but now I know why it was full. We'll be back.

o-eyLFXHB6Nv8PoA8G_2iQ.text: What a cool spot!  The interior was super trendy.  When I arrived I found out Tuesday nights are half-off wines by the glass and bottle.  CHA CHING!  The zucchini fries were great...that Boom Boom sauce definitely had a kick.  I thought the shrimp cocktail was also cool and different since it was grilled and not cold.  More my style.  I ordered the grilled chicken entree.  It was ok, nothing like my husbands fried buffalo chicken sandwich.  I should have gone that route.  Mac & Cheese was a bit cold but the green bean casserole was phenomenal.  For dessert we ordered the bread pudding and HOLY MOLY it was yumm!  We will be back!

0Bmkq7XtYS9bCOjA-7Ba2A.text: Had lunch today around 2 pm. Plenty of parking available. Finally broke the code. Had my first Sweet Caroline chicken sandwich-delicious my new favorite. My wife had the fried chicken salad-food is always very good. Also very good cocktails at a reasonable price. Great job all the way around.

ZGbPob4ns6YFLKi4ButQLA.text: I'm giving this restaurant a 3 star due to service (not food). I have been here on several occasions and had excellent food ESPECIALLY the mashed potatoes & Mac but the service was horrible! The waitresses aren't very concerned about their customers and take forever to do refills or check on you. Even though I've been unsatisfied with the service I would still recommend it, it's a cute little restaurant and has a relaxing atmosphere.

mIC38qpHZqbHHddwTW535Q.text: Had dinner here with my wife for the second time and we enjoyed it once again. The steak nachos are really good. We also ordered the chicken fried chicken which was also very good. The service was also excellent. There was one negative unfortunately, we  ordered the pot roast as well and the vegetables had a really bad taste to them. The beef was good but the vegetables tasted like cigarettes. We couldn't figure out why that was, and it was very powerfully to us. We both do not smoke so it really was bad for us. I still give this restaurant a great review because it has been awesome other that the bad tasting vegetables.

hMqoS2Jrnq6r_bVBJLGGdQ.text: The fried chicken and zucchini fries were AWESOME!! My husband had a burger with Mac and cheese and loved it. It was really busy just after we were seated so the service wasn't a 10 but our waiter was very nice. We will come here again when we're visiting Charlotte.

Ovob7gyhLfJJwGjm7w_Mtg.text: As a charlotte native, I have seen the few restaurants that have occupied this location evolve and either succeed, or close. Leroy Fox is a place that I have eaten at now four times, including today, and each time... The wait for food gets worse and worse. The quality of the food has been delicious, but the wait is ridiculous, and the taste of food does not make up for waiting over 40 minutes at lunch for a sandwich and salad. Keep in mind, the restaurant is barely full... Highly disappointed in a restaurant with a prime location.

JHbW408JJk829mQaMn4qeg.text: I like the srimp with sweet sauce the portion is some kind small the zucchini. Fries is too spice  not mild.i will be back again

0EmyQAISGZ2oKiQKwFVkkA.text: Fantastic! First time here was on a Sunday afternoon and by 12:30 the place was packed and we were put on a 30 min wait which we were actually prepared for. Was the wait worth it? Absolutely! The chicken tender app was lightly breaded and served with delicious homemade ranch and honey mustard dressings. My wife had a chicken salad which was large portioned and came with plenty of chicken and of course she requested the homemade ranch dressing again! I had a mimosa (pretty much everyone in the restaurant had one) and the shrimp po'boy with fries. The shrimp was decent sized, cooked to perfection, and came with a delicious sauce that at first didn't look like there was enough of but ended up being plenty once I began to eat it. The restaurant itself is clean, has excellent decor and atmosphere, prompt service, and is great for families, brunch dates, or singles/couples. Leroy Fox is a prime example of what makes a small, locally owned restaurant successful.

NPXPafmohohT1JH8Dq2FRg.text: Had the Philly Cheesesteak. It was excellent and so was the service.  Nice atmosphere and large menu to choose from.

ckbMfYlvAj-27BmIO7xPkg.text: This place is fried chicken central. Chicken on chicken on chicken. Get the zucchini fries! Also, be aware that its pretty loud. Since it was available they sat us in the back room but its typically for reserved parties. If you wanna go all out, there is a dish literally called "winner winner chicken dinner." Something to think about

HSEKbAzpGHlJRkcuGIzkZg.text: My husband and I decided to come in for a couple of drinks and some zuccini fries and to sit outside on their patio because it was a gorgeous day.  So, we walk in and sit down and we wait, and wait, and wait and then wait some more while two different servers were checking on all other tables and never once made eye contact with us or acknowledged us in any sort of way....seriously, they were completely ignoring us.  So we decided to leave but on our way out we were going to stop and tell the hostess about our experience, but of course, there was no one there.

DxgR1DHYOOIVivnA7Qpgag.text: Decent food, awesome beer collection.  Bathroom was clean and nice.  Waitress was super friendly.  It seems like that +45 white drunk yuppie crowd likes to hang out there, too. I got a catfish BLT and it was very tasty.  Got beers from Olde Mecklenburg Brewery, NoDa Brewery, and Sugar Creek Brewing.  I love a place that has lots of local beers.

V6dyKjVRqaJ44T5JOdKVfA.text: My rating is based on the entire restaurant experience.  We've ate here before, but this time for our first brunch here, we made reservations via Yelp's Make a Reservation feature through Open Table ONE Hour in advance. We showed up on time and the Hostesses "clarified" that we should have called and made it over the phone instead because it takes a few hours for the their system to even process. If this is this restaurant's process, Leroy Fox (via Open Table) should not have allowed guests to book reservations near their desired meal time. Now we had to wait an EXTRA 20-30 minutes to be sat.  Completely disappointed in your "reservation process", Leroy Fox - Why even offer this Open Table online reservation to your guests to begin with if you are suggesting them to call Instead?  Food is good, but not memorable.

V0vQ4tVOs3B3nj48evSszA.text: The experience was excellent. Had my bday dinner there and I swear everyone enjoyed their food

YkooEbuqT7zhttuckiVtOg.text: BBQ Chicken w/Peaches salad - the chicken was like Tyson's that you get out of the bag, throw it in a sandwich baggy, & coat w/bbq sauce.  Needed a few more peaches.  Zucchini sticks weren't greasy & were served piping hot.  Service left a little something to be desired - our server never seemed to be around & someone else delivered our order.  Overall a nice take on standard pub fare

QKDonr1Op2OH_c5fRrke5w.text: We reserved a private room and from the minute we walked in everyone seemed eager to help and get all of us settled in. The male waiter took our drink orders and followed  with out dinner orders. I had the chicken fried chicken w the cajun fries and the seasonal vegetables. The food looked and tasted fresh. It was very tasty!  Hubby ordered the chicken sandwich came w fries and a chicken sandwich dip. It was spicy and tasty. We both cleaned our plates. Then I looked over and noticed everyone else had clean plates also. Our server checked on all of us often but not enough to annoy. Overall the food the service and location were great. Bathrooms were clean.

5XlypIm2PLPoVLJqX4iFYA.text: Food is good.  But twice now the OWNER has been so rude I have sworn never to come back.  Can't reward that when there are so many places that WANT your business.

wBO7RWj_jVdvuZHRhIXaRQ.text: Leroy Fox has a pretty sweet setup, the atmosphere is like a sports bar but a little more fancy. Reserved a table and they had it ready when we arrived. They are known for their fried chicken but I was feeling a sandwich that night (Sweet Caroline Dip) very good but a little too much bread. They've got a wide variety of menu items and a few unique ones such as the zucchini fries, they were really tasty, I'd recommend them. Service was good but they weren't super crowded for a Sunday night. I'd probably go back and try the fried chicken.

X0caOeBh2kDdJ5FTPEXlng.text: We ate lunch at Leroy Fox and I went in with high hopes and recommendations dancing in my head.  It was a slow day (granted it was a Monday), but there were some other patrons in the dining room.  Service was great - not over attentive, but there with a refill whenever needed.  I love love love the feel of the restaurant and the decor was perfect.  The food was average.  We had an order of the fried zucchini and it came out thick and hot, with a  plentiful three sauces.  The house specialty Boom Boom sauce was spicy and tangy and delicious.  The second was the staple, Ranch, always a favorite and the third was a spicy remoulade that kicked your mouth into high gear.    I was so excited about the Boom Boom sauce, I ordered the Sweet Carolina Dip with a side of mac and cheese.  The mac & cheese was beautiful, but lacked in flavor.  Maybe if there was some Boom Boom sauce on it . . .  The sandwich was good, large and fun to dip, except my chicken pieces kept falling into the chicken au jus and I didn't really taste any Boom Boom sauce.  A friend got the Shrimp Cobb Wrap.  I was told the shrimp were bland, but I didn't have the option to taste.    I'd love to go back for cocktails and to enjoy the atmosphere.  They have great nightly specials.  I'd also like to try their brunch!  (Sat & Sun, but probably moving to only Sun).

EpXDSTUiYlYYGuoUSVUAtw.text: Good place to stop for a bite, however I have occasionally noticed some service issues. It does seem that they are trying to correct said issues. Generally, the food is tasty. The highlight would be the fried zucchini and custom drinks. The chicken wings are a good choice as well. A variety of food and beverage choices...

DX83F5CnqLqe3zbxnUBeuQ.text: Food is great. Just found out today that they are not doing bottomless mimosas anymore. Even though they open at 10am they cannot start serving mimosas till 12 and they are now $3 each. :( not their fault about the time because of the state laws but will personally not be back for brunch because of the mimosa deal :/

iRgovAOnXfVFAFrEAKh5uw.text: Fried chicken to die for. Kayla waited on us which was just a treat she's absolutely amazing

6rQC3a1_tgKSHBoEGg8SJw.text: Slow service. Slow seating. Food is very average. Much better options. Such as Eddies Place, Duckwoths, Kickstand etc.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. How do you burn and char a buffalo wing? Lame.

_g5cHkf-F243Ew1D_ANdTw.text: I live right up the street so I'm there a lot with that being said this place has amazing food  and drinks for a great price! The atmosphere is laid back and relax that have live music  some nights and there open pretty late every night. Definitely worth checking out!

rs0sqRR7sGUU99eJd0e4MA.text: Just ok. I read reviews and decided to stop by since I was at a nearby doctors office and was excited to try it but did not really enjoy it. My fiance ordered shrimp and grits and was unimpressed, we both LOVE shrimp and grits but these were bland and floating in "gravy" that was nothing more than grease. I ordered the grilled shrimp wrap and it was just ok. The fried zucchini that was highly recommended was the highlight of our lunch though. It was really really good.

rSz-lMQhR5kAGsJ12DmfBg.text: I have been to Leroy Fox a few times now and have not been disappointed.  The food is awesome - on ladies night (Tuesday nights) they have awesome drink specials and the most delicious vegetarian nachos... I wish they were available all the time!  Unfortunately, the only have steak nachos on their regular menu :( I also have tried the Southwestern Salad, which is good but definitely needs to come with avocado!! Overall, a cool spot to eat and hang out and I'll definitely be going back soon!

qLbzy9oy9KQmPPXAtljtfA.text: Very cute place with a nice patio and a great menu with a gourmet Southern flair.  I've been here for a Yelp event where we sampled some of their breakfast bites to tempt us back for brunch (which I hope to enjoy come Spring) and for lunch with a dear friend.  I know it sounds crazy but I tried the chicken tenders and they were very tasty!  The batter was perfectly crunchy and not too overwhelming.  I will say that I would like to give this another chance come warmer weather to really enjoy the True vibe!

8UwgNAcJb9mVz15HvWm6mw.text: The food is always top notch, favorites are the sweet tater tots and the pretzel bite appetizer.

81SB7sGRGwJ0dm9BvHDgig.text: Really good fried chicken, and the Pink Lemonade cocktails are out of this world.

F88y0U6sk0EqKLXSznQuFQ.text: Leroy Fox was a pretty awesome place. Stopped in with my boyfriend last night for beers and I was an instant fan. The atmosphere was cool, hip and laid back. Plenty of space at the bar (even though they were packed for a baby shower) and Ryan took great care of us. He even sold us on the Pimento Cheese and warm pita bread appetizer... and I'm not even sold on Pimento Cheese yet, but it was very good. Local craft beer on tap (I had NoDa Brewing's Jam Session and my babe had Birdsong's Higher Ground IPA) which I love and just relaxing conversation. I will definitely be back for a full meal next time!

ujk5gYJhM05KklwnF8EJsw.text: I ordered my food to go, took it back to my office.  When I begin eating I noticed the chicken wasn't done, so I decided to just eat the macaroni and cheese.  I started eating and noticed it was plastic cooked into my macaroni.  I then called to speak to a manager I spoke to Jamie.  He said he would call me back the next day to refund my money for my horrible lunch.  That was over 3 weeks ago I haven't heard from him yet.

TmMCFG_7RzuplWDmF6OUAw.text: Nice service. Very prompt, appropriately attentive. Cold beer, decent cocktails. But the food... oh man.  On occasion I take my youngest children to CiCis pizza. If you've been there, you know how awful and bland the pasta is. This mac and cheese uses the same exact pasta as CiCis pizza. And the "cheese" is white flour paste. Flavorless and blah. The chicken sandwich was hot, which is a plus, but equally as bland.  For 15 bucks I'd expect just a little more. Flavor and effort.  Wife got the Cajun fries which were just OK.  If you're looking for a decent watering hole, its a good option. I'm a food lover though.  So for me, it's two stars only. If it were a bar only, it would be a decent 4 star option.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States

azxZuowNVfxgSkbawzrCDA.text: The food is great - highly recommend the Brussels! The servers/bartenders/hostesses are awful. I don't think they understand they work in the service industry. Just order togo And hope they don't mess it up because everyone who works in this place is miserable.

jzOn6_3KaEWnbwMqN9N1kA.text: Solid, but not exciting. Fried chicken and sides are best.

THJZ1PWvBj9Ro1c6at2Iug.text: Zucchini fries are so ridiculously good. Service is fantastic. The beet salad might sound weird but it's very very good. I am a regular here and will return often.

SryWzJcLcC-pBEA9JiLSyw.text: We got appetizers today at Leroy fox. Amazing!!!! We didn't have to wait long for our chicken Lizzie's, pretzels Ana d zucchini  fries which were all delicious. I especially like spicy food so I love the spicy sauce that came with the zucchini fries. I loved them so much I ate them with the chicken Lizzie's (tenders). Great atmosphere and i enjoyed my time here with my friends,m. We will be back.

MLSujbOesBpIXJO7XhNV4A.text: We usually come here on Sunday's for brunch. I love the make your own omelette. I think I've had just about everything on the breakfast menu. The chicken croissant is really good..My boyfriend was unable to finish it. The one thing I wish they had on the menu would hash browns...

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sunday Brunch Create your own omelette..with hash browns (cheese) and cheese grits.

j6jiz6qn8zi9W29R-HJlGA.text: My husband had the braised chicken and biscuits which is like chicken stew served over biscuits. He liked it. I had the chicken tender salad at the bottom of the menu. It was good. Fresh variety of greens but was lacking in qty of chicken tenders. The dressing is of the spicy mustard variety not the sticky sweet honey mustard, which I enjoyed. 2 dirty martinis and great bar service made for an enjoyable dinner. We enjoyed the sports and music videos on the TVs at the bar. Pretty consistent in food and service each time we have been here. Btw, Our first valentine's date night was here when it was Hotel Charlotte.

UC6XAvzvNmSC4HPtFtq0Rw.text: I came here a couple of days ago with some girlfriends from work, and was absolutely blown away by the Pimento, Bacon and Onion Straw Burger that was being offered as a lunch special that day! For just $12 I got a WHOPPING burger cooked to perfection and loaded up with all the fixin's. Now I've had quite a few Pimento Cheeseburgers in my life, (having attended school in the South) but I can honestly say this was one of the best I've had in a very, very long time. Deciding to go real light and healthy, I also ordered the Mac and Cheese as my side. This too, was also delicious and had I not been there with about 8 of my coworkers I probably would have licked the bowl dry...seriously, you NEED to try the Mac and Cheese. Overall, very happy with my experience here and will definitely be back to check out their bar area and brunch specials as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States

akBv5dd-ivLx5QwaEwfPYQ.text: We have been coming here for a long time, and really I can't fault the quality of the food from our latest experience tonight. This is typically a "go to" standard for us, however, it's worth my time to leave this review as the service tonight was just horrible. I cannot tell whether the trouble was in the kitchen, with our waitress, or even with sub-par management tonight. Whatever the reason, we'll think twice about dining again.  We brought some out of town friends here, and left a bit embarrassed about how long and frustrating our experience was. I could understand if the restaurant was overwhelmed or seemed understaffed, but the dining room was (at best) 2/3 full and there seemed to be plenty of staff roaming the floor. Here's a fair description of our dinner:  - Drinks were never refilled (and I would have purchased another cocktail) - Our food took at least 40 minutes to arrive to our table - Our waitress never stopped back by the table to check on us (hence the empty water and tea glasses), until she brought the bill. - I noticed several staff hanging out in a private dining room near the front of the restaurant as we left. Maybe the reason we never saw our waitress. - One of our guests' order came out wrong, but because our waitress was nowhere to be found, we couldn't ask to let them know.  I assure you that we're not fussy customers and we rarely leave this aggravated. However, tonight's experience is worth the review. I hope management is reading and taking note.

tTf0juJTwczoWcgldkPFtQ.text: Went first to my "go to" over at Eddie's Place, waited for way too long while three servers stood behind the bar and watched me waiting for service while. talking amongst themselves.... So glad I walked across the way and finally gave this place a chance. I sat at the bar and Kayla took great care of me. Had the country fried chicken with green bean casserole and mac and cheese. Every bit of the food was delicious, but I was most impressed with the service I received.  Sit at the bar and ask for Kayla. She made me feel welcome and I really appreciated it

rPcq7CmSJrGyFgRtZ1fKWQ.text: A bit dark, like a pub atmosphere. Food was good. Service was good. The only thing that really stood out to me was the sweet potato tots. They were something to write home about. Service was friendly and it was a great place to meet a friend for conversation.

m8EmXCN7ysbAg5ZkAXNmXQ.text: Awesome atmosphere! A bit smaller breakfast portions and not so pretty plating, but the food is delicious!   Best tip about this place: there is an omelette bar & call ahead on the weekends

aA01N7NplGZDzvWGtOXK3Q.text: I have to admit I was quite disappointed in my expect today! I arrived with two friends around 11:20am for brunch. We were greeted by the hostess and sat at a half booth table which was WAY to close to the two tables next to us. Basically like a family style table because the strangers next to us were so close we could hardly carry out own conversation on. Also it's extremely uncomfortable to have to stick your butt in someone face to have to sit down!!!   Once we sat down we literally read the whole menu, picked what we wanted to eat and had a decently long conversation before we started to wonder where our server was because we hadn't been greeted. We started to look around and saw around 5 servers standing in a corner, "waiting for the rush". Still no one greeting our table. We saw several people walk by and finally a young lady with brown hair came up to our table. Same girl I saw walk by our table 2 or 3 times without even a "I'll be right with you." It wasn't busy in the restaurant yet either. We ordered waters and told her we would order cocktails at noon (NC laws don't allow alcohol on Sunday's until 12). We ordered an app and our entrees.   Again we found ourselves looking around wondering where our appetizer was when we noticed a table next to us had been sat down after us and had an appetizer already. After what felt like forever we received the one good thing from our experience, Fried Green Tomatoes! These tomatoes have pimento cheese under them and were absolutely delicious which is why I am giving this experience 2 stars.   Then we wait for our entrees which arrived with on egg missing on one of my friends plates and after about half way through our entree we noticed that we didn't have the chicken part of our Chicken & Sausage. I'm not sure if the waitress rang it in wrong or if the kitchen messed it up but it was a price difference and a manager didn't even stop by our table to address it.   My mimosa was ALL orange juice and my friends Bloody Mary had no flavor at all, basically just pure tomato juice!   We noticed that our waitress seemed to have a private room and a full section which did make us a little bit more understanding but to me that says poor management because no server should be sat an amount of tables that they can't handle.   The ladies I was with were talking about our bad experience and we hear the table next to us, which are basically sitting in our laps, say they have waited over an hour for their food. We heard that the Mitch lost their ticket and the manager did go to their table but it really seemed like they didn't have their stuff together!   They need to clean up their systems of service before I will return and work on excelling in True customer service!!

iNp7IfwotbEfXtfzn9yWOA.text: So the manager seemed to really care about the last review I left and said she would make sure the chicken issue was addressed   What ever she said/did worked, I was here the other night and the fried chicken was just like the first time:)  crispy, moist and juicy.  If this stays consistent I will remove what I posted about the chicken inconsistency's  Right now this is one of my favorite places for good food with a home cooked taste, nothing fancy...just good home style cooked food.  And that's what I prefer most of the time:)

P7uu1bM_WuxMnhenDJT-_g.text: Did a ladies night here with my sister and a friend last night. The place was jam packed which I loved. The energy was great-- lots of people,  good music (which I feel only the crew I came with appreciated). Anyway while we waited for a table we ordered drinks at the bar.  One of the Male bartenders pretended to not see us and got irritated that we were standing where the servers were picking up drinks.  We didn't do it on purpose.  There was literally just no place to stand.  Anyway once we moved the female bartender took our order and made our drinks-- super fast.  I had a  blueberry drink which I can't remember the name of but it was AMAZING!!!!! BEST COCKTAIL I've had in a long time.  My friend and sisters got the cucumber basil cocktail and they all loved it! To eat I had the shrimp wrap.  It was good.  The sweet potato tater tots I got as side were THE BOMB!!! OMG. Piping hot and so good!! Our server was super sweet. Blonde slim girl who was fast, efficient,  and just super nice.  My rating of 3 is because the bar staff was rude and towards the end of our meal a man who I believe was the manager came over and just stood in front of our table staring at us for a minute.... and then said  "are you guys ok?" It was so strange.  My sister told me earlier he was behind the bar and super rude to her and my other sister.  Not sure what that was all about.   All in all it was a good time.  The wait was about 30 min which I didn't think was bad.  I'd go back and probably sit at the bar and order drinks and apps next time.

cO0a0tz1dBPKm-dlcZ0EiA.text: This edition of Excited about Eating takes us to Leroy Fox in the Cotswold neighborhood of Charlotte. Cotswold is named after Cotswold Village Shops, a large shopping center at the intersection of Randolph and Sharon Amity Roads. This southern style neighborhood restaurant specializes in golden fried chicken but serves a full line of southern favorites.  Dora here. What an inconspicuous exterior. Wait until you see what's on the other side of that wall. I confess when hubby preferred to sit inside, I copped a wee attitude. How could we pass up this gorgeous patio? But, then, it was 95 degrees outside, so maybe he had a point...just don't tell him, okay? lol. Instead, we ate inside where it was cool, jammed and loud.  For our appetizer, we chose the Hot Pretzels, bite size nuggets served with Leroy's honey mustard and ranch dipping sauces. The pretzels were great, especially when dipped in the honey mustard sauce. We ate every last one.  Dora here. Well, I did, anyway. Ernie exercised a bit more restraint. lol. Yum, the honey mustard was the big seller, with just a hint of sweet trailing as the pretzel disappeared down the hatch.   For my meal, I chose the 14 North (breast/wing) Leroy's World Famous Foxing Fried Chicken with a side of mac n' cheese. This fried chicken was great, juicy and tender on the inside and crispy skin on the outside. The mac n' cheese was good but not to the level of their chicken.  Dora here. Y'all know that a salad with fruit has my name on it, right? The Berry Almond Chicken Salad won my vote over a couple other entrees by a notch. The chicken was grilled with a nice char, the almonds added texture, and the strawberries popped with color, red and fresh. I would've preferred the poppy seed dressing on the side, but forgot to ask for it that way. The mozzarella clumped with the warm chicken, and while all the elements tasted good individually, I wasn't impressed with the combination.  We rate this restaurant 4 forks out of 5 (Ernie 4, Dora 3.5), for a family friendly restaurant serving great food. ~Ernie & Dora Hiers, Fiction Faith & Foodies Blog
