VvGni2G4QnKDgeV_BmVeXA.text: Another wonderfully local place. Sat down ordered drinks, then apps, the food shows up and no drinks, no waitress, the food is gone now and no drinks, no waitress. Finally she shows up and I say " don't you think it's ridiculous that we've finished our food and still don't have our our drinks?" She then started to make an excuse, I stopped her and said "I just want the drink I ordered 25 minutes ago. Second visit, service was good. Can only update to 3 stars based on the fact that 95% of the menu is deep fried. The sides are better than the mains. Green bean casserole, grits tasty.

obGd7OwfZUtuswOx7mSSGQ.text: We went to Leroy Fox back when they opened in 2014 I think? We really liked it, it was delicious food but the service wasn't that great.   We do order from a food delivery service once a week, and when Leroy Fox appeared on their service, we ordered dinner from them back in November of 2014. The food arrived, and it was delicious. Except several items were missing and they ended up crediting us for the missing items.   We tried again on 5/3/15: Once again, great food but missing items that had to be redelivered an hour later.   We still loved the food so we tried again on 11/2/15. Food was great, missing entree.   At this point, we just gave up. It seemed like they were never going to be able to get their act together to actually put together a ticket as ordered (and we aren't complicated orderers or anything either; just basic stuff).   Fast forward to yesterday 6/15/17, we were REALLY craving some Leroy Fox fried chicken, so we thought we'd try one last time.  Good news and bad news. The bad news is that after 3 years, they still can't get an order right. We ordered 1 app and 2 entrees, and they forgot one of the entrees and we had to wait an hour for it to be redelivered.   The good news for us (bad for Leroy Fox) was the food is now really sub-par. Both chicken entrees were massively overcooked and bone dry; the mac and cheese seemed to be no cheese all mac, and the quality of the side dishes was just really not even close to what it was when they opened. That's good news for us because we definitely won't be craving this anymore. Goodbye Leroy Fox - we miss the good food you once provided way back when.

kQIxX69_E5Uy-uNsVQ2EmA.text: Leroy Fox has reached a point of no return for me and my husband. The quality of has continued to get worse and worse. We continue to go back as this is one of the only neighborhood spots near us. The take out tonight has me so disappointed and is begging us to never return. Not only were the drumsticks as big as my thumb but the wing was smaller than a McDonalds chicken nugget.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Worlds tiniest wings

UIZoZlGszm4-9utRYqSUjA.text: Stopped by here on Friday evening to have drinks with my daughter and her boyfriend. We took advantage of the weather and their great outdoor seating area. We went with a couple appetizers to start. The pimento cheese and pita chips were on point. I've been on a pimento cheese kick this week after trying Queen Charlotte's at a Yelp event. Leroy Fox has some good stuff too!! We also tried some of their wings. I like the fact that they through them on the grill before serving them. Adds a nice texture! Of course the beers were cold and refreshing too. My daughter tried one of the signature drink specials too. It tasted like a strawberry milkshake. Not my thing but Kaitlin really liked it. I do wish they had more variety with the appetizer menu but overall a great experience but get here early on the weekends because it gets packed. Need to go back to try the Sunday brunch. I can't say NO to $5 Bloody Marys.

2s1YH9xrVyWKPPdECKbCyw.text: I love this place.  My friends started to come here for the bottomless mimosas (give me a Copper though!) with Sunday brunch. The brunch menu features customized omelets, chicken and waffles, and other fun and exciting stuff I have yet to try.  The place is packed so it's best to get there early or late, but not right around noon.  I haven't had a bad dish from here yet.    If it's a Panthers football Sunday you may even get a drink from the Miller Light ladies who pass out free bottles of miller light and sometimes some swag as well (got a bottle koozie last time).

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pretzel brownie

r_zYCq3EjNO51_KnQV8yeA.text: First things first, let's talk about the ONLY reason to (in my not so humble opinion) visit this restaurant...  Fried Chicken!  It's good.  No, It's really, really good.  If you need something tasty along with it, try the zucchini fries.  They're good, too and the dipping sauce is perfect.     And there ends my praise for the Fox.  Sadly, everything else I have tried on the menu has been bland, or just fallen short of my expectations.  I've tried the catfish, the fried steak, the BLT, and several other things.  Everything tastes like they're out of seasoning.  After my last visit, I won't be back.  There's just too many other great options.  I would meet friends there if asked, and if so, I'd get the chicken.  The place is also pretty loud and the tables are crowded.  Service has never been an issue, the wait-staff is very nice.

0LwkG9VLdofxebZ-m125jg.text: I would give Leroy Fox a 4.5 if that was an option! :)  APPETIZERS, APPETIZERS! They are the best! My favorites (in order) are the zucchini fries, soft pretzels, and pimento cheese! They are big appetizers and everything comes with multiple dipping sauces!   We always eat the fried chicken - it's delicious! Also, an entree choice is a "Side Plate" - for only $10 you can get one plate of 3 sides! That's perfect for sharing or family style eating, plus the sides are delicious! The mashed potatoes & gravy are my favorite (with mac and cheese a close second).    Also, ask to sit in Jabari's section! He was our waiter during our most recent visit - very friendly, gave us good recommendations when we asked, and attentive to our table! :) what more could you ask for from a waiter?   My only -.5 would be because we had an abnormally long wait when we sat at the bar for one of our visits - and our bartender/waitress was texting on her phone while we were waiting to order and waiting to receive our check at the end.

ula0-NxixWqgxEYusOxHDA.text: FINALLY a restaurant that is the total package -- great food, great value, great atmosphere and outstanding customer service.   Found this restaurant on Yelp and needed a place near my parents house that accepted reservations and could accommodate 8 people for lunch the day after Thanksgiving for a surprise 80th birthday party/lunch for my mom. This restaurant totally delivered! The food was outstanding, generous portions, reasonably priced and the staff could not have been more accommodating. They gave us a room that was separated from the main restaurant which allowed us to hear each other and have our balloons and presents in a bit of privacy. The waitress was spot on and always had our glasses filled and every order was exactly right. They even allowed us to bring in a cake and provided a knife and plates and brought it out with candles lit. I can't thank them enough for making this occasion so special for us and for taking such good care of us and for providing outstanding food! I highly recommend this restaurant.

tuhEGLXaxlVgSWPy4UfT-Q.text: Leroy Fox is one of our favorite places to go regularly in Charlotte. The food is always on point and the service is good. We also love the events they host (like Foxy Mixology - a three course meal with 4 drinks pairings that they teach you to make)!   The pretzel bites are a must with queso for dipping. Their brunch is awesome on Sunday, but you need to make sure you come early; it gets busy! For brunch, the breakfast casserole is a winner.

IDZTgHsyc9eQAonwWdqUhQ.text: My family and I have been to here numerous times since we lived so close by. Food and service were excellent for the first two years.  We have shared meals with friends here and referred people to eat there more times then I could count.   We recently moved further away and don't get to frequent them as often. The times that we do, we have noticed there has been a considerable decline in their food and service, with it getting worse with every visit.   The most recent visit which will be our last, was horrible. We have allergies in our family so there was some items that needed to be returned because they would cause an allergic reaction.  This is understandable, but apparently our server decided to write us off, and we went almost 20 minutes without seeing him again. I played around with the idea of talking with a manager, but he walked by our table 3 times, and never stopped to ask how our meal was.  Considering we had a few problems with our meal, we found it very unusual that the manager didn't do a table visit.  To me that would seem like management doesn't care either.   The restaurant hardly had anyone in it at the time we came in, so being busy or in the weeds wasn't an issue.   Because we have piculuaritis with our families meals when we eat out, we often tip well. He should be glad my wife was there to leave a tip, because for the first time in my life, eating out, I wasn't going to leave one.  Considering that the fried chicken meal starts at $14, this is not a cheap place to eat.    Go here if you would like to be disappointed.

jWkUOhfjzMW1ERephtCnEg.text: I've ordered lunch to go twice from this place and it was good. The first time I ordered the grilled salmon salad. The second time I ordered the grilled shrimp wrap. Very impressed with the shrimp wrap. They weren't stingy with the shrimp. This time I decided to dine in for lunch. I was dining alone at around 12:30 pm on a Friday. I thought that they would be packed but the place was almost empty. This was surprising to me given that they are the South Charlotte area and the food is good. Anyway, Abby was my server and she was very nice and friendly. She described several dishes and made recommendations. I ordered an alcoholic drink "lemonade..." something...can't remember the name. It was sweet and good. I ordered 2 appetizers- the zucchini fries and the fried green tomatoes. They were interesting - served with pimento cheese. Both had good portions and were DElicious! Since I'm now working on this side of town, this is becoming my fav spot for lunch.

leSqALYgT5Ob9tHNjxYxHg.text: The building certainly looks fresher than the others around it, so it makes it stand out a bit.  It has a large covered dog friendly patio that looks very appealing.  The interior is also nicely done with that relaxed industrial modern feel.  There is ample seating and a very large bar.  While it's great to have a TV or two for the single bar patrons who need to zone out while eating alone - the size and number of the ones here was a bit distracting - giving it more of a bar hang out feel than casual restaurant.  The bartender I had was a bit leisurely.  She was nice and all, but seemed as if I waited around a while to order a drink, then even longer to order my food.  After my food arrived she only checked on me once and she just seemed weary.  Guess the lunch rush had worn her out before I got there.  The menu seems as if it wants to be a little more upscale southern food.  Now being a vegetarian in a place known for fried chicken can be a test, but they had several options on the menu for me.  I opted to try the zucchini fries so many speak of, the fried green tomatoes and the mac n cheese.  Being a southern girl the last two were going to have to be spot on to get my approval.  Regrettably they failed.  The zucchini fries were large spear cut sections with a nice batter, but where was this spice that so many talked about?  The batter just seemed salty to me.  The boom boom sauce was too much like a zesty mayonnaise to me, so when I did opt to dip I went with the ranch which was decent.  As for the FGT - well for starters if you are going to call them green - then that's what they should be.  These however were just tomatoes - fully ripe, soft, red tomatoes.  No green, crisp un-ripeness to them.  The pimento cheese was good, but it was all too rich with the boom boom sauce all around it.  The batter was also the same as the zucchini.  I prefer the lightness of a customary cornmeal batter on my FGT.  It really needed something to lighten it up.  As for the mac n cheese - my grandma would roll over in her grave if I even pretended it was good.  It didn't taste any better than the Velveeta stuff in a box.  Guess it did have fancier noodles than elbow, but it was a letdown.  The sangria was good however, spicy and tart!  I could see this place doing well as the after work hang out in the area, but not sure this is the place in Charlotte I'd suggest for visitors to go or if you're wanting to have that foodgasm experience.

m5sttWXm7PUG5Sc0C0xCRg.text: Came here b/c of other good reviews... I don't know how they received such good reviews. I came here with my family for a good time. I ordered my food first, but was the last to receive mine, the waiter never came back to ask was food ok & if she had she would have known I didn't have my food. I waited 30 minutes, everybody else was done with their food by the time it came. The waitress bless her heart must've never served before! She never refilled our waters, never asked if I wanted another glass of wine. I asked to speak to a manager, in which they sent someone over to act like a manager b/c she herself was rude & unapologetic & very unsympathetic & couldn't possibly be the manager with that attitude! I asked for corporate number the manager gave us the event coordinator number!!??? I am appalled & will not EVER return here or advise anyone else to either.

AfxDHVabns_qGhJMW6BplA.text: Delicious food!!!! Great drink choices with fun and friendly service. This place is close by and one of my favorites......good for a real delicious sit-down meal, but also perfect for a few drinks at the bar and a good game. I'll definitely be back soon.

67EJMDyGKTLeKoKf-HRMXQ.text: Great food and lively atmosphere. We went for dinner on a Tuesday and the place was full--not overly crowded, thankfully--which is always a good sign.  The service was friendly and prompt. Pricing was reasonable and the food was great. Our table had the shrimp wrap, cheese steak, and Cajun wings with an assortment of sides--all of it was excellent. We had the zucchini fries as an appetizer and they were very good as well.

I6TJ7tAFoiWnGmhSCunsig.text: Looks a lot better than Hotel Charlotte, less Charming, still they fixed it!  No hugs by an incomplete Stranger!!!    Since I did not speak Football, my "server'" quickly handed me off to someone who spoke, Hungry Chimp!  I'm so hungry I have to get an appetizer to have enough Brain power to read enough Menu to Order!  What's in a Name???  Leroy Fox!  First I'll ask some questions... Do I want these Zucchini Fries as L' Fox intended!!!  YES!!! They are GREAT an easy five stars, think about GREAT Fried Chicken, then replace the Chicken with Big Chunk Sticks of Zucchini!  WOW!!! Did NOT Believe until I tasted them, so Glad to-be-so-wrong! GREAT Flavor!  Fox Please keep these!!!  Forget what I said before!  One time Unbeliever, now BELIEVES!!!  Pretzel Appetizer!  You have my attention now tell me... "Flash fried" Sounds Great!  Not Great - AMAZING!!! !! !  My New Favorite Pretzel!  Wins the virtually unknown Rod0 award for Creative Geniusry!  Served with (you could lose stars for this) Ranch and Honey Mustard [next note : YOU better do better]... The Pretzels win 5 yelp stars!  More Creativity Needed on these sauces!  Burger!  I did not know they had Burgers, I had not read reviews and really NEVER planed on eating here. EVER! In fact I had planned to NEVER eat here ! ! !  If they did not have Burgers I would go to somewhere across the Lot!  They do have Burgers and they are Excellent! I will bring my Fiancee here so she can replicate the Bacon Marmalade so I can eat it at home on everything, especially a Large spoon! The Burger is "Blended whole cuts of USDA Choice Short Rib and chuck" ground and shaped somewhat burger-like! So when they saw my Camera during the appetizer they knew they could keep it slightly pink in the middle (not red, pink and barely and only in the middle,middle center) meaning PERFECTLY Cooked (hey George, bet you would like this one) They said they will make it more rare for you if you like! ! !  NEEDS some HELP!  Fox, are you listening ?  Fries too!  Their Fries are not as good as a few places (very few) still good enough for about 3.70 yelp stars - still these make my "Lonely Fries" yelp list!  The quantity of Fries is Gargantuan (as a side with a Burger).  Need A LOT of HELP ! ! !   Mac and Cheese PLEASE START Over or REMOVE this Dish!  Better REMOVE it!  Very Poor!   Pasta Salad (NO Mayo Yay!) the Flavor is too BLAH!  Revamp or Get rid of it!  Sauces: : With the Exception of the Very Exceptional Bacon Marmalade the Sauces need work (they are the opposite of Good) Fox, you came up with Bacon Marmalade your Creativity can NOT end there!!!  How about a Moonshine BBQ Sauce???  Dessert???  Consider two things:   1.)   I'm getting Dessert, here or somewhere right after I leave   2.)   Sitting before you are two Men (both me) one you should be Very afraid of, now where is my Dessert!!!  It all sounded too healthy for me!  Here are my ideas for FOX * * * Note to the Owners maybe something like Beignets or some Deep-fried dough delight Dipped in Chocolate, then sprinkle Powdered Sugar on top and serve it with a little Toyota on the side, maybe some kind of exotic Gelato!  Break the Bank or Millionaires Coffee if you must have it so healthy!    3.)   Dessert on Fire - Use someones Imagination and get on it Fox!  Is this a Sports Bar???  PLEASE Do NOT tell me because that would ruin it for me (I hate Sports and Sports Bars)!  I would never ask someone who works here... Because, really do I want to know?  Nine TV's Mmmm I think it is a Sports Bar, ooohhps 10 counting the one outside... No TV in the Boys Room!  That  is a dead-giveaway unless it is the only one in the place... Gotta be able to check the scores, right?  Right!  More enjoyable and better food than Hotel Charlotte and still some of the old H.C. Doors!  Boys Room is almost the same, very close friends of complete strangers, still better than incomplete ones!  Advantage Leroy Fox - No one at the Door offering to hug me, Nor in the Boys Room!!!  Boys Room has a Working Lock on the Door - Advantage Leroy Fox!  Justin Kasee!  Girl walks in takes a seat at the Bar  (True Story) orders a Beer and chats with the Staff - She is looking for a job (HERE)... I think this was a good approach to get comfortable with the Staff!  Did they hire Her? These are NOT the Jokes!

J5b5L8N9O4sn8rmmuvo29g.text: Walked in at 10am and they just opened and I was their 1st customer.  Sat at the bar as I normally do when I eat by myself. I ordered the cheese steak sandwich and had them put it into a wrap for me. I was worried about this cause most places dont do it correct and there never any meat and thin slice of tomato etc. This was the opposite,  stuffed with meat and thick Slice if tomato, mushrooms,  onions it was awesome.  I would recommend this to anyone you have to try it. Ok, now for the side. I wanted something different and they had several unique and different side choices. The bartender said I had to get the hashbrown casserole, OMG it was incredible.  I will definitely be back.

sM0x5pK1DX8csPtJI0I-Bg.text: Nice atmosphere but that's about it. The waitress was rude. I had to flag down another server to order. The nachos had 40 jalapeno slices on them. Who eats that much? And they rested in a puddle of Buffalo sauce. Again, waitress wasn't around to clear the plates. Off night? I won't be back

d1Rc343STF8rU4TR-P_Ckw.text: Dont go here We decieded to go here for breakfast today and we left at about 11:30. When we got there They told us it would be 15 mins to get a tabel, we got one 30 mins later. We sat down at an area so loud You couldnt hear yourself think, And by the time we got our food it was like 1:30 ONE thirty!!!! The food turned out to suck so i didnt eat and we ended up going to poppies bagels, a much better meal.

IUr6zqy3R8rpP7192GEjhg.text: Excellent family spot.  Great for kids.  Noisy, good beers on tap, friendly staff.   Not high-end food by any means, but good salads, chicken, etc.

NEE_QDLPXtv00xtt78ANjw.text: The night before we left Charlotte, we decided to go to Mert's downtown, but when we got there, we discovered that once again we had managed to visit North Carolina during a basketball tournament.  Parking was pretty hard to find, traffic was heavy and we decided we would not get into the restaurant, so we used our fall-back, Leroy fox, based on reviews for the fried chicken.  Ms T had chicken fried chicken, which is a breast that is fried and served with pepper gravy.  She substituted mac 'n cheese and grits for her sides.  I had fried chicken with mashed potatoes and gravy and green bean casserole.  The fried chicken is good, a little non-traditional with a fairly heavy coating.  The coating is however, crisp and well salted.  The chicken was moist and hot.  There was plenty of black pepper and a fair amount of sage in the coating making it somewhat unique.  I did like it.  Ms T's chicken fried chicken was Ok, nothing really special.  We both found the pepper gravy to be too pasty thick, like it is only thickened with flour and not cooked down cream, but it also had good black pepper flavor, which I like.  The mashed potatoes were certainly home made.  The cheese grits had good corn flavor and were not overcheesed.  The mac 'n cheese was cavetappi with a smooth white cheese sauce.  It was a creamy style, not baked or if baked, not in a small pan that allows it to setup.  The green bean casserole was the only miss for me.  The green beans had a lot of strings in them so Leroy needs to find a better supplier of green beans.  I don't know where you would even go to find green beans that are stringy these days.  The casserole was over thickened a little.  All in all this is pretty good food.  I would say strong three stars, not quite four, but it wouldn't take much to fix a few details and be there.

Ye04o7lG-S9I_ZHC7IEMng.text: Such great food here and the service is wonderful. I love their drink selection and my favorite is the buffalo chicken salad we've had them make a few times by request.  The patio area is also a perfect place to relax on a sunny day!

3Hhi1sQnEfHAJbCBY4pa7g.text: This was our second trip to Leroy Fox.  I wasn't excited about it as I thought our first experience was average at best.    Unfortunately, this was even worse.  The regular fried chicken is the highlight; however, the sides are awful.  The gravy is thicker than pudding and tasteless.  The mashed potatoes are mixed with so much sour cream they don't even taste like potatoes and then they are covered in more of that gloppy gravy.     By far the worst though was my husband's "Nashville" fried chicken.  It was so greasy it left pools of grease on the bottom of his plate.  The taste wasn't spicy...mostly just burnt flavored.  We should have sent it back but didn't.    In addition to the bad food, the staff is young, inexperienced and flippant.   Many of them stand around the kitchen door and chat as opposed to waiting on tables.    Last time for sure.

i4O0sL517mEW27Jn27AYvQ.text: I love the chicken and the drinks are legit. We have been several times and we are never disappointed. We have also had success getting food to go.

eMNKyHpG5wNP6jmywmlEAA.text: The food was good and came with a lot. However, It overpriced and around $15 for some chicken tenders and fries. The Cajun fries and chicken were really good though so it might be worth the extra money once and awhile.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Tenders with Cajun fries

WJpRTjErt-9YmB7VxQOKng.text: Good ole southern eating! I have brought all my out of towners here to get a great a meal and they all rave about it! I was skeptical of the fried chicken, because who can fry chicken better than your mama??? Well Leroy Fox definitely is a contender!!! A super nice restaurant with a cool vibe...I love that they have shareable platters! The sides are pretty big and you won't be disappointed with much of anything you get! Brussel Sprouts and Mashed Potatoes with the sausage gravy are a couple of my top favs, and let's not talk about the mac and cheese!!!! Love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States

13-PuNiJUqOXC_r7-NNRRw.text: One of my go to spots for friend chicken In town. Make sure to get mac and cheese as well as the mashed potatoes with sausage gravy. They dont take reservations on Saturday nights  so get ready to wait. Totally worth it and you can always grab a drink at the bar. Only complaints consisted of a guy at the table behind me falling out of his chair and a plunger in the urinal.

pHe_4hjyCKaA-FbgC28xHg.text: The Beet Salad. Hands down the best salad I've ever had! The beet croutons on it should be an appetizer!! Amazing. I wish I had a picture to share.

mBPUOCsnzAvBGsxlyXMAzQ.text: Leroy Fox (L.R.) is slowly becoming my new favorite restaurant/sports bar in Charlotte.  You know that excitement you get from the beginning stages of a new-relationship?  You know those "butterfly-feelings" women are always talking about??  Well that's exactly how I feel about Leroy Fox!   Let's start with the food.  The fried chicken ranks as some of the best I've ever had anywhere on planet earth.  I'm talking BETTER than Price's, better than Chicken box and better than your grandma's!!  Yep, I said it!  I usually go with the "1/4 North" which includes a wing and breast, but they also have the "1/4 South" (leg and thigh), and other combinations.  No matter what pieces of chicken you get, it's all fried to perfection.  Went here last week with a buddy and though it took some time for the chicken to arrive to us at the bar, it came pipping hot.  I love that they don't over-fry the chicken - its always really moist on the inside and full of flavor (that's what she said - LOL).  I've also had the "Fox Den wings" on multiple occasions and can say they are excellent and very underrated as far as wings go.  Yes folks, I would also put these wings right up there with some of the best in Charlotte.  They are perfectly seasoned, charred (for no up-charge a la Hickory Tavern), and are served with a cold, healthy, serving of ranch or blue cheese.  I usually run the fries or sweet potato tots as my sides - both are great.  I would warn against the mac-n-cheese however - its all mac, and no cheese if you know what I mean.    I've sat at a table before, and although there weren't any notable concerns, I found it to be a bit slow.  Ever since, I've dined and drank at the bar.  The bartenders are always super friendly, willing to strike-up a convo, and willing to accommodate any request you may have.  I don't know if its the location in the heart of Cotswold, the spacious, comfy bar, or the super-chill bartenders, but there's definitely a unique, friendly, southern vibe to Leroy Fox.  From the looks...or TASTE of things, this is going to be a one long lasting relationship!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/4 North w/fries - I could eat this meal every day of my life
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States

EUxPr2bgqnHatsJAu8gBNw.text: The ambiance was very cute... hardwood tables, patio, and a huge bar. The food on the other hand was a bit underwhelming. I had the salmon BLT... the salmon was over charred to the point where it was all I could taste! I tasted a piece of the fried chicken... it was either cooked too long or cooked in old grease. On the brighter side, I enjoyed the fries and Mac and cheese. Street parking was available. I would make a reservation for a large group. Cards and cash are accepted!

JN2W1AXkZFluWsGS0SrH1w.text: I've been a couple of times now.  It's a little hit or miss for me.  The food is normal, not anything spectacular.  Drinks, the same.  The inside is nice with plenty of tv's to catch games.  The bartenders are kind of hit or miss as well.  They can be very nice or very unconcerned with your presence.  No one seems to smile much here, not sure why I've noticed that.  The outdoor patio is very nice with a couple of large tv's, though I've never sat out there to eat.  It seems fairly quiet since it is protected from the parking lot and nearby road.  It's an option if I'm around that area.  Try it for yourself.

jLK4hkj7W1SOAnyb_D6Sow.text: If you're ever stuck in traffic on Providence road, this is a great spot to pop into where the bottleneck occurs.   I highly recommend The Young George Washington for a yummy and warm cocktail mixing bourbon and a delicious tobacco smoke.  Charming presentation too.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States

kx0OacA_YFxPaIeKuNl88w.text: Had dinner tonight, sides were good, but the supposed star of the dish was small and dry as sand. I ordered the chicken fried chicken, and this is the first time I've seen a chicken breast that has nearly curled into a ball. It doesn't take a five star chef to realize in order to fry a chicken breast evenly, you need to pound it out. Overall, decent experience, but the prices reflect the cost of living in downtown Charlotte, rather than the quality of the food.  I'm still trying to wrap my head around $8 for six wings....... lastly, the bathrooms are desperately in need of a remodel. I got flashbacks from my studio apartment when I was a teenager. Doubt I'll be back.

hH-C1ecCT-YgTvhBdwDzIA.text: My friend visited the restaurant the week before sharing that the food was so so. While my husband and I were out last weekend and also very hungry I thought why not try Leroy Fox. Now you may ask why try it if my friend said it was so so, but I enjoy visiting restaurants tickling my own palette before making a decision. Once we arrived we were seated quickly although it was March Madness Duke vs. Michigan State game. Our server was delightful he informed us of the tasty menu including non-seafood items since I am expecting. The food was Delicious and the service impeccable.

eTAaabNLoNIFRgrBdgzeaA.text: My sister and I came here and we order some food and it toke almost a hour to get our food because they said a dinner party had ordered their food and it will take awhile.

hBOBWD73NheDaI3Cn4D5fw.text: This place is a disaster. We came at 1pm on a Sunday, the restaurant was around 30% full. We were seated immediately and the server came up to take our order promptly which was great, but then things started to go down hill from there. First, there was a significant amount of food under our table. As in, no one cleaned up after the toddler party before us. Our server didn't come back to refill our drinks for several minutes after they were empty. We were wondering where our server was most of the time actually. We were delighted they offered stevia sweetener, until we asked for more and the server said "we're usually out of it." She didn't even look for more, that was it! Our food came and the chicken was great. The fries were not. It was obvious they had been sitting for a while or were perhaps reheated. Also, the side salad had chickpeas in it. What's up with that? That's just weird and annoying.   This place had good fried chicken, but everything else was a sad performance. Get it together!

F8fBqAxw0da66oTRXcpngA.text: This place is one of my favorite places in Charlotte. I've tried several of their dishes, and I'm never disappointed. In addition to a great selection of food, their kitchen is open late on Sunday nights. I recommend their buffalo chicken nachos (grilled), buffalo chicken salad, and their grilled chicken club wrap. My sister loves their sweet potato fries and their pimento and egg chicken sandwich. They also have a great variety of cocktails. My favorite is the champagne mojito. Seriously, i could drink like 5, they're amazing!   i definitely appreciate their kitchen being open late since my boyfriend sometimes works late on Sundays and its one of two nights he has off, so Leroy Fox gives us that chance to eat great food after 9pm on Sundays. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. grilled Buffalo Chicken Nachos
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. champagne mojito

z2jR3gzQdy33HoDj_UrGZw.text: I have visited Leroy Fox on a few occasions as my parents just moved to the area. They have a great atmosphere and beautiful outdoor patio. I am looking forward to going back to sit in their outdoor patio once it is cooler outside. They have great drinks and the fried chicken is yummy. Will definitely be going back.

UUbT7MwDU2cVijds3IZZ5g.text: Awesome sandwich and sweet potato tots! We had lunch and the staff was amazing to get our order in a hurry, we both had appointments. I had the chicken salad sandwich, which had light mayo and a good flavor on homemade-like bread. In fact I took half the sandwich home as leftovers since it was a generous size. The sweet tots were the main attraction--seriously the warm, fragrance and hint of sugar made these sides the main event! I wanted a whole bowl of sweet potato tots. We also shared an app of zucchini "fries" that had a yummy dipping sauce.     The parking lot is tiny so I parked nearby and walked over to LF. We didn't have drinks but I hear they have a good list. Excellent service!

Guzfjbg2IDk1oS1O7-iH4w.text: Leroy Fox is a great spot to grab a drink or dinner. Friendly staff, great signature drinks, and a very well prepared menu.

LgYqanDkQ6PQI9TYXTZeYQ.text: I heard good things about this place so went with my girlfriend and a few of her friends. The waiter was good but seemed like he lost some of his enthusiasm when he would take my order rather than the females I was at the table with. The food came out and my mashed potatoes were cold, others at the table had complaints as well about the temperature of their food. I would try again only because I don't like ruling places out after the first visit.

JGP6nkzb7haILZpk4j-XOQ.text: By far one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. The hot chicken is absolutely incredible. Innovative cocktails (yes, a little pricey, but I suck it up). Great patio that's dog friendly...my dog is too awkward to socialize with people, but it's super cool to see all the other dogs!   I have been to this place like three times in the last month and a half. I wish it was closer to my house, but that's obviously not the restaurant's fault. Haha.

OU0uLI9dBk7ZIP4kD0lDaA.text: Honestly I like the place and he food, however the service is the most unprofessional I have ever witnessed. Servers stand around and chat (even with the manger) while patrons go without food. The last several times I have been here it has taken over 30 minutes to get food. I have been here and had bartenders make eye contact then go back to stocking glasses or some other mundane task and leave me sitting until I have had to physically go and ask for service. I only write this in the hopes they start to take their jobs seriously.

mg7ED-1D62-znt_4aGjOMQ.text: This was the first time going to Leroy Fox and the food & service was great. The favorites were Leroy's lemonade and the honey buffalo wings.   This could quickly become one of my favorite places to go.

R1j2c4aQ_Cl_YA21eq9SCw.text: I'm going to go ahead and give Leroy Fox 5 stars for my first visit and here is why.  * No Wait (it was very busy but we lucked out) * Awesome outdoor patio (could use a few more tables out there though) * $6 absolute dirty martini (I thought that must be a joke) * Zucchini Fries (amazing - 3 dipping sauces you will not be disappointed) * Sliders (bacon jam - that is all I have to say)  Extra star for service Chelsea our waitresses was attentive and friendly.    Cotswald had needed a place like Leroy Fox for a long time - family friendly and big bar with large TV's to watch your favorite games on!

aqBQKJ69_qhRWuBorTRfVQ.text: Went to Leroy Fox on a Friday night and loved it.  Fresh beers at the bar from OMB made the wait for a table a little more tolerable.  Food was great, at least mine.  Pretzel appetizer is great, as are any of the fried chicken sandwich selections.  Personally, I thought the honey buffalo was the best, but took a bite of the gravy sandwich and it was incredible too, although it could've used a side of gravy to dip a little into.  Others got the tiger shrimp wrap and weren't impressed, but everything I had was great!

EkHUX3AQRLykPWzjkYkblA.text: Cool place.  Only been here for lunch but never had a bad experience.  Food comes out quickly too.  Placed an order to go recently and came to find out the prices on their menu online aren't the same as the menus at the restaurant.  Wasn't that big of a deal, couple extra bucks doesn't hurt but just something to point out.  Cheers!

aGoy5DMGWdMMVF3P34no9w.text: Amazing! Went with a large group of 16 and they easily accommodated us and the service was fantastic; the staff was attentive and quick.   The food was delicious.  The table had an array of food between the perfectly crispy fried chicken, the amazing zucchini fries, the fried chicken sandwich, BLTA, and a bunch of other things.  The zucchini fries definitely deserved all the rave I've heard and I don't know how anyone can make hot pretzel bites taste so good but they managed.  Hailing from Miami and dining with all southerners, they were all more than satisfied with Leroy Fox's. We will definitely be back on a regular basis.   They only lost one star on a personal taste level - the live music on Thursday, Friday, and Saturdays. While the musician was fantastic and the choice of music was wonderful and the concept is great, for a restaurant that's a little smaller in size, it was a bit too loud. For being 9 at night on a week day and being a restaurant and not a bar or lounge, I wasn't ecstatic that we could hardly hear one another. However, this will not stop us from returning. It's too good not to go back!!

cqE5MbsHszCYws1B-pT0ig.text: So I've been wanting to try Leroy Fox ever since they opened.  Much to my surprise, my boyfriend took me there last night for Valentine's Day.    My first impressions were: YAY, they're working on outdoor patio seating out front. That will be nice in the spring / summer / fall.  The interior is so nice & cozy...I love the wall with all the street names.  The bar has plenty of seating. There was in excess of 5 or 6 TVs.    We were seated immediately upon arrival (we had 6 PM reservations).  Brittney, our waitress came to our table as soon as we sat down. She was very upbeat & friendly.  She had great recommendations on drinks - she talked me into The Hotel Charlotte martini & my boyfriend had the King of Foxes whiskey drink - they have a whiskey club you can join!  For our meal, we decided on the fried chicken sandwich with mac & cheese for me & Shawn got the 1/4 north foxing fried chicken, with the mashed potatoes & peppered gravy.  We waited less than 10 minutes for our food to come out.  While waiting, our water glasses stayed full.  We were VERY pleased at the presentation...the food looked delicious - & the taste of it matched!  The portions were huge (we decided there was no way we could have eaten an appetizer along with our entrees)! The chicken (on my sandwich & the foxing fried chicken) were lightly seasoned & breaded, juicy & tender. The mac & cheese & mashed potatoes!!!!! HEAVENLY. If I were stranded on a desert island, I want these two sides with me!  These are probably the best restaurant sides I've had in Charlotte.  The cornbread muffins were baked perfectly & were moist inside. YUM.  We ate our entire meal & felt just the right amount of full.  During the meal, Brittney came by frequently & checked on us & we had a manager come by, too.    Extra details: the fox theme is throughout the restaurant - waiters & male bar staff wear shirts that say "Sly" & waitresses wear ones that say "Vixen".  Beverage glasses have a fox etched on them. I love the color choices on the dinnerware. Nice white plates & turquoise bowls for the sides.  Neat design on the chicken tenders appetizer - wire basket, with 3 holders for dipping sauces.  Appetizers are in portions that could serve as a meal.  At 6 PM, they weren't busy yet, but about 30 - 45 minutes later, it began filling up.  The noise level is normal with customer & wait staff chatter. Prices are reasonable.  While I expected this place to be "grown folks" only, there were several families dining.  We've already decided this will be a regular spot for us. Long live Leroy Fox!

zOArWrXn9SoYSZS7e8QUzA.text: Just the name alone makes me smile.  Like a southern nickname this place can certainly grow on people.  I didn't have the oppurtunity to try the fried chicken other than a bite hear and there from the girlfriend, the burger special I did have was absolutely fantastic.  Sirlion burger on a croissant, nuff said.  Service was very energetic and attentive, seems like they have hired pretty well in that regard.  Atmosphere is very casual and somewhere in between southern comfort and a little new age.  I really like it.

FfR848rA3LbVMgAsgFsPjg.text: Saw all the great reviews about this place, and as I was in the mood for some fried chicken, decided to check this place out. The restaurant itself and the atmosphere was great. Very trendy but not overly done. Inside seating was a little tight, but not terrible. There were TVs to watch, seats were comfortable and the place was clean. The host was friendly and so were the waitresses.   I ordered the 1/4 South with Mac & Cheese. While it was not exactly what I was hoping for, it was delicious! It was more of a modern twist to a southern comfort meal. Don't get me wrong, it really was outstanding! The chicken was lightly fried, the skin was crispy and the cornbread was perfect. The macaroni, which was a surprise, was a in a runny cheese sauce instead of the thick cheesy mess I was hoping for. It was still great though!  I went on a Thursday night and it was still relatively busy, but I hope to go back on a Friday night and hear some of the live music.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. 1/4 South with Mac &amp; Cheese

rbG42RgZPJFQVd7bMBHFOQ.text: For some reason I heard very little buzz about Leroy Fox, but am super glad some girlfriends and I went last night. Since it's not far from where I live, and the prices reasonable, I agree with Angie P.  This is going to be a regular spot!   The environment on a Friday night is kind of loud, but very warm and inviting.  Not sure how to describe it but "Southern Plantation" -ish style.  (Think, perfect place for a date, or to catch up with friends and chat.) Not pretentious at all-- wear whatever you want, and you'll be comfortable. Our server was just a doll and provided us great service and was knowledgeable about the menu.   (Example: The famous chicken is brined for 24 hours, and the pretzels are flash fried (which is why they're soooo good) and served with a homemade cheese sauce, ranch and honey mustard dip.)   I feel I can't give 5 stars yet, only because I need to try more of the menu.  But my dining partners all loved their fried chicken and sides.  My shrimp and grits were pretty great-- though I would have loved some sausage in it too.  (Still, by far, the E2 Emeril grits are my #1 in Charlotte!)   Stay tuned for a follow-up review soon!

cp34cPh7ZLOLM7rYXBtdCQ.text: Favorite Appetizer - Zucchini Fries with the Boom Boom Sauce ....Great Atmosphere for watching game and celebrating a friend's birthday!

Mo-KBtiMbubKMLRoDJaAZg.text: This is for the waiting for a table process only as we couldn't get any farther than that. We came in for dinner, 4 and a high chair, on a Saturday night around 6:30. We were told the wait would be 30 minutes-ok, no big deal. I watched 4 parties come in after us, put their names down on the wait list.....and all get seated before us. When we asked what the issue was, we were told it would be about 15 more minutes as there were 2 more parties before us. Then we watched a party of 6 THAT ARRIVED AFTER US get seated. When we asked if they took reservations, the hostess said no-and when we asked why we werent getting seated we were told it was because there were smaller parties ahead of us-and when we pointed out the 6 top that got seated, she back tracked and said, ohhhhh well maybe they did have reservations. Ohhhhhh, well maybe if you stopped wiping down menus and ran an efficient seating chart, this wouldn't happen. Then we were told it would be another 15 minutes!!!! No thanks. We left and went elsewhere-and I'd advise you to do the same.

x8R0YybmbcxL4ESEEW7nCA.text: I am a pretty simple girl when it comes to food a drink so that is probably why I liked this place so much. Give me the original fried chicken sandwich and some cheap miller lite and I am happy and Leroy Fox serves both, all the time.   I have tried several other menu items and the only thing I am not a fan of is the mac n cheese (just find it to be bland). My husband loves the BBQ peach (insert some type of meat) salad. The first time he had it, he talked about it for days. The next couple of times, he just talks about how he still can't believe how good it is.   I like to get one of the big booths in the back or grab a seat at the bar. I find some of the table seating to be awkward, but I am like that everywhere I go. The service is always fine and this has quickly become our go to spot when neither the hubs or myself want to make a decision about where we should eat.   Just a heads up- it can get kind of loud in the space, especially on live music nights but that isn't enough to keep me away. I think it is just a sign of a fun place full of people having a good time.

NbiZufA4tlPlf6-RYDwJxA.text: I went to Leroy Fox for the first time yesterday to meet a friend for lunch.  Let me just say that the new build out of the old Hotel Charlotte is fantastic.  We were seated immediately and greeted by our server within seconds.  He was super friendly and helpful with the menu.  I ordered the Shrimp Cobb Salad and loved it.  The shrimp were seasoned and cooked to perfection and the salad was a great size.  My friend ordered the Chicken Salad Sandwich which she said was delicious.  The staff was super attentive....our glasses were never empty.  I will definitely be going back and hoping that they start serving brunch SOON!

B87Fvg2uX3eqfhQJvObveA.text: I had the chance to have lunch a couple of times over the past few weeks and both experiences were good.  Service was great both times with food coming out quickly, glasses always filled and attention to detail.  Wide variety on the menu from several sandwich options, salads and bigger entrees.  First time out, I had their basic burger called "the prohibited burger" and it was quite tasty with the combination of short rib and chuck in their ground mixture. Also, since they grind their own beef in house, they can cook it to your liking.  Second time out, I had the BBQ Chick Chopped Peach salad, which had chopped peaches, red onions, tomatoes, cheddar and grilled bbq chicken with sweet vidalia onion dressing.  I was a little skeptical going in, but was pleasantly surprised how all the ingredients worked together.  My only issue with the salad was the amount of dressing, which was excessive for me.  I will ask for the dressing on the side in the future, but I would certainly order this salad again.  All in all, really good food and atmosphere at Leroy Fox, and they look like they have a good adult beverage menu as well.  I will have to return to check out the libations.

dJz-eKLUzOeQ7XdMQeTxQQ.text: Saw the New Years Event on Eventbrite and thought, "Wow $60 for 5 course meal AND 2 drinks" thats where I need to be for New Years!! Boy was I disappointed. Not only was the food cold and stale like it had been sitting there all day but it took 15-20 min to even get the plates of food. What a disappointment! Based off of this I will NEVER be back in.

503_ZUy0gRmxSJ6mr4mdXA.text: The place is small so definitely make reservations if you can, especially for a weekend night. I had 7:30p reservations and the place was packed but we got seated immediately.  The food was pretty good overall. The fried green tomatoes were excellent with the spicy pimento cheese! I could eat a million of those. The buffalo wings were nicely grilled and equally as spicy.  My main course of chicken fried chicken was good, but it was missing some spice and/or flavor. Also, the little cornbread muffins were delicious.

LCI-frg1rNoBxych-RI-9w.text: Sad to say. Came to bar for a drink and take out. Sat.  Finally was given a menu. Sat. They were too busy for me. Ignored. Left. Went to place in the same parking lot (Eddies. ) they were equally busy but I was served within a minute or two.

8kRlMO9apjZUrv3K88yc-A.text: Our group went to LeRoy Fox last minute as the restaurant we chose did not have room for us.  One of our companions ordered the zucchini fries, which came with 3 sauces.  Delish!  For my entree, I ordered shrimp po'boy.  Very good.  I loved their spicy boom-boom sauce!  We experienced excellent service as well.

UT4E-qD5lQQqaGbHzkzvbA.text: Went in at 400pm after our daughter's volleyball game and the place was basically empty. We had a party of 5, which included our two kids and mother-in-law. Atmosphere is nice and cozy. Pretzel app was good. However, our food took forever!!!!  Manager was standing at the bar the entire time doing absolutely nothing. Our server was great but for as long as the food took to come out, and considering the place had about two other tables sat, I found no reason for our food to take that long and then have the nerve to be sent out luke warm.  We always tip well, and our again our server was great.  Probably won't be back though since we live in University area and have many better choices to choose from.

zRYm2i9eGhAa8F3n8RnlpA.text: Amazing chicken! Great food, great atmosphere. Would definitely go here again.   Here's what we had: PRETZEL BITES: we opted for the cheese dip, which was good but so is the ranch and honey mustard that these come with. I think these are deep fried pretzels and oh man are they good.  PIMENTO AND EGG CHICKEN SANDWICH: hello! Perfect chicken oozing with pimento with bacon and a fried egg on top! Whoa nelly! HONEY BUFFALO CHICKEN SANDWICH: sweet and spicy, with buffalo cheese and these amazing sweet green tomatoes (kind of like pickles, but so much better) SIDE OF MACARONI AND CHEESE: creamy and perfect SWEET POTATO TOTS: soft, lovely nuggets of golden goodness with yummy honey mustard dipping sauce BANANA PUDDING: okay... Here's the one thing we didn't like. It was like they forgot to add milk, it was so thick, almost like a custard and my friend with a super sweet tooth even said it was too sweet for her. Something seemed wrong with it. We should have sent it back but we were too full anyways.

7CYrvLzSB1Sonq-3mpjBLg.text: Not sure why it took me to long to check out Leroy Fox, this place is super fly.  I love the rustic but sleek exterior: gray washed beams, with cute pergola topped patio. The interior has just as much personality. As a design nerd, I totally fell in love with the exposed brick, paneled ceiling, and mouding. Along the walls are super cute vintage-looking prints of animals on book pages, LOVE. I also wanna give props to the amount of seating in this place, especially all the booths.  My only complaint is that the menu is not especially vegetarian friendly. There are some appetizers to choose from, and then sides (you can make a sides plate: $11) This place seems way too cool to be ignorant of all of us herbivores...  I ordered a "Sideways Plate" which comes with your choice of three sides. I ordered the mac n cheese, cheese grits, and zucchini fries. I ALMOST ordered the green bean casserole, but luckily I had our server check with the kitchen and yes, it's made with chicken stock... BOO! No fair. The mac n cheese was ok. Good, but nothing special, won't waste my time with this again. The cheese grits were pretty good, but not my favorite in town, but I'll definitely order them again. The shining star of my plate was the ZUCCHINI STICKS. Oh boy, these things have a ZING! Super crispsy, chunky, and filling. At first I thought it was the sauce, but the breading on these things is spicy. I like moderately spicy things and these sticks hurt so good. If you like foods with a little zip, make sure you try the zucchini sticks.  The staff here were excellent. Nice, helpful, attentive. Kudos.

2qe2jRDHYZxLS0ayuXsrDQ.text: We visited this restaurant on a Saturday afternoon.  I loved this restaurant!!  The food was good, but I think it was the clean, well placed table and overall feel of the restaurant that truly added to my overall satisfaction. I felt comfortable and relaxed as I ate and enjoyed the predominantly mellow crowd.   Now for the food. My husband ordered the fried chicken and macaroni and cheese, which was accompanied by cornbread and white gravy. I had the BLTA (bacon, lettuce, tomato and avocado...although I had mine without the avocado), and the shoestring french fries. Everything was good, however I found the macaroni and cheese to be a little bland. Salt and pepper probably would have remedied that. My BLT(A) was great!!!  I loved the pickled green tomatoes that added a bit of sweetness to my savory sandwich. The white gravy complemented the fried chicken very nicely. I would no doubt return to this restaurant.  Next time I might eat outside on the lovely front patio....it looked lovely!!

gBkTY2GtDIakRtKrVQo35Q.text: I still love Leroy Fox, haven't been in a while. I went earlier today and we were pretty much the only ones eating inside. Our waitress was lazy, she sat at the bar and ate while we were eating, when we needed things we had to wait for a good bit until she decided to stop by. She spent her time eating and chit chatting with what it look like to be the manager.  Very unprofessional in my opinion.

deyjARSjy7_LEcQ7NaaeGw.text: So happy this is in my neighborhood! The service, food, and drinks were great! My husband had the buffalo chicken sandwich. It was awesome! The zucchini fries are a must and the mac and cheese was tooo good. I wanted more! We had the hotel charlotte cocktail, which was worth the $10.00. We will for sure be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States

2TP3V7NyCGRlzIYlg5ux6g.text: Great atmosphere  loved being able to have a beer and watch the panthers.    The fried chicken is really worth coming here. I will come when I have a hankering for fried chicken again. I was disappointed in the cheesy grits - very bland. I had to ad extra extra salt and pepper to add flavor.     The bar selection was ok. I'm on the lookout for locals and had a couple nice ones.   Server was friendly and ok.

lEwcQNOq4ySKwDurzOdS6w.text: Great southern food here with a little more of a "upscale" vibe to its presentation.  I just had a few of the appetizers and a couple bites of the chicken sandwich but everything tasted great. The mac and cheese is very good and prepared with a white cheese and absolutely delicious. The hot pretzels are also a good app and served with 3 dipping sauces (honey mustard, ranch and a cheese sauce). I also tried the chicken tenders which were fried to perfection in my opinion. Not too over done, soggy or underdone. Everyone I was with (a large party of 14) seemed to like their meals. We had a lot of members of the "clean plate club" with us that evening.   The food seems to be reasonably priced but the beers, starting at 3,25 for domestic up to 5.5 for imports, are a little on the high end. Also, we tried one of the specialty drinks (maybe the peach tea? I can't remember) and it was served in a small mason jar and very tasty but the specialty drinks can run at up to 10$ a pop. I guess you could say overall this place is moderately priced on the food and a little high end on the drinks.   The one bad thing I would comment on is that our server, while being very good at running our orders and checking up on us seemed a little too friendly with the females at our table. If one of the guys placed a order he would just kinda give em a dead pan look and fetch whatever you asked for but if one of the ladies placed a order man was he all "hey how you doing?" and smiles across the board.

4WEnlIr5CFLXTJaaIhrM8g.text: POOR MANAGEMENT, SERVICE and CARRY OUT. I am really sad to write this review. We actually sometimes travel from NY to Charlotte just to eat Fried Chicken at this place and of course stay at the Ritz and enjoy the pool and spa, but that's besides the point. This trip I came with my Mom and daughter to go furniture shopping in High Point. We ate fried chicken twice in 3 days at Leroy Fox and decided to take some home on the plane to my husband and father. We ordered two winner winner chicken dinners which is basically two whole chickens and 4 large sides. When we got the food we didn't check it to make sure it was correct and to our surprise we were missing a whole chicken. We didn't realize this until we were back in Brooklyn!  I called and the management was pretty rude telling me we must have lost it or misplaced it and they were sure we had it because the staff said they put it in there. Do you REALLY think your staff would admit if they forgot to put a whole chicken in a carry out bag????  Do they really think we would call to try to get a free chicken?????  Do you think that many to go containers can fit in one bag, which is what we were given....1 bag?  Come on people. These people need to go to Customer Service 101. We didn't even want our $$ back necessarily, but some acknowledgment of the problem and apology or offer to fix it would have been appreciated instead of being made to feel like a crazy person trying to get a free chicken, lol.   Other problems we had that day was our server was so new she didn't even know the menu and messed up our lunch order and the breasts and wings were dry and way over fried by the kitchen, which btw has happened many times but we usually overlook it because they will correct the problem and bring fresh chicken out. The other BIG MISTAKE on their part is they put the 1 chicken we did get in the to go containers right out of the fryer and brought us the to go order right after we started eating. They should have let the chicken sit to cool down before packing it. AMATEURS!!!!  We ended up with 1 soggy chicken back in Brooklyn.  We used to tell all of our friends and colleagues who live in Charlotte and New York about this place. We can no longer do that as we wouldn't know what kind of service, treatment or quality of food they will get.  GONE DOWN HILL LEROY SINCE WE STARTED EATING THERE 4 YEARS AGO!!

GZ4Asp6JjZoRLO5jPtV1ow.text: YUM, YUM, YUM.  My first 5 star review for a Charlotte restaurant.  A cool but relaxed and unpretentious ambiance with huge plasma TV screens that will satisfy any football-loving boyfriend or dad.  And the food - not even worth me elaborating on, b/c I'm just gonna lose my entire evening describing how absolutely delicious, succulent, generous, and crazy good everything is.  MUST HAVE = Zucchini fries.  They DO deserve to be "world famous," like their menu says.  The dips that come with the appetizer are amazing too - remind you a lot of the ranch & chipotle dip that California Pizza Kitchen offers with their Avocado Club Egg Rolls.  So far, I've tried their Shrimp & Grits - very generously sized and great quality.  My sister had their BBQ Chicken Sandwich - um, to die for.  Definitely recommend.  Overall, everyone should give this place a try & give it some serious business.  No complaints over here!

bLH8vkk-eo6pwMCyZl5tKw.text: I can't believe it took me a year to make my way to Leroy Fox! This place is fantastic. We went with friends for drinks and a late lunch the other day and had an excellent experience on the patio. The drinks were creative - served in Mason jars - how can you not love that Southern touch? Our appetizers and salads were all delicious. I wanted to take the Boom Boom sauce home with me...   The restaurant looks nice inside and out, the service was spot on, and the menu looked good... This is a great place to hang out with friends or take your kids. I can't wait to go back -I want to  check out their brunch!

6nMjluK0scRSqDBcJgYJMg.text: The fried chicken was great, but the Nashville style hot chicken was pretty meh - definitely does not compare to the hot chicken I've had in Nashville. Sides were good, the mac and cheese was probably the winner from the ones I tried.

dIO7715dYrFY64Kyhbqqyw.text: Went here a couple times with my girlfriend and actually we never went inside. :)  They have a great patio area and both times we sat outside to enjoy the sun.  The lunches we ordered kicked butt so much so that we came back the next day for lunch again (the zucchini fries are addictive). The servers were great and when we brought our dogs the second time they put some water out for them.  Definitely going back...

eACto3Abyef5CCZg4aKueg.text: Great atmosphere. Awesome outdoor patio. Good beer selection. But the food falls way short. Had the southern fried chicken and had to send it back because it was extremely dry and that's an understatement. I was expecting the food to match the restaurant's vibe but was extremely disappointed. Then ordered the catfish instead. I will say the catfish was cooked perfectly but had no taste. Very bland :/. Not happy with their food. If you want a cool place to drink and hang out then this is perfect but make sure you eat somewhere else before hand!

0bVrkx27NGX6A60E26T5VQ.text: I had the chicken egg croissant and it was so delicious! I've always thought having chicken for brunch was too heavy, but their chicken was so light and delicious that I can't wait to go and try other fried chicken dishes. Even thought its fried, it is really lightly battered and seasoned so well. I never had better friend chicken! I definitely recommend it.

YPCkBY2jGUtubOsiTMBgkg.text: Probably the worst service anyone could ever have. The waitress got everything wrong and when brought to her attention, she tried to blame us. That's not how you do business, ma'am. Food was mediocre at best, but came out cold after waiting over an hour.

ChDR-EMOSxR6Vm0MSAf-0g.text: We are always in search of some great fried chicken in the Charlotte area.  Read online that Leroys had good reviews so gave it a try.  Very disappointed.  We got there early and sat for dinner @5:00.  Ordered the chicken and my son had the catfish.  The chicken was awful.  It was dry and skimpy on meat.  Looked like it was left over from the day before and reheated, it was that bad.  My sons catfish was so greasy it was floating in oil and he could not eat much of it.  We did not complain to anyone while there as you get what you are served and we vote on a restaurants food by either going back, or not.  Leroy fox will not be a place we go back to.  We have a chance and so eat out @3-4 times a week trying different places and revisiting the ones we like often.  Very disappointed in this place and the food that we had was not close to acceptable.

_sWk1JbN6xO9gqWhW65M1g.text: Must say that Leroy Fox has carved out a nice little space for themselves along Sharon Amity. Most of the other locations are lackluster in appearance and seem to get lost in your passing commute.   Leroy Fox is just the opposite. The entire facade stands out with layered, aged beams of grayish brown wood. The juxtaposition of each piece of wood seems to exhibit the careful, yet disheveled, look of the exterior. It goes without being said. This place just looks bad ass.   The interior is HUGE. Much larger than one would anticipate. Mounds of tables and a rather long, full-service and fully stocked bar. A conservative amount of TV's line the walls above the bar. Not too distracting like some other restaurant/bars. Tons of great beers on draught. Locals, too. NoDa and a few from OMB.   The service was fast, friendly and helpful. Didn't visit the table too often, didn't ask too many questions or hound for an up-sell. Just the right amount.   The food...woo. Where to start?   Pretzels: Great. slightly crunchy and neatly seasoned with salt. Three dips to choose from: cheese, ranch and fantastic honey mustard.   Sliders: Beef was so flavorful and smokey. A welcome aroma. Pretty sure on mini brioche buns. Perfect as a standalone or an app split amongst all diners.   Mac n' cheese: Let's just say, if you don't end up getting it, I feel sorry for your taste buds.   My fellow diners had a salad with fried chicken and the tiger shrimp wrap. The wrap looked nice and fresh. Would definitely consider for a lunch option. The salad looks great with nice helpings of lightly battered and fried...uhh fried chicken. I had the serendipitous opportunity to try a piece of the chicken. Divine.   Next time, I'm trying the fried chicken as an entree. This place knows the way to a southerner's heart (in a good way).   Looking forward to many visits in the near future!

zuCT-PeUFOgjCnKIv83sIQ.text: The atmosphere was nice but I expected a bit more from the food.    The mac and cheese was very bland.   We got a chuckle out of the menu.  One can order an entree of 3 sides for $10 or separately order 3 for 3.25 a piece and save a quarter. lol  Made our waiter stammer a little but he was great over all.    I will try this place again soon.

s1p4ChJ0akkVIe7pHKR9ew.text: Despite hailing from the Latin American capital of the US (Miami), I know my Southern grub. It's thanks to South Beach farm to table operations like Yardbird that really set my palate straight. Then I traveled to Charlotte where my local expert led me in the direction of recently opened, Leroy Fox.   This gastronomy focused Southern pub features indoor dining options fit for anyone searching out a finely casual eatery or even an outdoor patio to welcome the hens looking to bask beneath a beating sun. The latter was our choice. Whether you're after a crafty cold brew or a serious spirit, there's a full menu of regional beers and mixology forward cocktails.  For starters, the hot pretzel appetizer arrived with a bouquet of dipping sauces. Between the cheese, honey mustard and ranch, I found my mini pretzels readily diving into the honey mustard time and time again. Then, feeling somewhere between good and glutton, I opted for the fried chicken salad.   I mean, sure, I'll take some greens with my delicately fried tenderloins. Everything danced together wonderfully... naturally, considering fried chicken was in the room. Then again, at Leroy's, "chickens are fresh, all natural, hormone free and blessed." Yes, they're blessed... which must have something to do with how godly they taste going down.  Next time, I'm running for the BLTA (bacon, lettuce, tomato and avocado).

5402GlgIiMq7RDJPRKLbPw.text: The food is really good, particularly the fried chicken (their signature dish).  I also love their side dishes.  I tried the porkchop once as well, which was great!    My only issue is their service is really inconsistent.  I have been here three times.  Of the three, I had adequate service once.  The other two times, the servers were slow--not checking back to see how our food was, not refilling drinks, etc.  Last time, our server was outright rude.  She made several mistakes (forgot our appetizer, cornbread, did not refill water) and only offered a half-hearted apology.  She rolled her eyes at my husband.  Just totally uncalled for.  Honestly, I love their food, but I probably won't go back here when there are so many other options in Charlotte.  They really need to invest in some server training.  Also, it would help to have a manager out walking the floor.  I have never seen a manager here, and would definitely have welcomed the chance to give feedback in person rather than on Yelp.  I really wanted to like this place, but I don't because of the poor service.

6_WKoivrH9ZqyLd_nxvP5Q.text: WOW What a gem!!!!  I love this replacement for the old Hotel Charlotte.  I had the fried chicken - South.  Means dark meat.  $9 bucks for the fried chicken plus one side.  Ya I am lame because I got a side salad.    The chicken itself was tender and juicy.  The batter was gourmet-ish.  It was salty and tasty.  Definitely trying to make it fancy instead of good-ol Price's Chicken Coup style.  It was very good!  And it came with a little container of gravy - i had never had this combination before and I guess you are supposed to eat the two together - YUM!!!!  It was fantastic!!  We will definitely be back!!!

QyIJAChZ5kFwjHKXHchcsQ.text: Pros: No wait time  Good, simple food - great salads, wraps, fried chicken (try the mashed potatoes) Good drink specials (champagne mojito.. yum)  Good atmosphere  Parking  Cons: Sub-par wait service  Pricy cocktails   This is my go to! However, the last two times I went my salad order was missing ingredients. The wait staff was slow (long time to get drinks, extra dressing, not checking up, etc.) and the kitchen took a long time (45 minutes) to get two salads! Yikes!

v747AhljjuyoRmLFOm-mSw.text: Review Update!  I came here on a weekday for lunch and dining room was pretty empty, so we were sat right away.  The server was nice, not super attentive..but the food came out fast.   The Southwest salad that my coworker had was topped with blackened chicken and I sampled it.  It was so delicious and I'm not a chicken person.  The salad dressing was the house and had a mix of  sriracha and sweetness to it. I had the beet salad and it was wonderful as well. Fried beets, avocado, and goat cheese with a white vinaigrette.    The prices are the only thing that gets you. $12 for a salad at lunchtime? Really ridiculous.  I took one star away for that.  I would love to go there for lunch every time I'm in the area, but unfortunately I don't have $12-15 to spend on a lunch salad.  My coworker added blacked chicken and her salad was $16!!!!!!!!! WHHHHHAT?!  They should really look into some lunch menu options with more reasonable price points.
