Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States

AIwoqZ2nhoD5nl11I5y0AA.text: The food was great and our service was friendly. I had buffalo cauliflower - this was spicy. I had a burger - delish. And the bread pudding was ok. I will go back.

PcdgB6bwu_zA9AVk4fDS4Q.text: Great food but if you're going for dinner, know there's a large bar so it's not the quietest (if you care).  The food is great. We had the fried zucchini app. They were good and came with ranch and a slightly sweet buffalo based sauce. I had the shrimp n grits which were some of the tastiest I've had in Charlotte with good sized tasso ham and even a sunny-side-up egg on top. You can get it without the egg which would still be great too. My wife had the chicken fried chicken. The sausage gravy on it made the dish. The green bean casserole is excellent. The Mac n cheese is also good...which is saying a lot because I don't really care for Mac typically.  We went around 6:30 on a Friday night and had great service.

K279ms5kQTrXZ9AD2gE_ZA.text: Extremely slow. Called in for takeout on a Tuesday at 9 for the leg and thigh dinner....946 it's finally ready. The hostess could not have been nicer but man they must smoke a lot of weed in that kitchen. This better be the best friend chicken ever at 11 dollars for two pieces with Bojangles right around the corner

O35F3iMZtCd7bt7yG5XdKA.text: AC was the best server we've had in a long, long time. We've had so many terrible experiences dining out recently, it was a refreshing change of pace to be so well taken care of! Even though it was a busy Saturday morning during the brunch rush, we were greeted right after we sat down & notified that we would be helped momentarily. Everything was efficient and smooth, all of our orders were perfect and our glasses were refilled before they were empty. AC was on fire! We appreciate the friendliness and prompt service we received, thank you AC!!

U0YWDL7AMEfLmz5t5Sktug.text: It has been a while since I have eaten at Leroy Fox. So thus past Saturday I was in the neighborhood and decided to stop in for lunch.  We started out with cocktails, and they do have a nice selection. I got a blueberry smash which was yummy & refreshing without being overly sweet.   I dont eat a lot of fried chicken on a regular basis, so of course being here, I decided to splurge and get that instead of a salad.  I went with 1/4 north which comes with 2 sides and a biscuit. I chose the mac & cheese and succotash.  Honestly, the chicken was not as good as I remembered it being. It was good but not the best fried chicken I have had. The crust didn't have the same spicy kick I remembered. The chicken was tender & juicy, but just lacked a killer crust.  Now, the mac & cheese on the other hand was better than I remembered it being here. I could have just eaten this and been happy!   Sadly, I did not enjoy their succotash at all. It was wayyyyyy too onion-y.  I don't mind a little bit of onion in succotash but this was so bad, you couldn't get a bite without having a mouth full of onions. Bleh!   One other disappointment was the biscuit & gravy. I would actually prefer a good piece of cornbread instead of a biscuit.  Especially since their biscuit is ok but not as good as grandma's. The white gravy was bland as well. Hardly any flavor there.  Of course, we were too full to order dessert but I bet there are some good things to be had here.   Overall, I still like the Fox, but next time i think I will branch out & order something different here.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Blueberry Smash

6DzGbw2YYOv--waBbajk5Q.text: Came on a Monday night around 7:30 and we were able to be seated quickly. For an appetizer, we ordered the pretzel bites which come with questions and honey mustard as dipping sauces. They were so good and so soft! I ordered the 1/4 chicken, Mac and cheese, and the Brussel sprouts. I really liked the Brussels sprouts especially because they had bacon in them and were seasoned really well! The Mac and cheese was also good! The chicken was okay. The skin could use a bit more seasoning but the boom boom sauce was really good! It also comes with syrup but I didn't use it and very large portions! I probably wouldn't go back for the fried chicken but definitely for the sides!   10/10 for customer service it was excellent and they even turned on a light for us when we wanted to picture!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States

lo6veN4GRzpbYK1mWZlBpg.text: This is definitely one of the best fried chicken places in Charlotte--for me it's the best chicken tenders I've ever had! Seasoned perfectly, crispy, juicy... I crave Leroy's chicken so much. To start, I usually get the fried zucchini app, which is actually an awesome alternative to chicken tenders for vegetarians. I tried the blueberry smash drink and it was good, but the food is the star of the show. I've gotten the chicken fried chicken with mashed potatoes and green bean casserole, which was awesome but super filling. I've also gotten the chicken tenders with fries, added on mac and cheese. The mac and cheese is one of the best as well, crispy breadcrumbs are baked on top of the creamy noodles. All in all, one of my favorite restaurants with options to please everyone, especially kids and picky eaters.

YPlTx1x3TciU6FhVXzR-ew.text: Leroy Fox is one of those restaurants that I forget about until I'm in the neighborhood.  I don't know why, because this place is really good!  First off, thanks for not judging me when I come into this restaurant on a weekday sweaty from Flywheel.  Second, this place has a nice mix of healthy and indulgent options.  I'm a big fan of restaurants that stick to their cuisine and style, but offer a variety on the menu.  I usually order a salad with Grilled Chicken, and it always comes out correct (hey, what can I say, to me, the menu is a starting point of ingredients for me to add/take off).  Their chicken and waffles is great if you're there for brunch!  Their outdoor area is really nice when the weather is right.  I sat out here last time and the waiter was completely attentive, which is hard sometimes to find someone when you need something and you're not actually in the restaurant.  I would recommend this place for the following situations: 1. You're hungry after a flywheel class and need a casual place to have a great meal with a friend. 2. You want to watch a game.  Lots of TVs! 3. You're on a double date or with a group of friends and you need a place that's a lively atmosphere, but you can still hear people talk. 4. You're by yourself and just want to have a drink and dinner at the bar.

6DKDKI1zuX7cY4DyZ6iyPQ.text: If there's a place in town that's super slept on, it has to be Leroy Fox. Why? Because this place, hands down, has some of the best fried chicken that I had in this city. Golden, crispy, succulent, juicy, tender and just simply a well executed fried chicken. From their Chicken Fried Chicken dish to their Fried Chicken Pimento & Egg Sandwich, this is some of the best fried chicken that I had in a very long time. Not greasy or burnt or simply tasteless. It is what fried chicken should truly and always taste like.   Their culinary chops don't stop there. If you're a big fan of Mac & Cheese, Green Bean Casserole, Mashed Potatoes and some delicious Nachos, this is the place to go as well. Trust me, it is well seasoned, to the point you don't need any salt to get those exquisite flavors flowing through your taste buds. Now, the portions are kind of small. But trust me, it'll get you full. Take it from a guy, that'll eat not just my plate, but your plate as well.   The servers are extremely courteous, professional and engaging. You can tell they love the place, and I don't blame them. Plus, I love their music selection.   Now, I know you're wondering, why did it only get 4 out of 5 stars, if this place is soooo good? To answer that question, it was based on consistency. The night before as a great example, the Mac and cheese was oozing with cheesiness, that'll melt in your mouth. However, the next day, although the Mac and Cheese was good, the quality wasn't as cheesy. To be honest, I didn't see any of that mornay sauce that they slapped on the night before, and that Mac and Cheese was extremely dry. It had a sprinkle of cheddar cheese on top, but that cheese sauce was non existent.   Would I eat here again? The answer is a HELL YEAH!   Just please have some consistency. After all, nobody wants to go to a place where you are playing Russian Roulette in the quality of the dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States

e6WzV8pNdxq20H_GRsnmfg.text: This is for the Late Night Menu  We arrived a little after 10pm on a Sunday. Not too many places are open. My love had never been here before, so he was down. I was hoping to get something off of the regular menu, but the late night menu had a couple of things I could roll with. I ordered a Guns and Rose'. I like the word play and the drink was very good and strong. See pics.  Service was ok but could have been more attentive. Seemed like the focus was on closing, but they still had an hour to close. We ordered the jalapeno pimento cheese appetizer, and it was good. I wish it was a little but warmer but it had a great taste.  I ordered the naked tenders, they were grilled and tossed with honey buffalo sauce. I would have had more sauce, especially since there was no breading for the sauce to stick to. See pics.  I had enough for lunch the next day.   The grade was very disappointing to me with it being a 90. I may come back again just for a drink.

hWcNcz6L0NjblagX65zGtg.text: Crushed a tower of fried zucchini, pimento cheese dip and THEN had an amazing burger.   Service was FAST and great!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States

DWHFA78A0coI2ofPi3a3Ww.text: Stopped by on a Friday night and were told we had about a 30 minute wait. So, we headed to the bar to grab a seat.  Service started off real slow. We were given a drink menu and we said we would be ordering food then sat for a good 10 minutes waiting for our drinks and appetizer to be taken.  We started off with the pimento cheese app. I've heard very good things about it and it did live it up all the talk. Pita bread was warm and ohhh that cheese. So good! Plenty for two!  Service got better and we chatted with our bar neighbors. They gave us food recommendations and talked about Leroy Fox's new location.   For my entree, I decided to get the sideways plate (three sides of your choosing). I got the sweet potato tots, side salad and mac and cheese. Those tots were delicious! They were covered in cinnamon sugar and came with a side of honey mustard. I normally don't like honey mustard but this stuff was good. The mac and cheese was oh soo delicious. My salad dressing was homemade (I forget what kind) but it was different and good.   I actually would return and order the exact same thing! :) I was very happy with my food choices.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sideways plate (choose three sides)

4ZDjqlv0dHw3BIAfn2wtpg.text: Came here with a large party of maybe 15. There was a small room yo the side that we were put in and it was great for what we were trying to accomplish. The waiters were very through and patient. The food was excellent! The sweet potato tots and the hasbrown casserole are a must. I order the shrimp and grits and they do not come with a side but I ordered those because the waiter said they were the best.  and his recommendation was spot on.  whatever you get, try those 2 sides. I tasted some of my friends food and no one had complaints. I would co.e here again

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. chicken biscuits with gravy and fries
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. deconstructed chicken and waffles
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. custom omelette with hash brown casserole

w50DOqZt-0xjGrTUAWxkJw.text: First time back in about a year. We loved everything we ordered! The chicken dishes were good but the sides stole the show. The zucchini fries and boom boom sauce were excellent but I think the sweet potato tots were our favorite. The jalapeno corn bread was some of the best I've had. We also enjoyed the mac and cheese and the salad dressings have to made in house they were so good. Oh and a small history lesson, the doors that line the wall are from Hotel Charlotte. Hotel Charlotte opened in 1924 and was demolished in 1988.

B7gFNXmMYGywuaIb7pZ3IQ.text: Went here last night and I was pleasantly surprised by the service and the food.  We started off with the zucchini fries and pretzels with different sauces.  The honey mustard sauce with the pretzels and the 'boom boom' sauce with the zucchini fries were my favorite.  I wasn't very hungry, so just got the grilled Buffalo salad, which was very good; love the dressing.  Everyone's meals looked great. Wish I wasn't full going there or I would have stolen from their plates.  I would like to try the pimiento cheese appetizer next time.  The dirty martini was perfect and the Leroy's lemonade was great - love any drink that comes in a mason jar.  The atmosphere was very loud and there were a lot of kids there, so this will be a family night out type of restaurant going forward, vs. dinner with friends/sans kids.  Our waitress was fantastic - knowledgeable about everything on the menu, friendly and very accommodating.   Will definitely be one of our go to restaurants when we go out with the kids.

SBUBZK3veseRFQfB7Nbx9Q.text: I have heard a lot of mixed reviews about LF.  I give them higher marks for a fab patio and delicious cocktails.  I find the food lacking, with the exception of the savory creamy pimento cheese and pita appitizer.  Awesome!t  Obviously, LF is known for fried chicken, so the menu features A LOT of chicken dishes, too many if you ask me.  I went for the chicken fried chicken wih mac and cheese and my friend Lauryn ordered the chicken grill.  My chicken filet was over breaded and too spare on the gravy.  My other side with the mac and cheese was another specialty, the fried zucchini. The zucchini also suffered from an overload of the same batter as my entree.  I did enjoy the creamy white cheese mac and cheese on curly tube pasta (sorry don't remember the italian name for the noodles.) The patio is a relaxing with a rustic vibe and some beautiful hanging plants.  You can tell a lot of thought was put into the patio and it shows.  Our cocktails were quite yummy too.  I had the Selwyn Ave. and  Lauryn chose the Sassy martini, we followed them with Red Sangria (her) and an ice cold Stella for me.  I would definitely hang out again for drinks and apps, but my skip the dinner menu on a future vis

gix2LqHLdPnJh2NQ6DFwlQ.text: My favorite meal is brunch. If I could, I would brunch all of the time.   Leroy Fox served up a great brunch (it didn't hurt that I was in terrific company). My friend wanted to try Leroy Fox because she heard they had a Bloody Mary bar on Sundays, but unfortunately, when we arrived, they didn't. I won't complain about the $4 bloody mary special though, and when I asked for spicy, they definitely delivered. Best bloody I have had in Charlotte (but I hear Boudreaux makes a mean one).  We enjoyed drinks on the patio while waiting for a table outside (we were in a couch,c hair situation). However, everyone who had a table outside never wanted to give theirs up, so after about 1.5 hours of drinks, we realized we still wanted to eat, so moved inside for brunch (it's still brunch if it is 3pm right?).  I really wanted an omelet, but their omelet station closes at 230, so I settled for a traditional fried chicken sando and mac and cheese. SO GOOD. I also shared the pretzel bites with a friend. Definitely get the queso dip with those.  I would love to come back to try some breakfast food (the french toast looked amazing). Overall, the food was solid, our waitress was attentive and it totally was a satisfying brunch. Nom.

Xo0kDqTXrOmDv-yvH4iJgA.text: I went during lunch. Nice place. Fried chicken sandwich was delicious, and sweet potato tots were  amazing. Service was good, prompt and the servers had good knowledge of the menu and beer selection.

xOLFmGuaJGcujD0EVTAdIw.text: I love Leroy Fox for many reasons.   I love there concept and atmosphere of the place. I love the hard wood flooring they have, to the more upscale food but with the casual attitude. I love the half off wine specials they have, to the patio which offers a nice view of the metal ornaments they have on the outside wall.

U9BV4oHj-bsCD6nLyRYKeA.text: If you sit at the bar, even when it's slow, you basically need to flag down a bartender to order anything...and be specific, such as "I would like to order food" so they'll bring a menu. Such things are not automatic here. Practice your flagging technique. You'll need it.   Also, practice your patience because when they actually do stop to wait on you, they will act very put out.   Good for them the fried chicken is truly excellent

4KWi0vXQOblpwpSoqPQ4Iw.text: I finally had the chance to check this place out and its really a step up from a neighborhood bar. Fairly modern for a bar. Nice outdoor seating and the food is terrific.   Yummy zucchini fries, green bean casserole and BLT. That's all I tried and everything was de-lish!  Warm, friendly service. Well minus the hostess...she had a touch of an attitude.

uhe_drSnJDdHjEFD8BXBJA.text: Service was good, drinks were good, food was ok. I ate here some time ago and felt the atmosphere was nice and good place to grab a drink. I didnt too much care for the food. I tried the chicken since thats what they are known for, and I just found it ok. I would go back to hang out and grab some apps.

j73e9b53GDZDjXQpb_g-zQ.text: Caesar salad with chicken- no good. Ordered blackened wings, got buffalo instead but server insisted they were blackened.  Carolina dip is excellent

c-EkEH03hW5dGm4gIPkLdg.text: We have come here a few times now and we always for the fried zucchini. It is amazing with the boom sauce. Which is also great. I dip my fries in the left over boom sauce its that good. I ordered a burger cooked to order which came out medium just like I ordered. My wife ordered the shrimp wrap and loved it. We also both got the Cajun fries which are very good. On Sunday's they have bottom less mimosa as well which is great.

xO_33yj6k5YYN1gEM1yUxA.text: Pleasantly surprised. Food was great and inventive. My only question is why did they spend thousands of dollars to make the place trendy and leave the same disgusting bathrooms Hotel Charlotte had? Weird??

9C0Kgf6u2kLRQ_JOc4iTGQ.text: Hands down, top 3 places to eat in Charlotte and surrounding. Tonight- there was a bit of a wait, always a good sign in my eyes, and boy was it worth it. Greeted by the hostess, friendly and efficient. 40 minutes later, we were taken to our table. Our server, Jabari, was prompt and knowledgeable. Took our drink orders, went over the specials and answered all of our questions as this was our first time here. Drinks were delivered in a timely fashion. Took our orders, all were correct when they hit the table. My husband has the burger with a fried egg (not on the menu but they accommodated. My mother in law had the special, a fish over rice. My meal, front and center trumped them all! Chicken fried chicken, mac n cheese and their fries. It was amazing. Best ever. Dessert was s'mores topped with sea salt Chocolate covered bacon. Jabari's recommendation knocked it out of the park! This guy deserves an award!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken fried chicken with white pepper gravy. Fries, cornbread and Mac n cheese
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. S&#39;mores topped with sea salt and chocolate covered bacon

BRUaWr8AXP2R5o06yc7ktg.text: My husband and I often stop in here to retox after we detox (look for us at the bar in yoga clothes, often still glistening with sweat).  The pretzel bites and the zucchini fries (more like sticks) are fantastic.  The dipping sauces are great!  The boom boom sauce is perfectly spicy... I wish I could recreate this at home.   Dinner:  I did not enjoy my dinner.  Get the fried chicken.  My husband did enjoy his buffalo chicken sandwich.  I had some kind of salad-- obviously not a great choice in a bar but there veggie selection is limited-- it was not great but what is great is their brunch.  I prefer that to their dinner menu.  They also offer bottomless mimosas and bloody marys but-- good grief-- who can partake in that at noon on a Sunday?  Not me.  If you can, stop reading right now and say a prayer of thanksgiving.   The french toast, the omelet, the toast and grits, is all great.  They have a good beer selection on tap.  What they do not have is a good wine selection... this is definitely an area in which they can (and should) improve.  They have several specialty cocktails which usually are good.  There bloody marys are delish... especially the bloody martin.    They have a cute little side room that you can reserve for parties. They have also been generous in the community, hosting fundraisers of various sorts.  Their marketing campaign-- Leroy Fox for President-- was awesome.  I loved seeing those signs in front yards.  "Free chicken for everyone."  This area needed this spot.  Hotel Charlotte had seen its better days... and the face lift and the thorough cleaning this spot got is great.  Even the restrooms aren't awful anymore.  I wish they had left the train running around the ceiling...  This is also a fun place to watch a game.

BKOom1bPYlwrpIhEyxZKYg.text: I like Leroy Fox a lot. Their menu is small, but mighty - I've been craving their zucchini fries since I last had them and their fried chicken and mac n cheese are pretty solid too.   The best part though is sitting outside when the weather's nice with one of their many lovely cocktails or brews. They welcome well-behaved dogs on the patio, so it's a nice walk there and after a few delicious dragonfruit or iced tea cocktails, a pleasantly tipsy walk home.

hu1GnMN44S6pgpn0IzqG0Q.text: I had the chicken fried chicken entree for dinner tonight and it was fantastic. Just the right level of seasoning & juiciness.  The sweet potato tots are addictive! I certainly suggest them for a side. I was a little disappointed in the mac & cheese. I was hoping for something a little more creamy - however I'm a snob for that kind of thing. I will certainly come back!

BIH_2Hum94P1iTLtk-3Ipw.text: Love this local joint. They did a great job with the remodel - from back in the day when it was Hotel Charlotte.  Awesome patio and inside bar with a ton of tvs.  Better than your average bar food.  Great salad choices, wraps, po-boys, etc.  They are known for their fried chicken, but they do have some healthier chicken dishes too.  Don't miss the pretzel appetizer with the kicken' queso!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lounge

oIshQ7lZjEUxJyCVJjFREQ.text: Been twice, once for dine in and once for take out. The dine in experience was much better than the take out. Service was great both times even though the waitress made sure to point out that the burgers were pricey. They will customize your order. The burger was quite tasty. I did not enjoy the bacon marmalade as I did not know it was made with onions (that was my first try of a marmalade). For the to-go trip, the beef was not nearly as tasty. It was disappointing since I had talked up my first experience. I will definitely try it again but there are cheaper, tastier places to get burgers in town.  There are many different types of tables that you could be seated at and there is both indoor and outdoor seating. The seating runs into similar issues as it did when this location was Hotel Charlotte, it can get a bit cramped. The two-tops don't provide a lot of space for food and drinks if you do more than 1 drink/entree per person. If you plan to move along the bar, you'll have to do some scooting and maneuvering if parties are seated at the tables nearby.

H01rHKgbulooeR6l_apFDg.text: Nice to find a restaurant that has the balance of a neighborhood pub, but with a feel of downtown Charlotte. Love the dark wood, open space, right size portions and excellent service.

KhPIty9YE-j9s9NuqIeMVQ.text: Found our new Sunday brunch spot! The mimosas are $3 and the bloody mary's are $4. Everything looked amazing on the menu but as a table of 12, me and 4 of my gfs decided to share the dinner meal of fried chicken (2 pieces of each meat part and comes with two large sides) for $40. The fried chicken itself was great! Not the best I ever had chicken, but eating it didn't make me instantly fall asleep. I look for the amount of oil left in the chicken, the crispiness of the outside and how it stayed together to ensure maximum juiciness. As sides, we got mashed potatoes, green bean casserole, cheese grits, fries and mac n cheese. My friend got an appetizer of the buffalo chicken nachos which were dank!! My only concern was that it took so long to get us our food (one hour and 15 minutes to be exact). We may have been a big party but there were other big parties as well. We couldn't ask the waitress how long our food would take since she didn't come by much until after the food came out.  Regardless.... if you have an out-of-towner, bring them here. This place is screams homegrown Charlotte! Love it.

yz1H2IiL-dekdLeVSDAUIA.text: Leroy Fox has some of the BEST fried chicken in Charlotte!   The atmosphere is very neighborhoody and fun. They have drink specials, and the bar seems to be trained well... I've never had a complaint about a drink.  I love their country fried steak... but the chicken. The fried chicken is seasoned beautifully and fried crispy yet juicy inside. It really is a beautiful thing.  Everyone raves about the zucchini fries, but I just think they're okay.

gdV07TctkXKtYd4u0ie9_g.text: I've been to both Leroy Fox locations and I really like both of them. South end is closer to my house and Cotswold is close to my work so I can't complain about that!   Service has always been great, so whatever they tel their servers to do is working. It does get really crowded at dinner time at both locations, but they take reservations or you can plan to get there earlier. Their drinks are on POINT. I've tasted lots of different ones and I can't complain about any. They did take their Leroy Lemonade off the menu which was my favorite, hence 4 stars.   Their food is delicious and so filling. Everything has a little bit of spice to it though so if you don't like spicy, be careful what you order. Even the fries zucchini app has a kick to it. My favorites are the shrimp po-boy and the pimento cheese appetizer. Noms! I definitely recommend. Oh! And best part, the patios at both locations are dog friendly! Check it out.

VLlfYPXhnd5GRd7UuhZraA.text: So I never write Yelp reviews, but felt I should in this instance. I order the 1/4 North Chicken wing Style, but substitute a thigh for the wing to go. After getting takeout before with the cornbread excluded, I asked the bartender and she gracefully checked. Upon checking she noticed they did not make the chicken wing style. So, I had to wait for the order to be corrected. When I got home and opened the box I noticed that the order was still incorrect, as they gave me a thigh and leg. With me already being home I figured it's too late.  I am not mad, or anything for the food was good. I just know that I paid extra for the substitution ($4.00) and the North 1/4 is $2 more than the South 1/4 which I received...combined with not getting cornbread my prior time I am just disappointed.

gGEMLLEgahvRgvRo86nIyw.text: This place is neat. It's a kept pottery barn inspired rustic bar with decent selection of chicken and side dishes. TVs in comfortable views without overpowering the place. Fairly loud at dinner time.   Appetizers were yummy. My fellow diners enjoyed fried chicken dishes that they said were excellent.   I had a grilled buffalo chicken sandwich and was met with a relatively mild experience. There was no signature flavor, no stand out seasoning, just basic generic buffalo sauce on grilled chicken, slice of cheese, lettuce with a store bought bun. This place is styled in a way that makes me expect some sort of chef twist to the food. Maybe I'm being too hard on this sandwich, it met all the requirements after all.   The mashed potatoes on the side saved my experience. I should have ordered a few bowls of that alone. So good....so good.

waDT1RRMsvypd4uZUW5oAA.text: Tried Leroy again after all of this time and it's just not it. I expected more fries for $13. The wrap was okay. But again, it's just overpriced food. I guess i should try the bar. Get drunk first then order the food. Haha.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Buffalo wrap and fries

o35dzAv4tgdXZ_bAmzU99A.text: The Chicken is great. Starters are mediocre. The Young George Washington and the Queen City Stoplight are a tasty rendition of an overpriced cocktail ( I do not believe on an Earth with $12 craft drinks, they should be more like $10).  The Cotswold location has a private dining option for celebrations ( I would only recommend the space accommodating 10-12 adults comfortably).  The parking options are not grand at all to meet the demand of their shopping center. They could benefit in investing in valet and having the cars parked in one of the businesses lining Sharon Rd.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Young George Washingtons

8P33UKQwW9claci1pYVLgg.text: It took our waiter 3 trips and 15 minutes to get us a cup of coffee. He brought the coffee, but no cream, sugar or spoon. Then he brought the spoon...but no cream...no sugar.  It was a foreshadowing of the rest of our experience. This was especially frustrating because it was Game Day...Panthers hosting the Buccaneers. Entertaining friends from out of town. No lie, it took us 45 minutes to get our food for a party of 4. We were there at 11am and it wasn't even that crowded. By the time we left, we missed the kick off and the first TD.  I had the eggs benedict which was just OK. Ask me if I ever got the refill on the coffee?  So many other choices, take another one.

zfW_GGDYRLxF7xNNTm2BlA.text: Turning away business because your kitchen can't handle volume is heartbreaking. The food is usually good but you can't order to-go during regular dinner hours. I never post reviews, but this has happened 3 out of the 4 times we've tried to order. Disappointing.

hjoXxQJzLS-xexu0JrZn6w.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte! I often end up back here whenever I'm visiting - it's simple, convenient and serves up delicious chicken.   Food: I HAVE to start every meal here with the pretzel bites - the honey mustard and queso sauces are the perfect compliment to truly perfect, pillowy bites of pretzel bread. I also highly recommend the wings. They are fresh and never frozen, which makes a huge difference (and comes with a price tag). For my main, the pimento & egg sandwich is fabulous if you're super hungry and not worried about your cholesterol. Any of the chicken dishes are good as well: fried chicken, chicken lizzies, fried chicken salad, etc. For your sides I would go with Brussels (something green!) or mashed potatoes.   Drinks: Don't get me wrong, the cocktails here are good (shout out to the Russian ruby rose and cucumber basil lemonade). But they are definitely pricey for this area of Charlotte. It's always weird for me when my cocktail is more expensive than my whole food order. The beer menu is extensive and a little more budget-friendly.   Atmosphere/Service: The interior restaurant space is large with patio space, so there's usually tables available for walk-ins. There's also a side room available for rental for large dinner/lunch parties. I've always been a huge fan of the wall of street names here - it's definitely fun to look at if you're a Charlottean. The fox theme is cute without being too in-your-face. I've always had pretty good servers here, so I'd say service is adequate. Parking can be tricky during peak hours because it's a shared lot.

9oCTGepgbUDGNfO9ujgbLw.text: I agree with the 3.5 overall stars but rounding up to a four.  My friend and I were starving and came to Leroy Fox around lunch time on a Sunday.    We were seated at a cute high top table and our friendly waitress came over right away for our drink order.  On Sundays they have $4 mimosa specials which is a good weekend deal in charlotte.  We each ordered a mimosa and ordered the blackened shrimp wrap with our drink order.   Our drinks came out promptly along with some waters.  We then waited a long time for our food after we got our drinks.  We said multiple times where is our food?  This is taking forever.  When the food came out it was all really good and fixed perfect, but we had to wait too long for our food.  I would come back if I'm wanting to sip a couple of mimosas and I don't mind a long wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States

ImeK3o116NyebS9oe_Ujwg.text: Wow.  What a find.  The location wouldn't make you think it's so great.  This is one of the best spots we have hit in Charlotte so far!  The fried chicken here is excellent, different than others in Charlotte.  It is not as breaded, but sill has an excellent taste.  It was very very affordable to eat the fried chicken dinner as it came with two sides and a biscuit.  You left full, but not super full dreading the walk to the car because you can't even move.  For sides, I recommend the sweet potatoe tots (MUST) and the zucchini fries.  The Mac n cheese is good, but not as thick as others.  Just depends on your type.

e-Jafe8bscS9XxRfNQDwTw.text: Super Bowl Sunday! Sunday Funday! It's time for brunch, brunch, brunch!   This was my first time visiting Leroy Fox. My New Years Resolution was to try new restaurants in the Charlotte area. Great resolution right? I decided to explore the menu before arriving, thank goodness! The weather was super nasty! I arrive thirty minutes late to brunch! UGH! Thankfully, my friend made a reservation for eleven people. The staff was both accommodating and patient with us. First order of business, Mimosas! Which are four bucks on Sunday's. Winning!!!   I choose the Chicken & Waffles. This was served with a peach compote, over-easy egg, and a Belgian waffle. The chicken was fried to perfection and seasoned perfectly!! The Peach compote was soggy and unnecessary, and the egg.....was not over easy. Of course, I ate the chicken and the waffle, duh! I left the peach compote and egg on the dish.  I selected the Mac & Cheese as my side item. The breadcrumbs were a perfect addition!    So will I come here again? Yes. I'm interested in trying the crab cake benedict and french toast with cannoli cream.    FYI, I would highly advise arriving early or make a reservation for a good seat.

jpIQFDQGimOVh7Fh551IYA.text: Mac and cheese! Nachos! Burger! ALL OF IT WAS AMAZING! And don't get me started on that damn cookie dessert! The atmosphere is very relaxed and chill, great place to just stop in. We had a great waiter and a wonderful time. Will for sure be going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Sandwich
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rib-eye burger!

VWcK57Dvx9R4NJYi_CPqDg.text: Everyone has told me about the Fried Chicken at Leroy Fox!. I finally got to taste it! I must say I am a fan. Went in between Lunch and Dinner yesterday, which was a Sat and got right in.  Had a nice waitress, who explained the menu. I ordered the Chicken Fried Sandwich. It was a huge piece of white meat of chicken, fried with a delicious batter on a reg bun. I got the most delicious little Sweet Potato Tots! They were sprinkled with Cinnamon sugar! We also had the Fried Zucchini for an Appetizer. Huge slices, but fried crispy and crunchy. My sandwich did come with a side of sausage gravy, which was filled with sausage. I had to ask for some mayonnaise, the sandwich was just plain on the bun. But it really was a GREAT piece of Fried Chicken! I will also recommend this establishment for their Chicken..go and try it!

kZP-w3_WIUvLOlObC1RbiA.text: I'm constantly on the hunt for a new brunch place. So this weekend, I tried out Leroy Fox. I'd been here before for dinner but this was my first time experiencing their lunch.   I came with a pretty large group, it was about 15 of us and the staff was accommodating and very kind. We were in the room right by the front door, which worked out great. It gave us just enough privacy to really enjoy our time there. Tip! If you're looking for a cool place to host a brunch or dinner (check them out).   I started with the mimosa, it was quite tasty. For my meal, I ordered the chicken biscuit with scrambled eggs and sausage gravy. The sausage gravy was not quite what I expected. I wouldn't order it again.   But the chicken was well seasoned and nice a hot when it arrived. I can definitely see why that's a restaurant favorite! I was also able to sample the chicken and waffles, hash brown casserole and sweet potato tots. All of which I recommend.   I'm looking forward to giving them a try again and sampling their lunch or dinner items. For now, they are A-OK in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States

mr3G3VV4WlF9XslL0IcT4Q.text: Nice restaurant with a friendly team of people. I came on a Sunday night and there was plenty of parking. They have a shared lot with several places on the strip. They had the duke versus kanas game on and there were several families present. I was greeted no reservation needed and soon seated. They got my drink order to me quick but after that it it got a bit slow. I had the bourbon themed drink it was wonderful. They have good bar bites and nice place to relax. They have a small section in the front where you can do a small private party or gathering. I had the chicken wrap with the honey mustard on the side and it was pleasant. A friend of mine ordered the fried chicken and felt it was too salty. They have sweet potato tots which is very different. We also had the wings no sausage fried hard and they were okay. I would recommend. It's a casual setting with easy crowd.

by38dS-podGAPmFB4DyYlQ.text: I am a fan! After seeing mixed reviews, I almost didn't give Leroy Fox a chance and what a mistake that would've been. A friend was in town and we needed a place for lunch on a Monday. Turns out every place we wanted to try was closed, womp womp. We came in to LF around 2pm, place was quiet but it was Monday. After tasting our food my friend said, "why are they not slammed?" It's //that// good. I ordered the tenders and fries, she ordered the fried chicken on the bone with gravy, mac and cheese and green bean casserole. I will say not a single bite was left behind on my plate. I know what you're thinking, "it's just chicken tenders and fries, how good could it be...?" It was //that// good. I don't know if their sauces are made in house but the honey mustard is a must. If it's not made in house then I need to know what brand it is so I can hoard it at home. My friend was also raving about her plate; I dipped my fries in her mac and cheese sauce.. oooh! By dipped I mean to say I scraped the cast iron pan clean. I will definitely be back!  p.s. Don't skimp and skip the cocktails. The blueberry smash tastes like summer in a glass.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mojito
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Elizabeth
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Artwork in waiting area

iAy3F5tTPnGurS9ttsilyQ.text: My boyfriend and I frequent Leroy Fox often. Overall, the food is tasty and consistent. I couldn't give it 5 stars because I don't feel the wait staff always has it together. Food wise, it is a great spot and great option for when you're in the mood for take out.

bia-BhPuoOAbxJ1H9dsApQ.text: I went here Sunday afternoon with some friends. My review is of the food because Adam's customer service was good. I got the salmon w/ citrus olive oil and Brussel sprouts and a side salad as my side. Sadly, the salad was the best part of the meal. The Brussels seemed over cooked and it was like chewing bubblegum. The salmon was just ok. I did like the $4 mimosas! I sampled my friend's green bean casserole and it was also just ok. My other friend's mashed potatoes came out cold so he didn't eat them. My friend said her black bean burger wasn't great either and she could only eat it with ranch. I would still give this place another try...eventually.
