1lk3bTUU8RMSqdxvJdEsHQ.text: Awesome chicken!!!  Need a little patience because the chicken is cooked to order and takes a little while, but worth the wait...

iBXFedw0Uh3eTvYZsNpG7Q.text: I went to this place back in November.The food was good. I would recommend this place for brunch.

n7bs68_jpyH03VkyWHC-9Q.text: Great chicken fried sandwich and we looove the zucchini fries.  Beer selection was great too.  Defiantly would recommend Leroy Fox to friends.

-_rzfL8XHB5amOdbIgZiLQ.text: OK. I must be fair. Since my last review, I have visited this establishment several times. (It's near my work/home.) And I have to say...  WELL DONE!!  They have stepped EVERYTHING up. Servers have learned to acknowledge their regulars. The food has shifted and changed in quality to the point of, well...pretty darned good yumminess! And, truly, their outdoor patio, just can't be beat. It's gorgeous. Amazing "live" art. TV's and just the right amount of shade/sun for those who love shade/sun.  So - I'm completely changing my story. And I'm completely thrilled to do so! And I'm completely going back. Again....and again.........and again.  Yay! Another yummy neighborhood spot!!

heXxYa47MfcpnATABmTkBg.text: If NO star was an option I would give it! I cannot tell you how many times this restaurant has effed up our ToGo orders! They are beyond incompetent! If it wasn't for my wife loving this boring ass salad I would never go there again! I am not sure if it's malicious intent or they just don't have a clue but it never fails it always happens! I order a side of mac n cheese and they give me green bean casserole, I say no onions add cheese and they give extra onions and No cheese! They point blank forget items...they are the worst! The food is mediocre at best! They have a buffalo sauce that's too hot and not flavorful. Supposedly their regular fried chicken is good but so is Bojangles....you can buy good fried chicken anywhere and get Real service! The place is beyond loud, so don't think you are going to hear any conversation at your table. In summary, Mediocre food, loud and guaranteed to screw up your order! Save yourself and eat somewhere else!!!

-VH8cZP7RTwBCD9M-oO9xw.text: Last night I finally made it out to Leroy Fox! This place is such a great spot to eat and hang out. Tons of TVs to check out the games and the seating is nicely setup. Friendly, quick service. I had their southern style fried chicken which reminded me of my grandmother's recipe. Great mac & cheese too. But the best was their corn bread muffins. . . . I need more!   This place is def one to try out!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Try the South Fried Chicken &amp; Mac &amp; Cheese!

XSY5pYDcmIOeQDAS6DKshg.text: We've been here several times and unfortunately this place is just not doing well. Even on a saturday night at 7pm they weren't that busy. Unfortunately service was still very slow. It took a long time to get served and we never had the same person serving us through the entire night. The only thing we really like here are the zucchini fries. The chicken is way over priced and not better than you'd find at publix. We also tried the nachos, they were decent at best. The sweet potato tots are good too, but I'm pretty sure they just fry those from a frozen bag.

gZKHQqLnCcWxqytCTodImg.text: The pimento cheese and cornbread muffins are great! Getting one star for the pimento cheese!  The fried chicken isn't special - I think the oil needed to be changed. The macaroni and cheese was wet and cheese-less. Expensive for fried chicken.   So what had the most hype wasn't great but I did like a couple things. Got seated right away during  peak time Friday night and waiter was attentive. The restaurant looks nice too.

2E8uzcP_HPUIFE-OsMfvNQ.text: Southern style cuisine at it finest! A little noisy but its not enough to keep me away! You just can't go wrong with this place or any of the other sister restaurants Cowbell, and Mortimer's! Great Environment, and Amazing Food. Chicken Fried Chicken with cheesy grifts

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Fried Chicken perfection, cheesy grits, and mashed potatoes with white pepper gravy. Killer Southern Style Food!

r89sg1ayh7H2IPGANsS_ZA.text: I can only rate the bar. They have a great selection of local craft beer on draught. There are daily specials. Through the restaurant I see multiple tables with young children and some in hi chairs. Thus leaving the impression they are family friendly.

xuXsP5qsULnWS-AUxX2OJg.text: The berry chicken salad is SUPER good and they have $3 mimosas for brunch! The wait was a little long, though. Make a reservation before you go.

KjEUS6V8lnlzLMFWgNaPyQ.text: Eat here. Do it. Dooooo it. Big fan of Leroy Fox in Cotswold. Stopped in here a few times now. And always excited when I do. Out front is a covered patio, perfect for any summer weather since there's plenty of shade. Only downside is small patio so I always have my fingers crossed I can eat or drink outside but have yet to do so... next time I venture to Cotswold, I'm going to awkwardly stare at patio tables til someone gets uncomfortable, leaves and I can jack their table... you've been warned. But the inside is relaxing - cool, laid back vibe with a long bar and a front area decked out with couches for your lounging pleasure.  The menu is sensational with southern-inspired entrees scattered throughout. Last time I stopped in, my date and I posted up at a table and started with the zucchini fries. Whoa. Very good. The fried coating around the zucchini rods was seasoned perfectly. And out app was served with boom boom sauce, a orangish dip with a slight kick. Perfecto. Believe these fries would also rock with a side of sour cream.  Next I opted for the grilled chicken club. Fresh ingredients and drizzled with a sweet honey mustard. Light dinner choice (if you're starving I wouldn't advise it) which is exactly what I wanted. And I snagged the mac and cheese as a side.  I saw a list of drink specials for every day of the week, which I love when specials are valid on the weekends as well, yet I chose just to stick to a refreshing Angry Orchard.  Already decided my next meal there will be the honey buffalo sandwich, topped with blue cheese crumbles and sweet green tomatoes... you got to know a place is good when I already have my next meal planned out!

5Cp9b1qN0JJDc-6MtezE_g.text: Such a beautiful renovation from the former Hotel Charlotte. Though I miss the train I am okay with open spaces. Always love coming here to feel nostalgic. It's okay though because the honey mustard is still the same.  I had the pretzel appetizer tonight. I might go back just for that. With the cheese (worth the extra $1). Also Tuesday is half priced wine. So...you know I'll be back.

qd4kK2-_l9k1pNHg_km9FA.text: Great food.  Had the Elizabeth and the fries are amazing and Country Fried Chicken with sweet potato tots and green bean casserole. Will definitely be back.

Pm3UzlYLtlqV5Llw-ZZAFA.text: Such good southern food!  The BEST mac&cheese ever!  They've got everything...chicken fried chicken, shrimp&grits, burgers, zucchini fries!  Patio will most definitely be packed when it's nice out!  There is usually a wait for tables on weekend evenings- but that's typical for any great restaurant on that time. Try this during the week if you aren't a fan of crowds- as the tables are really close which makes for some interesting acrobatics to maneuver around them and seated patrons.

7zyBCPBuJJeDIFvs9_ouvQ.text: Fried Zucchini Sticks are great, nice atmosphere, and good wine selection. Patio is nice and covered and you can bring your pup! Headed there this afternoon!

gbz4NaMvcmgVycKajaeIkA.text: went there a few weeks ago and got really Bad service which made the food taste really bad.  We were seated and placed drink, appetizer and food order.  Another party sat next to us about five minutes later, they got their appetizer and food before us. we sat there watching other folks get served; I asked for a manager and never got one.  Still waiting for our food and some guy comes to our table and wanted to clear our table ( we haven't received our food yet).  I went up to the hostess and asked for the manager and manager never came; no apologies from the wait staff. Finally get the check but I did not tip my usual and wrote a note on the check for the manager to call..........still waiting for that phone call

PIXzOP5qw337dbRId5BYOw.text: This place is truly one of Charlotte's BEST kept secrets.  They helped to make my son's college graduation celebration memorable in a very good way.  From the food & drinks, to our most professional waitress, to an AWESOME manager - Mikey.......I cannot wait to revisit.

LjdKgArxsVF6SOsbG1Iu1A.text: Fantastic food and wonderful atmosphere! Came here for brunch and we were seated fast. Recommend the chicken and waffles which was delicious. Portion size was great as well. My boyfriend got the chicken sausage and biscuits which he loved as well. Only bummer for me was that I came too early to have a Bloody Mary and brunch here is only on Sunday. Can't deduct stars for that though. Will be back to try dinner and cocktails!

Cm4ZJL3snLUd6UHHN8jreg.text: I'm glad they opened this place up in Cotswold - a neighborhood joint with plenty of TV's and a decent menu.  Because I'm adamantly opposed to Eddie's Place (in the same shopping center) Leroy Fox is a decent alternative.  I like the decor - kind of trendy, southern comfort, hipster.  Sort of looks like pottery barn barfed all over the entry way.  The little outdoor area will be nice in the spring - if you like looking at parking lot views - but it'll be brutal come July.    The food was good, not great.  I had the shrimp po-boy with shoestring fries, the wife tried the chicken fried chicken, and my son had a the chicken fingers and grits.  The fries were great, the shrimp was cooked well, seasoned decently, and overall was a decent sandwich.  The verdict on taste was that the food was decent.  Better than bar-food, but certainly no gastro-pub.    The one take-away from the food?  PORTION SIZE - holy meatballs batman.  Seriously, you're not leaving hungry.  I'd be surprised if this place turns a profit knowing how large each of the meals was.  Each plate was enough food to feed at least two people - including my sandwich plate!  It's not an exceptional value type place, I have to say.  The three of us (considering my son is 15 months old) dropped about $45 for lunch - with no alcohol.  I'd much rather get a smaller portion for $3-$4 less a plate.  I'd probably come back again for lunch, but will certainly keep in mind the portion size and look to see if I can order of the kids menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States

Ui8kLn71f2l4MnLs5cdhXA.text: I'd heard about Leroy Fox and had been wanting to check it out.  Believe me when I tell you LEROY FOX DID NOT DISAPPOINT!  We of course had the fried chicken (1/4 North).  It was amazing!  The flavor was great. Even in the usually bland breast meat, the brine they use gave it great taste.  The skin was crispy and was seasoned beautifully.  For a side, I tried the zucchini fries.  They were recommended and well worth it.  The rest of the menu looked good.  But I can't wait to go back for more fried chicken!  Outstanding!

TPJ3lidbVhjp8bt5BQ541A.text: Love Leroy's! The bar is long so there is enough space to sit solo or with a group of friends. They have a great outside space to enjoy on those fun summer nights or heat lamps are greatly appreciated on those not so warm evenings. I enjoy the modern twist to a casual waterhole. They have fun bites, I would suggest the pretzel bites or fried green tomatoes? You're welcome in advance :-)

T9HCEC-EOHjqfslkhvpcAQ.text: What a disappointment, the service was slow and my chicken sandwich came out undercooked....yuck! When they offered to cook it more I refused and just asked to take it off the bill because I had lost my appetite after taking a bite of warm, raw chicken. Will not return.

HCJsrcUmzZ160SnlGA_3Jw.text: I live down the street from Leroy Fox and I eat food from there at least once a week. The salads are amazing, with all their homemade dressings. I also love their tiger shrimp wrap. My favorite things are their fries, pretzels, and all their dipping sauces. I think their menu has a little bit of everything and its a place you can go when you are not quite sure what you feel like. I guarantee you wont be disappointed with anything on their menu.

Jza-mvc2BzncbuyOBvm4kA.text: Leroy Fox has become our go-to place when we want a casual bar and grill that is a notch above  places on Montford Dr. and has more personality and better food than the regional sports bar chains. The food is not your typical bar food. It has a definite Southern theme and the fried items are, unfortunately for my waistline, their strength. Fried chicken and fried zucchini border greatness. The staff is always very good too. It can get a little loud and the patio is sorta weird because it is basiclaly in the parking lot with a wall in between. Sometimes its crowded and sometimes its wide open. We have gone on Friday nights and had our choice of tables with zero wait, and we have also had to wait on a Wednesday. The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because the parking is a pain and the patio is not the best. But if you want a bar and grill and want to step off the beaten path, this place rocks.

EAuBtK2xAhd7eIUWsEDhNg.text: I love their pretzels!! So delish! They also have a great chicken salad.  My only issue is that their champagne is $38 a bottle- would be ok if the bottle was worth that but other places sell it for $24.

BzrcGcz3_c567yR902AKbA.text: First I want to say that I have waited until last weekend to visit Leroy Fox's. I wanted it to get the newness out of the way . What I found on last Sunday early evening  was  sadly that I should have waited longer. Let me explain#1 My date and I went early enough to have some time before the busy time to talk and enjoy the Sunday at a new place to eat. When the server came to take our drink order I had told her that it was our first time and needed her help around the drinks and food... She offered a starter that we ordered when it came we found it was so really over coated w/batter that it was a pile of batter on a plate that she took away.  She then by that time had come by 3/4 times asking too many questions about what we had in mind to eat...Isn't that alot?  When knowing we had never been there before and were in deep conversation each time..It didn't seem to matter to her as we could see on her face as she walked away. ..We did order main dishes ,2 of the same and they came cold .  And with food still on the plates she again and came back 2 more times to ask if we wanted more food ......No we wanted to finish our food and conversation w/o her there with us .I don't think I have ever had that much inter-action with a server anywhere........ It was a Sunday early night meal ,not a Friday or Sat date night w/a packed house...... I ask that this be looked into and hopefully this does not happen to others.. I ask that this be a learning tool........ It does look very nice and that seems to be the best I can say.

XHEmmBXdVrXorEHrETI3MQ.text: I wish I could give it a negative start, if possible. Our waitress was kind of hung over and took away my plate before I finished eating. The grilled chicken in my sandwich was over-grilled, hard and burned, and none of the people in my group loved their dishes. Overall, I can't think of a reason to come here again, even the patio is beautiful.

D5x4fWIrDXbUuOMpIx6ObQ.text: Enjoyed a spur of the moment decision to try Leroy Fox Friday night. We arrived at 7 was told there would be a 30 minute wait place was PACKED! They have a really comfy waiting area divided into seperate spaces so you don't feel like a herd of cattle. Wait was as promised love what they did with the place after Hotel Charlotte. They kept the charm and the hotel doors love them! I had the Sweet Caroline chicken sand. Husband had the fish and chips. Both were fantastic he wished the fish was not catfish but hey he ate it all. Will return again. Great outside eating area.

vOVPiS_12d3BZVjuDb36pg.text: I attended the Great Gatsby themed New Year's Eve and I really wasn't pleased with what I tasted. The decor and the theme were great and the service was also really good. The Gatsby themed drinks were really good. These things are why I rated it the two stars that I did. The food however, was terrible. I was expecting something reminiscent of what their menu looked like online but I was wrong. To start off with they brought us our shared appetizer plate which consisted of 4 small stuffed button mushrooms were cold, 4 deviled eggs which were alright but nothing to brag about, and some crudites.. which was 4 cherry tomstoes, a few slivers of red pepper and some dry Brocolli. The next thing brought out was our choice of appetizer. Everyone got the pigs in a blanket and I got the oysters. Both were pretty good in my opinion. Then the Waldorf salad came out; it was soggy and weird. After that we were planning on where we were going to go after the main course because we were sure it would be disappointing.. We were right. I got sea bass with truffled risotto and it was down right terrible. I still want to give the restaurant a chance when there isn't another event solely because all the prior reviews

b5tqJPMcAl3-DZSiTHCF4w.text: I enjoy going to Leroy's on my way home from work..great place to meet up with friends, the bartenders attentive along with the wait staff.  Their specialty is fried chicken, which is quite good, but the remainder of the menu is just OK.  I have yet to get excited about the apps...to really make this place be a standout is to improve the menu...quality of the food...currently the apps are equal to Chili's

KL8IDGpwdLHz4yvLAnT4jA.text: Excellent chicken and other offerings! Zucchini appetizer comes with unique dipping sauces; grilled buffalo chicken BLT salad delicious if you like a little spice; signature fried chicken is outstanding! Sampled the salmon salad and can recommend it as well.  Very accommodating; charming al fresco venue as well as small, private dining room available.  Prompt and gracious service.  It has become a local favorite after the first visit, and there have been numerous since! Looking forward to revisiting often.

Im6RfUHNDpilmqlxs5na7g.text: Really good food and lovely outdoor seating! Service could have been a bit better- for it not being super busy it was rather slow. Had a couple annoying bees outside. Pimento cheese sandwich was delicious, as well as the Brussels sprouts and grits!

O8skzHUCL7JXEIFRccApDw.text: Cracker Barrel quality with Southpark prices :(  What is all the hype about with this place?  I ordered the chicken fried chicken with pepper gravy, Mac n cheese, and mashed potatoes.  My husband ordered the $22 pork chop with Mac n cheese, and baked potato.  The pork chop was tiny, maybe 6 oz which is absurd for a $22 entree, and it was over cooked.  The mac n cheese was bland and watered down.  Both of entrees were like warm, not hot and fresh.  My fried chicken was good.  In addition, all kids meals are $7, and again, small portions, just 2 small chicken tenders.  I rarely complain about portion sizes, but when the portions don't justify the prices, I have an issue.  Overall not a do over and a waste of money.

Xumv_Caly37s4dhs4ch6PQ.text: I like going for brunch. My two favorite items are the fried zucchini spheres and the Challah Toast. The atmosphere is cozy, but elevated so that you can have a nice experience.

pdqNvGPXsZIHr9AZ3rpLHw.text: The photos of the food here always looks amazing, but a few things will keep me away.  Dinner with my family and friends was not as we had hoped. The server seemed miserable, the food was cold when it finally came, and the table beside us was complaining the entire time and when they asked for the manager.... they never came.  My suggestion is to head a few doors down to Eddie's, different atmosphere and food but way more worth your time.

VsSluFNrMpHfaawutagYvQ.text: Their fried chicken is delicious. I can't eat it anymore but I would kill for it. They give a good size portion with a couple of sides. The atmosphere is very relaxed, friendly. The service is good too.

x3a7OsDcY_k9QGj6eaIUNw.text: This place is good, but nothing special. It sort of reminds me of a independent version of Chilli's. The service is ok and the food is good, but not fantastic. They're open late, which is a huge plus. I would definitely go back for a casual, quick meal.

yuxu022XK4LRT_oQyalJJQ.text: love the food and the service is amazing. dont change a thing! kayla is my favorite and megan does a great job! hats off to you all!

8D7bdancsXyaF2Deth-2qQ.text: I just realized that I haven't written a review of this place yet. Shame on me!!  I came here with my family one night and it was a really good experience. The food was good and came out hot and the pumpkin beer I had came in a sugar rimmed glass... That may be a no-no for some but I loved it. I've also been to an event here and it was one of the better Yelp events I've been to!! Anytime I can legitimately wear my pajamas to a party I'm in!!   I am using them to catering my company's holiday party so I can't wait to review then again for that!!

GNP7FGdmFGZ4iLGfx3BJAg.text: Decent place, often hard to get a table on Friday and Saturday night.  It's become a family spot for a good bite.

Rj8oeBIAuqLHpMNYihffgg.text: I had the Pimento & Egg Sandwich and it was incredible! The fried chicken was very tender and crispy. Most places can't do that without making the chicken soggy. The bacon was crisp and not too hard to bite into. The fried egg on the sandwich was perfect. Not runny or messy. Just right. There was an orange sauce there as well. No clue what that was, but it complimented the other ingredients very well.  My waiter was very kind and had personality. Not cut and dry like most dine-in restaurants these days. He checked on me to make sure everything was good every few minutes without making It seem like he was forced to do so.  I also had the Delirium Tremens beer and it complimented what I had very well. It was a light beer, possibly the best light beer I've ever had with a slightly sweet taste with a nice kick behind it.   Lastly, I had a brownie dessert that included a light brown brownie with chocolate chips, ice cream, caramel, chocolate drizzle and whipped cream. It was absolutely one of the best desserts I've ever had.   All together, it's a very warm environment with charm and you can tell they have standards for their upkeep as well as their food. My waiter made the experience one I'd come back for. I'm big on people, and you can tell at least from my experience that they have at least one great guy on deck. Go there!

iwtSzEuyu4NP2aouu1KicA.text: Friendly service and plenty of space inside. It just gets crowded with the limited outdoor seating on nice days. Prices were fair and the chicken was a hit or miss.  We ordered the breast, leg, and thigh platter, and unfortunately, they gave us two thighs instead of a breast.  After informing the server, he immediately suggested to get us a breast piece, even though I told him not to worry. Once that piece arrived, it was freshly cooked, making it perfect and juicy.  However, a friend at the same table ordered the same thing, and afterwards said that his piece was too dry and needed extra hot sauce to liven it up. Dry breast meat is the worst, so hopefully you get a fresh piece.  Not sure if I'd gamble again on the chicken.  Will have to try some of their other dishes.  Also, we really enjoyed the sweet potato tots as probably the best thing to get off the sides menu.  An afterthought is their banana pudding.  For serving southern style fried chicken, their banana pudding was plain and the wafers were hard.  They need a better recipe for that.

9UMrZg152cPPFiqJz35GEw.text: After our very unfortunate experience we ended up giving LF another shot, on a very busy Friday non the less, and everything about the experience was great. We still frequent LF regularly & have yet to have another bad experience. The service and food are nothing short of amazing every visit!

pI2MXFfHnq_TvJKbyu4fBw.text: This is a really cute place to grab a bite. It's my go to spot for a good meal. The service is always friendly and helpful. The outside patio is really cute and the inside is cozy as well. The food is yummy and there are good portions. I always recommend this restaurant to folks looking for a good meal!

OJcyrkUwba110_76U-2EcA.text: Amazing service and amazing food. Has TVs like a sports bar, but still a great casual dining atmosphere without the noise of a normal sports bar. Our waitress, Acey made us laugh the entire night. She gave great recommendations and checked on us frequently. The food was out of this world good. Simple but delicious. The chicken fried chicken was juicy and done to perfection. The macaroni and cheese might be the best I've ever had and the green bean casserole topped it all off. The Tollhouse cookie dessert didn't disappoint either. Warm, gooey, melt in your mouth delicious. Also, I'd highly recommend their cocktail selection. I had the blueberry smash! Definitely going back and can't wait to try the Southend location!

fYETXBAnmeqw7AYCK8fOyg.text: The outdoor seating is awesome! Food was mediocre, I thought the fried chicken had too much pepper and the Mac and cheese was not good at all. The chicken that was on the salad was almost all fatty pieces. I'm guessing it was a rough night in the kitchen because everything was great on my previous visit.

bmBPlxEbqVYNZOS89HwTyw.text: With the exception of the slow service (expected due to mothersday) the overall experience was pretty good food was great. Would make it a stop for viaitors.

YreviWlJ9-A_DPG6bYeE3Q.text: Went here with the wife tonight. Because of our schedules, we usually have dinner late (Late usually being around 10pm, sometimes later) I went to my trusty Yelp app to find "late night" restaurant options nearby and poof, found Leroy Fox.  Driven by this place a number of times, but never knew that it would be so cool inside. Upon reading a few reviews from friends it was "Go time!"  I really like the layout. Big tables. Very comfortable space in the dining room. You can sit at the bar, sit at big tables or booths. I know, that's just like everywhere. But this is different. It's cool. Trust me. The way it's set up if you're at a booth, you're not that close to the bar. So if you're on a date or something you won't have to be around too much rowdiness.   It felt like just the right amount of tvs in there too.Some places have too many tvs and it's almost distracting. They hit that perfect balance here.  There's also a very cool outdoor seating area. I can see myself coming back for evening drinks or happy hour or something. Very cool outdoor area with tvs.   Now onto the food and service.   The menu looked awesome and we were super excited to try some of the things on the menu. Then we were informed that because of the time we could only order from the late-night menu. It was kind of a bummer since obviously the late night menu isn't as comprehensive. We had to compromise from our first choices. But my wife enjoyed her chicken sandwich and pasta salad. My chicken tenders and fries were pretty solid too. I look forward to coming back and trying some of their other specialties.   The service wasn't bad. Our hostess got our drinks started and server took care of the rest. He was friendly and chill. He wasn't super attentive, but it was later in the night and things usually are slower. Overall the service was fine.  The prices were reasonable and they even have a cool selection of gifts/shirts, etc.I could see myself buying a shirt one day. LOL  In any event, I like this place a lot, Definitely recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tenders and shoestring fries from the late night menu

ayarpQ9Vwh-C1s2rYCmSCw.text: One of the best restaurants in Charlotte. Sweet potato tots and fries shrimp are amazing. I have not tried breakfast yet but I saw plate after plate heading out of the kitchen and it looked so good! Bonus points for the awesome comic shop next door.

aA7OXU1woGc64xrYKU614A.text: Me and my girls went there on Sunday after church. We order salads and the zucchini fries as appetizer. I have never tasted season less food like I had there. This wasn't a great place for me. The service saved the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Taste less
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken was so bland

vEjbMGO-ASyPQb-dobIUOA.text: Oh Leroy Fox, your zucchini fries stole my heart (or rather, my stomach) at first bite.  I can't say this place necessarily has a lot of healthy eats, but what they do have is some pretty tasty Southern cooking.  My partner and I have been here twice now for dinner.  Both nights we came, this place was PACKED.  The tables are pretty close together, making it a little difficult at times to navigate through this place.  Still, they have plenty of tables and a decent amount of space at the bar.  The decor is great, with nice earthy tones, dark wooden tables, and hanging lights.  The staff has been incredibly friendly and our food came out reasonably quickly.  Prices are very reasonable as well, with most of the dinners at $11-16.  It does tend to get a little loud in there when it's crowded, and don't even get my started about that tiny parking lot.  But don't let those things deter you.  Now, onto the food -  Fried chicken: I'm not  going to lie, it is pretty  amazing.  The batter is crispy and perfectly seasoned, and the chicken is moist and flavorful.  The second time I had it, it wasn't quite as good and was a whole lot spicier than the first time.  I imagine maybe it was an off day. (4.5/5)   Prohibited Burger: the patty itself was pretty good, and the meat tasted higher quality than standard beef.  The brioche bun was good as well.  I was quite excited about the concept of the bacon marmalade, but it ended up being a little too sweet for my taste.  I don't know why I'm surprised, since it IS marmalade.  Still, overall it wasn't bad, and if I'd been in the mood for that sort of thing, I might have liked it more.  (3.5/5)  Fannie Flag: I loved the batter, but the tomatoes were a little too vinegary for my taste.  The sweetness of them grew on me after a while, and I liked them with the boom boom sauce.  (3.5/5)  Zucchini Fries:  THE MOST AMAZING THING ON THIS MENU!!!!  These might be my favorite fried veggies anywhere.  The batter is very crisp and flavorful, and they are cooked so perfectly with just a little bit of crispness in the middle.  I could make a whole meal out of these.  (5/5)  Cheese grits:  Pretty good, and plenty of yummy cheese.  Not my favorite grits, but they're pretty solid.  (4/5)  Mac-n-cheese:  I give them mad props for having an original dish.  It's more like a parmesan and garlic macaroni dish, which was pretty good.  (4/5)  Toffee Tollhouse:  Really, can you go wrong with a big cookie topped with ice cream?  Definitely not here!  I loved the blondie, which was soft and buttery delicious.  The caramel drizzle was a perfect addition.  (4.5/5)  J.D.'s bread pudding:  After it cooled a few minutes, I really enjoyed it.  It had a great balance of sweetness and I loved the sauce.  (4/5)  I can see myself coming here pretty often.  I'm so glad to have great Southern cooking close to my neighborhood.

9z8wEDijfQxmqLE9IsRV3w.text: OH MY GAWDDDDDD!!!!!  Go for brunch or regret all your life choices.  I went on Sunday with three of my friends and I couldn't decide who's meal was better because everything we ordered was fantastic. Even the coffee was above the cut. I had a chicken biscuit that made Chick-fil-a taste like crap. (and I LOVE chick-fil-a) The bacon was crispy and thick, defying all  logic, I know. Anyway, the real reason I'm even writing this review is the cheese grits.  Let me say this again GET THE CHEESE GRITS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I left the restaurant in the cheese grit euphoria... unlike food high I've ever had. My friend and I were having an overall tough weekend and we both agreed no matter what happen for the rest of the day, nothing could bring us down from this grit could 9.   The bathrooms are individuals, which I like. No listening to other people's convo's while you do your business.    They have outside seating and a FULL BAR.  If you're a panther fan, they have a super signed hemet behind the bar!

photos.caption: Photo of Leroy Fox Cotswold - Charlotte, NC, United States

QeLobUwiUfcrDUEXjEuxLg.text: I asked our server what sides were good and she said the cheese grits were good. Big disappointment! Being a southern girl, I love my grits, I know grits. But Leroy Fox needs grits 101. They lacked flavor and they were lumpy, not smooth and creamy.   The salmon with thehoney glaze was good but I was disappointed at the portion for the price. See the pic for the size.   I do like the atmosphere. I'm coming back in a few weeks for drinks with friends, so we'll see how it goes bit I'm definitely not getting the grits!

WGYU-XKgosx-1ygq37aiUw.text: We were seated at Leroy Fox and was immediately greeted by our server - so far so good.  She asked us what we would like to drink and the following ensued:     Server:  What can I get you two to drink? Danielle:  I'll have a water please. Evan:  I'll have a water also and what is the Sugar Creek Rotation today?   Server:  Oh, it's really good, I've had it before.   Evan:  Awesome, so what is it?   Server:   What does it taste like?  Umm..well...   Evan:  No, what is its name?  What is on rotation this month?   Server:  No, that's the name, it's called "Sugar Creek Rotation"!!    Evan:  Really (and at this time I was questioning myself for a minute...)?? Typically when you see the word "rotation" next to a beer it's to indicate that the draft selection is on rotation with that particular brewery. You know like seasonal beer?.   Server:  No, not this one.  This is its name.  Sugar Creek Rotation.     Evan:  Interesting, so what is the OMB Rotation below it??     Server:  OMB, well that's Olde Mecklenburg Brewery.     Evan:  I know what OMB is, but it appears that you have a rotational draft with OMB too or is it coincidence that OMB and Sugar Creek both have a beer called "rotation"?    Server:  Yeah, that is weird.     Evan:  So weird. So to be safe, I'll just have the Sugar Creek Pale Ale please.  And a water.     Water never came, but at least the food was good.  Will probably not go back and will only consider Leroy Fox as a carry-out option only in the future.

C-OwmIIe6_44_qqfVyiLFg.text: My husband and I use to be regulars. Excellent food and a great bar. But...we started having to eat late. If you go before 9 pm you might as well eat at Chuckie Cheese. The place is full of little kids running around while their parents drink.  So we stopped going for awhile. Months.  Tonight we decided to go back. Now I am disappointed because the quality of the food seems to have diminished. It is still good but not near as good as it was.   Now this will be just be a late night neighborhood bar.

wcClN26MiLAcnOslxb49Mg.text: Yummy Brussels! A little pricy for what it is. Enjoyable atmosphere and good service. Tried the chicken appetizer, good flavor and crispiness. Overall, enjoyed the dinner but felt like the check was just a little much for the quality of the food.

dGQahjeKfn1bYI3gj-2UsA.text: We were pretty underwhelmed with the food for dinner, especially for the price. We had been looking forward to trying Leroy Fox for a while. Would love to try again for brunch here though!

HnKRyutJe0TaU9Q3Mt6HmA.text: We went here for Sunday brunch. I was excited to check this out after hearing it's owned by the same folks that own cowbell and mortimers. The patio is a really cool atmosphere and it's neat that they have big screens mounted outside. We had the Zucchini fries and they were awesome! The eggs Benedict was also great and I liked that they used chuck Taylor roll instead of Canadian bacon to give it a little twist. The cucumber tomato salad was pretty good as well. The service was friendly but extremely slow. They didn't refill our drinks until we hunted them down. Not as attentive as I would like. Overall solid spot and I will be back next time I venture over that way!

M5Wno5kyqOrbsvshPhML3g.text: We love eating dinner here!  It is one of the best restaurants in Charlotte and it is a must-visit when we come into town!  The chicken fried chicken is amazing!

IUKtqN3SHeeXRrX2okv3pg.text: What can I say that hasn't already been said about Leroy Fox... Being a Cotswold resident, LF has become my local watering hole. It's also the only venue that I'll suggest for a "first Tinder date" (because the drinks are strong, and I know all exit routes, just in case...).   I've been to Leroy Fox for probably every type of dining or drinking experience possible... casual post-work happy hours, formal events, sit down dinners, business meetings, and the like. My favorite aspect of Leroy Fox is that it features an inviting, casual ambiance with a swagger that prevents it from feeling like a dive bar. It's the perfect blend of "business" and "party".   I've seen the same bartenders slinging drinks for years which is always a testament to them being paid and treated fairly. I am a stickler for Wednesday Sangria night, or trying a new cold beer on tap for Draft Night.  In addition to being a great place to get drinks, the food is sublime. Whoever thought of "fried zucchini fries" should be immortalized in a hall of fame. Those things are completely, utterly addictive. They even taste good the next day, if you've ever been guilty of ordering a full size portion, and get too tipsy off Copper to where you can't finish your food until you've sobered up the next morning (oops). Every single thing that I've consumed from LF has been delicious.  Give it a shot, get a spot on the patio on a warm summer night, and let's keep this place in business. Cotswold needs Leroy Fox to stay "cool" and "hip" in center city!!!

eg679_Px1ZXOZcQNeXa5Nw.text: The 2 stars are  for the service. This food is not good. I've got the prohibited burger and honestly I should have gone around the corner to smash burger this is not good at all. My girlfriend got the BBQ plate but I go to Mac's for that kind of stuff. The mac&chees is bland and the fries are bag fries. The best part of this meal was the pimento cheese app. Now the server's name is Holly and her and the hosted were wonderful but the food is just bland and tasteless. It's our first time and we won't be back but I wish them the best. As for Holly she's great so ask for her. The food though,

dH0chHNbIxEhaDIBkWC5rg.text: Perfect spot for lunch, busy but never a wait and the food is great! Buffalo chicken salad is my go to!

GLf9QTnQZiHGEPU1HqeopA.text: The dinner group had plans to visit Eddie's Place last night but Eddie's was jammed so we ended up here instead.  First off, it was half-price on specialty drinks but they were out of the Raspberry vodka for the Hotel Charlotte drink which is my first choice.  Bummer...so i opted for a second choice which probably wasn't as good.  It was a bit weak in the alcohol.  I guess 1/2 price means 1/2 the alcohol.  Some of the things we noticed as we were browsing the menu....This place is definitely southern with a lot of fried options...chicken and shrimp and zucchini to be exact.  Also, one of our group was on a restricted diet and couldn't do salt.  Your only salt-free options here are the salads.    Our table opted for the Zucchini fries as an appetizer and these were wonderful.  The trio of sauces were great especially the Boom Boom sauce.  Nice spice to it!  For my dinner, i ordered the Sweet Carolina Dip which contained Chicken slathered with that wonderful boom boom sauce and onions and served with chicken jus.   For a side, I ordered the mac n cheese.  The Sandwich was mostly bread which while tasty, I do like my sandwiches stuffed.  The mac n cheese was good and had a wonderful addition of pepper!  Desserts were ok...nothing special.  I had the toll house brownie which was quite rich but the ice cream cut the richness.  Service-wise, they were excellent.  For decor, the restaurant still has some of the old doors from the original Hotel Charlotte and I like that the drinks have local names.  The place was a bit loud between the music and the other patrons.  We were seated at a round table and I couldn't hear the person sitting across from me.  Overall, a decent place but with just a few flaws.

9fopNMK2giJmVh1gN-WRvw.text: I went here one Sunday afternoon I was not pleased with my experience the breakfast station or whatever it was was very dirty dishes piled high the food was way over priced for the taste everything was below average

tXa96Wv1KjOyDAbxtQATGQ.text: Walking into Leroy Fox, it has white washed wooden walls, it's lovely, it reminds me of JCT in Atlanta.  Nice people, everyone smiled and said hello.  I ordered a bloody mary and a shrimp po' boy.  My friend ordered a starter of pretzel bites.  The server said she didn't really like pretzels that much, but she loved these.  I hear ya sister.  When they arrived, they were little fried pretzel nuggets, with ranch, cheese dip and honey mustard for dipping.  I am a sucker for condiments.  Yay!!  Pretzels good.    My sandwich was a great size portion and the shrimp were fried and hot, my french fry barometer registered a "wicky, wicky woooooow."  So I was happy, the one thing that I was not pleased with was my $10 dollar bloody mary was supposed to have a shrimp garnish, I didn't get the shrimp skewer, so I was hoping I had a $5 bloody mary, but I still had a $10 on my check, WAH!!!!  I hate $10 cocktails in the daylight.  Day drinkin' should be a bargain.    They do have really cute American Apparel t shirts, (with Vixen, sly fox and Leroy fox) you can pick one up for $20. And they are garnished with a shrimp skewer!

k5uspGoD_w-SeE6g0bE7BA.text: Our first visit here meets with a mixed review. Our pretzel bite appetizer and my Leroy's lemonade were a good start. My husband ordered a beer and it was just dumped in the glass by the waitress, which left a huge foamy head. But I can chalk that up to inexperienced service. I ordered the Caroline Dip with cheese grits for dinner. The grits were creamy and perfect. My sandwich was pretty good, too. My husband ordered fried chicken with mac n cheese. He really liked the mac n cheese and corn muffin, but the chicken was super salty. We ordered a toll house brownie dessert to go and waited a good 20 minutes for our check. The manager did remove the chicken and dessert from our bill, and maybe the waitress was just inexperienced or having an off night. I still tipped 20%. I will give Leroy Fox another try because overall the food was good and fairly priced.  Tip: The restaurant is very family friendly, casual, and sports-friendly. It'd be a good place to watch a Panthers game.

xQkrf9yHo-tK0uMUbN89Ew.text: Food: I came here with a large group and started off with an assortment of pretzels/dips and fried green tomatoes. I wasn't a big fan of the pretzel dips but I did enjoy the novelty of the fried green tomatoes as I had never had them in my life. For my mail course I ordered the salmon filet with mac/cheese and seasonal vegetables. The salmon, veggies, and mac and cheese were all well cooked and not over/underdone, though I did feel hungry after the entree and thus ordered the berry tart w/ ice cream for dessert. I definitely enjoyed both my entree and dessert, but I wouldn't call them special in any way, except for the mac and cheese, which is more like "coils and cheese" which I definitely liked. It would take me too long to explain but I think a few patrons have posted pictures of the mac/cheese to illustrate that they use fancier pasta :-P.  Service: Because we were in such a large group, service took longer than expected for both the entree and dessert. That being said, they were very courteous, and I my water was refilled regularly.  Establishment: The establishment itself is PERFECT for sports fans. I came on a Sunday night and there were big-screen TVs everywhere with each of the NFL games on a different screen.  It was wonderful and if you hate your family, you can just stare at the TVs all night. It's also clean, comfortable, and great for groups. I didn't use their bathroom but it seems like the kind of place that would have a nice clean bathroom.  Conclusions: To summarize, this is a sports-bar + restaurant that makes simple, American food that won't wow you, but won't leave you disappointed.

d5_9jLK_MGw3FaYqkI2Dvw.text: I've been here several times, mostly for dinner and takeout, and I've been very impressed!  There is a cool vibe in Leroy Fox- neat decor and good music.  Food wise, I've gotten a couple different things and I've been happy with my selection every time. For appetizers, I'm a big fan of the Zucchini fries- lightly fried zucchini with Boom Boom sauce, which is a spicy creamy aioli type sauce. It's not great for takeout, but delicious at the restaurant. I also like their Fried Green Tomatoes, which has some sort of goat cheese in between in tomato which leaves a nice flavor variety with the saltiness of the fried tomato and the intensity of the goat cheese. Most of the time, I get the Elizabeth to eat, which is their chicken tenders with a side. If you like spicy, I highly recommend the Nashville style, which gives it a hot and spicy fried taste. I've been to Nashville and I would say that it's on par with what I've had there. The sides are great as well, the Cajun Fries and the Cheesy grits are my personal favorites. They have a large variety of sides which is much appreciated when you want something different.  The service is also pretty good. I have had some trips where it's a little slow, but overall the wait staff is friendly.  The only downside is that I wasn't overly impressed with their brunch, but I'll have to give it another try.  Great spot in Cotswold to enjoy some fried chicken!

O0Dlg628FjHIDekigzu9Ow.text: So I had the burger burger burger, great bbq flavor and Smokey taste to it. Also had the crab dip, it was good, decent whiskey drink, service was a bit slow and it wasn't even busy. I would say i would comeback. Maybe better service?

l8DouiTdy1Ie_gapGaJ7Qg.text: There are two things I take very seriously: fried chicken and brunch.  I am happy to say that Leroy Fox gets both of these things very right.  I highly recommend their "world famous" fried chicken.  The meat is juicy, the batter is perfectly seasoned and the portions are large.  Roll up your sleeves, ask for extra napkins and dig into some of the best fried chicken you've had with one of their awesome sides.  I love the green bean casserole.  If brunch is your thing, this needs to be your place.  Remember that fried chicken I spoke of?  It comes on top of a waffle.  Enough said.  There are other amazing options such as omelets and breakfast sandwiches as well.  The hashbrown casserole is slap-your-momma amazing.    The only thing I have had at Leroy Fox's that I didn't love was the sweet potato tots, as they are rolled in cinnamon and sugar.  But hey, that's personal preference.

8HSX7gXrIZKxZsyW4aggGw.text: Leroy Fox is a little out of my stomping ground, but the fella and I made a point to try it one Sunday morning for brunch. They don't open til 10:00, so I was a little bit gnawing my arm off, but it was worth it.  As we walked up, I noticed how cozy the outside patio looked. It was too cold to sit out there, but I made a mental note for a future trip. There are heaters around and a TV, and it looked like a nice place to hang out. Inside wasn't anything like what I expected, but I loved the old Hotel Charlotte doors with the bar that runs the length of the restaurant, and the booths that sit up a little bit with a window overlooking the tables.  I was hoping for a few lighter choices on the brunch menu (I know, I know), but I went with the make-your-own omelet. The fella noted that he's never seen me order an omelet - because I feel like the innards are never that great - but this one was decadent. I ordered ham, bacon, red peppers, and cheddar cheese, and I couldn't stop eating it! The fella got Which Came First (this place loves its chicken), and he loved it. The side of grits were good, but he said they needed just a smidgen more seasoning.  There were a few, tiny service mistakes - we got the dinner menus when we sat down, and we got two coffees and a water instead of two waters and a coffee - but our waitress was so apologetic and sweet that I didn't even mind.  By the time we left around 11:00, the place was hopping! This place may be off our beaten path, but I think we'll have to adjust our beaten path again pretty soon.

UVYxAJY6L6mmMn7EdCgGlg.text: I was really excited to try some southern fried chicken and sides and went to Leroy Fox with a group from work for dinner. The service was wonderful, the appetizers tasty but the mixed drinks were sent back, totally watered down and tasteless, and the famous fried chicken was sub par. The mac-n-cheese was delicious and easily the most enjoyable part of my meal. I plan to give it another chance, with my husband and dog (dog friendly patio!) for brunch to give it one more chance.

_ud0pHvRpty0z6yUIURDYw.text: Found this place on Yelp yesterday and we tried it last night for dinner. Great food, great service, good prices! We will definitely be back!

NNe1wBpVtocJSmxryuJyGg.text: I went back on Valentine's Day with my kids.  The place has gone from bad to WORSE.  The DELICIOUS macaroni and cheese we had the first visit had either gone bad or had been changed.  The server took it back to the kitchen where they tried it and determined "something definitely wasn't right."  The zucchini fries that were the BOMB had been changed--they were nice and thin, but this version came out, not as fries, but as large pieces of zucchini that had been dipped in batter, crunchy on the inside.  Such a disappointment.  One other suggestion:  since this is a family place and kids typically prefer blander food, they really should revamp the kid's chicken tenders.  WAAAAAY too much pepper and spice for most kids.    I'm so bummed.  This place is convenient and has potential a neighborhood go-to spot.  But they've got a LOT of kinks left to work out.

g52Y0vu_B1z8QN1PYF9SZQ.text: I had dinner at Leroy Fox tonight.  This site used to house the old Hotel Charlotte.  The rennovation was very impressive.  The restaurant was very nice and it was good to see that they had incorporated parts of the old restaurant into the decor of the new restaurant.  The restaurant was packed solid.  The noise level was probably the most negative aspect of the experience.  In addition to the already deafening noise level, live music started up and it soon became impossible to hear the conversation at our table.  I had the "north" chicken which consisted of a breast and a wing.  It was fried and was quite good.  The chicken comes with a choice of a side item.  The menu looked quite good.  The service was also good, but I believe the kitchen got backed up with orders since the restaurant was full.  I wouldn't recommend going to this restaurant, if you have hopes of having normal conversation with the people at your table.

PfYjQbK8WyiXquw1yxrRjw.text: So, I guess I am a glutton for punishment.  Tried Leroy Fox again.  I have several issues -   1.  If you change your menu items but still hand out the old menu, at least have your waitstaff inform you when ordering of the change.  Hubster ordered the double breast dinner (he says breast always come in two - yeah right!) but when his dinner arrived there was only one.  We asked our waiter about it and he shrugged and said they were losing money on the two chicken breast dinner so now they only serve one breast.  That is fine but a heads-up would have been nice. 2.   If you advertise 1/2 priced wine on Mondays which has become the norm, you really should clarify that is by glass only.  We got all excited about the $30 wines on the menu (all wines are $30) that we could try for 1/2 price only to be informed the 1/2 price was only good for glasses, not the bottle.  Again, meh ok - kinda picky but whatever. 3.   The last issue is really not the fault of the restaurant.  Parents - the outside patio is not McDonald Land - don't let your kids run around on the patio so that waitstaff who are carrying glassware and hot plates have to dodge your rugrats.  Just because you choose to sit outside does not mean you don't keep your kids at their table.  I love kids but not when they are left on their own to find some source of entertainment while you sip your wine and converse with your friends.    Ok - enough venting.  Probably will not go back based on the lackluster menu - too much chicken - although zucchini is awesome.

LLseOCl2wGEOWY1xPxw3dA.text: Great vibe, especially for the area.  A welcome addition to the dining and drinking scene in CLT.  They are dong a great job.  More places n town should learn from them.

eqD5Z6pKEYrdGAEmfQgnGQ.text: Went on a Saturday afternoon. Food was great! I had the wings with mac n cheese. The mac and cheese was creamy with white cheese and the wings were fried and lathered with sauce just right!  Service was a tad slow considering there weren't a lot of people in there but still a delicious meal!! Also, you wouldn't know from the outside but the inside is very classy and appealing not your typical hole in the wall bar.

CqE0x3LwCDS1UI0mPC77Tg.text: Went here for brunch service but it took so long to get our drinks that we were afraid to wait for food

zkMC4XGMgxMGZVwR_qoznA.text: Leroy Fox (no relation!) is a recent addition to the Cotswold dining scene, occupying the space which previously housed Hotel Charlotte. The focus here is on chicken and from the above fried chicken salad, Leroy Fox has their chicken recipe spot-on. I also tried the shrimp wrap, which included chopped tiger shrimp and bacon. To me the bacon overpowered the shrimp a bit too much but it was delicious nevertheless and the zucchini fries are really something to try. For dessert I tried the tasty brownie sundae with ice cream - a great choice for sharing. I look forward to coming back soon for the whole pieces of fried chicken. Leroy Fox also offers a kids menu and a gluten free menu. They are open late, serve brunch on Sunday beginning at 10 AM, offer live music Thursday through Saturday nights and have wine, beer and cocktails including special brunch cocktails.

rzuS8nhVuKAj3rnATKCZSw.text: Love the omelete bar at the Sunday brunch.  Its best to get there before 11:30 and beat the crowd.  The large selection at the omlete bar is awesome.  My favorite is the western.

T3eLsDu8AdqUmJWT-jrcaA.text: I just had one of the most disappointing meals in my 17 years living in Charlotte. To be fair, my family has gone to Leroy's every Sunday for the past four weeks so I could get their Shrimp Cobb Salad (with the shrimp blackened).  While a bit on the pricey side ($15), it's been something I have looked forward to as a way to end the weekend. Tonight, however, ruined it for me. Not only did my order come out incorrect (I have never sent a meal back in my life), but it took over 10 minutes to get someone's attention to point out the error. My entire family, who I insisted begin eating, were practically finished with their meals by the time I was able to point out the error. The server offered to bring out the shrimp cooked correctly, but at this point I just wanted to eat. The correct shrimp never found its way to our table. Again, to be fair, they didn't charge me for the salad but it didn't make up for such a poor experience. I still spent a great deal of money for the one appetizer and three entrees I bought for my wife and two kids, and I don't feel Leroy's did an adequate job of making such a poor experience right. The manager cleared our table so I voiced my frustration and let her we were regular patrons. While she was somewhat apologetic, I still don't feel we received the proper acknowledgement of the issue or poor dining experience.  It was so bad, I can say with confidence we have had our last meal at Leroy Fox's

k9LtsUScRNdA1db80x0sdQ.text: Off to a good start. Loved the zucchini fries with the 3 sauces. Fried chicken moist with a nice crunchy crust. Looks like a good bar crowd.

KDJJtDsFKlarIk4IWuWZtg.text: Popped in for a drink to celebrate my friends b-day.  Everyone here was friendly and the service was speedy.  The interior is very inviting and comfortable.  It was a Friday night so the place was pretty busy and noisy but the vibe was upbeat and exciting.  Everyone that ordered food raved about their dishes.  All and all two thumbs way up!  I can't wait for them to open the patio space out front!

ZFw-AYydDCWaWEmPx5rqrQ.text: This is my 3rd visit and I have to say it has been terrible every time. Tonight the service was the worst, i. Will not be back.

4Greiapx3wJ8UrgBWEWPOg.text: I'm at a loss to attempt to stay positive about our dining experience at Leroy Fox.  We spent the better part of a half of a ball game waiting for our order with little apparent concern for the delay. They either are suffering from now enough kitchen help or waiters.the best I would rate the overall quality as a two.

kG4ydxlQwKt-qUeAxc80BQ.text: Let me just start by saying this is my first review ever.  I am very easy to please and eat just about anything.  It was also the first time I have ever complained about food to a server.  Parts of the meal were fair.  The fries were inedible: chewy and cold.  I told the server and he said he would "bring us a fresh batch".  Never got them and no mention when he brought the check.  An $80 meal for 4...could have gotten better at nearby fast food and for much cheaper.  We will not be returning anytime soon.  Unfortunate since we live in the neighborhood.

9NqGikdPEn7_s-_c8klKQw.text: We have been to Leroy Fox several times and our most recent visit was a couple nights ago.  We were seated quickly upon arrival and the server took our drink order right away. It was fairly crowded for a Tuesday night.  The place has a comfortable feel. There are booths, tables, and you can sit at the bar. Behind the bar are many TVs.  My wife and mother-in-law ordered the fried chicken.  I had the chicken fried steak and my son had the BBQ sandwich and my daughter had the mac and cheese. A couple, pieces of the fried chicken were not cooked thoroughly so we sent it back. Two entire meals were returned to us and they comped our desserts.  They handled the situation perfectly. Things can happen once in a while anywhere but the way it is handled is what counts the most and Leroy Fox knows customer service better than most. The food was very good. My daughter loves the mac and cheeses and my chicken steak was delicious.  The asparagus and fries are also good. The desserts were tasty too.  The food, service and ambiance are all reasons to return to the Fox.  It is a good value too.

QO7yWfu2u5evBwBwomOh-Q.text: Amazing comfort food! The BBQ chicken sandwich, the burger, the 'Caroline' chicken french dip style sandwich, all great. Nice atmosphere, reasonable prices and a great staff, ask for a bartender called 'Goat'

sUc9743jIGkeTtwbYZQdEg.text: Mixed bag for us tonight at Leroy Fox. I had the Po-Boy w/ zucchini fried, my wife had the North fired chicken w/ mac & cheese, my son had sliders w/ fries and my daughter had kids mac & cheese w/ fries.  Starter: shrimp cocktail - interesting take, shrimp was fat and incredibly good, well cooked and very slightly seasoned. The remoulade replacement for cocktail sauce was a tasty and clever and pleasant surprise: I really liked it.  Sliders - they were fine. Not newsworthy, but fine. Came with fries, and they're pretty good - crispy and tasty.  Mac & Cheese - the most boring mac & cheese I have ever tasted. Creamy, bland, a little overcooked. Just blah. Salt didn't fix it - the cheese was utterly flavorless. Fix that. How hard can mac & cheese be, people?  Chicken - like most popular fried chicken, it's always way too much about the sear and crunch, never enough about the flavor of the chicken. Look at it this way, chef: if I like it off the barbecue or out of the broiler, sans breading, it's well made and flavorful. Make flavor happen AND good breading, you win business. This chicken was as bland as the mac & cheese: Great breading and crunch, but yawn. My wife got the mac & cheese too. Oops. Strike two.  Po Boy - NICE! Shrimp was fresh, sweet, perfectly cooked, and flavorful (note - whatever you did to the shrimp, which was breaded and fried, do that to the chicken). Sauce was simple and lovely, not too spicy and oddly tart, maybe a little extra lemon. Bread was fine, Lettuce was fresh. Tomatoes were good. Too many onions, but hey: take e'm off. This was the winner of the night. Zucchini fries - also nice! Breading was again a winner, and the zucchini wasn't overcooked: it didn't snap, but it didn't squish. I rather liked it.  So: deep fried and breaded stuff with hit and miss flavors for whatever food was encased and featured. Presentation was mom's house, but I don't care. Room is a little tight and busy, and MAN is it noisy. Family land: great for kids and families in the early evening when we showed up. Service was clumsy and irregular but always extremely polite and eager to help. Price was a great surprise - seems very reasonable. No wasted time on 75 exotic beer selections: a couple popular crafts, the regular stuff, fair prices on mixed drinks - smart to focus on the cuisine, even though it needs some maturity. I need 125 beers to choose from I'll go to Taco Mac (and starve to death rather than eat the tripe they serve) or the Saucer.  So: grow up a little bit, cover your seasoning skills under the batter and be flexible, keep that oddball attitude among your staff (kinda like the Pizza Peel; friendly and aloof and always willing to make you happy) and this tight little room could be a serious contender for my money.

02mFTqPWzCa4wFzDszdfsg.text: Very good brunch on Sundays. Didn't have a reservation so had to wait a while, make a reservation if you can. Parking is limited in a small lot. Service was a bit slow but the place was packed.
